analyzed: dgag dbye byas pa nyid kho na yin pas yang gzod dgag dbye bya mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the same for the Buddha, for the purification of the field is accomplished by the Buddha himself.

original: de la snga ma'am 'di'i rnam pa de lta ba cung zad kyang med do zhes zer na brdzun nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bsnyen pa de la snga ma zhes bya ba gzhag pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i de'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ba'am /
analyzed: de la snga ma'am 'di'i rnam pa de lta ba cung zad kyang med do zhes zer na brdzun nyid do zhes bya ba ni / sngar bstan ma thag pa'i bsnyen pa de la snga ma zhes bya ba gzhag pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i de'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ba'am /
translated: If one says that the former or the latter does not exist in the least, it is a lie.

original: 'di zhes bya ba gzhag pa zhes bya ba phyis bstan pa 'di'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer na bsnyon pa'i yul de la gzhag pa dang gzhag pa'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ba de ni
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba gzhag pa zhes bya ba phyis bstan pa 'di'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer na bsnyon pa'i yul de la gzhag pa dang gzhag pa'i rnam pa de lta bu cung zad kyang med do zhes zer ba de ni
translated: If one says that the former, which is the one just explained, does not exist in the least, or that the latter, which is the one that will be explained, does not exist in the least,

original: brdzun nyid yin te /
analyzed: brdzun nyid yin te /
translated: then it is a lie, for the object of the accusation does not exist in the least in the form of the former or the latter.

original: log pa nyid dang brdzun smra ba'i kha na mtho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log pa nyid dang brdzun smra ba'i kha na mtho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they are the agents of the misdeed of lying and of the downfall of schism.🔽If monks who are quarrelsome come to the place

original: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar 'gyur zhing thos par gyur nas /
analyzed: gal te gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar 'gyur zhing thos par gyur nas /
translated: where monks who have entered the rains retreat hear of them,

original: gal te gso sbyong gnyis sam gsum thal bar gyur na dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong dag gis rang gi gnas der dgag dbye byed pa'i dus su gnas gzhan nas dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te gso sbyong gnyis sam gsum thal bar gyur na dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gal te dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong dag gis rang gi gnas der dgag dbye byed pa'i dus su gnas gzhan nas dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: if two or three poṣadhas have passed, the lifting of the restrictions should be done.🔽If monks who have entered the rains retreat in a certain place hear that monks who are quarrelsome are coming to that place at the time when the lifting of restrictions is to be done,

original: de dag 'ongs nas bdag cag gis dgag dbye byas pa'i tshe de dag 'thab krol byed par 'gyur ba thos par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag 'ongs nas bdag cag gis dgag dbye byas pa'i tshe de dag 'thab krol byed par 'gyur ba thos par gyur na /
translated: and if, when they have come, they create quarrels when the lifting of restrictions is done,

original: gal te ngas par khas blangs pa de dag gis gnas der gnas par khas blangs pa tshun chad du gso sbyong lan gnyis sam gsum byas shing thal bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ngas par khas blangs pa de dag gis gnas der gnas par khas blangs pa tshun chad du gso sbyong lan gnyis sam gsum byas shing thal bar gyur na /
translated: If two or three poṣadhas are performed in that monastery until those who have accepted the invitation leave,

original: de'i tshe de dag gis dgag dbye'i dus la ma bab kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag gis dgag dbye'i dus la ma bab kyang rung ste /
translated: then even though the time for the invitation ceremony has not arrived,

original: ci nas kyang dge slong 'thab krol byed pa de dag gnas der ma 'ongs pa'i mdun rol du zla ba nya shi gcig gi dus dang sbyar te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang dge slong 'thab krol byed pa de dag gnas der ma 'ongs pa'i mdun rol du zla ba nya shi gcig gi dus dang sbyar te /
translated: the invitation ceremony should be performed in advance, before those quarreling bhikṣus arrive, in accordance with the time of the full moon.

original: dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: gnyis thal bar gyur na zhes smos pas ni phyed byas pa nyid bstan la /
analyzed: gnyis thal bar gyur na zhes smos pas ni phyed byas pa nyid bstan la /
translated: The phrase “if two or three have arrived” indicates that the ceremony is performed if half the saṅgha is present.

original: gsum thal bar gyur na zhes smos pas ni phal cher byas pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: gsum thal bar gyur na zhes smos pas ni phal cher byas pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: The phrase “if three or more have arrived” indicates that the ceremony is performed if the majority of the saṅgha is present.

original: thams cad la yang phyed byas pa ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes 'jig rten pa'i grags pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad la yang phyed byas pa ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes 'jig rten pa'i grags pa yin la /
translated: In the world, it is well known that if half the saṅgha is present, the ceremony is performed.

original: phal cher byas pa ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes 'phags pa'i grags pa yin pas /
analyzed: phal cher byas pa ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes 'phags pa'i grags pa yin pas /
translated: It is well known to the āryas that if the majority of the saṅgha is present, the ceremony is performed.
Here,

original: yang gso sbyong lan gnyis byas pas ni dbyar gnas pa byas pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: yang gso sbyong lan gnyis byas pas ni dbyar gnas pa byas pa nyid yin pas /
translated: since the purification and restoration is performed twice, the rainy season retreat is performed.

original: 'jig rten pa'i grags pas grags pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i grags pas grags pa nyid yin la /
translated: Since it is renowned in the world, it is renowned.

original: gso sbyong lan gsum byas pas ni dbyar gnas par byas pa nyid yin par 'phags pa'i grags pas grags pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gso sbyong lan gsum byas pas ni dbyar gnas par byas pa nyid yin par 'phags pa'i grags pas grags pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the purification and restoration is performed three times, the rainy season retreat is performed. Since it is renowned among the noble ones, it is renowned.

original: rkyen de lta bu'i dbang gis dus de tsam gyis dgag dbye byas na yang dbyar gnas pa'i yon tan dang dgag dbye'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu'i dbang gis dus de tsam gyis dgag dbye byas na yang dbyar gnas pa'i yon tan dang dgag dbye'i yon tan thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the lifting of restrictions is performed in that time due to such conditions, the qualities of the rainy season retreat and the qualities of the lifting of restrictions are obtained.

original: dgag dbye ni tshes bco lnga la bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: dgag dbye ni tshes bco lnga la bya ba yin pas /
translated: The lifting of restrictions is performed on the fifteenth day.

original: 'dir yang tshes bco lnga la ltos par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshes bco lnga la ltos par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, here it should be done in relation to the fifteenth day.

original: tshes bco lnga smos pas bcu bzhi yang bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: tshes bco lnga smos pas bcu bzhi yang bzung ba yin te /
translated: By mentioning the fifteenth day, the fourteenth is also included.

original: de nyid bco lnga yin no zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bco lnga yin no zhes sngar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was previously taught that that is the fifteenth.

original: ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa lnga'am drug tu blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa lnga'am drug tu blo mthun par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not accomplished, the five or six mandala members should be in agreement.

original: gal te sngar bstan pa'i thabs des sam /
analyzed: gal te sngar bstan pa'i thabs des sam /
translated: If the monks are unable to do the invitation ceremony in the way that has been taught above, or

original: bar chad kyi rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis dgag dbye de ltar bya bar ma grub pa'i skabs su dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag der lhags par gyur na /
analyzed: bar chad kyi rkyen gzhan gyi dbang gis dgag dbye de ltar bya bar ma grub pa'i skabs su dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag der lhags par gyur na /
translated: if they are unable to do it because of other conditions that are obstacles, and if quarrelsome monks come there,

original: gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dgag dbye byed pa'i tshe dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams lnga'am drug tu blo mthun par bya zhing dgag dbye so sor bya'o //
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pa de dag dgag dbye byed pa'i tshe dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams lnga'am drug tu blo mthun par bya zhing dgag dbye so sor bya'o //
translated: then those who have agreed to stay should do the invitation ceremony in five or six groups, each group doing it separately.

original: ngag gis bshes pa'i tshig gis bsus nas lhung bzed dang chos gos blang par bya'o //
analyzed: ngag gis bshes pa'i tshig gis bsus nas lhung bzed dang chos gos blang par bya'o //
translated: They should greet each other with words of friendship and then take up their bowls and robes.

original: gnas khang dang khyams dang khang pa brtseg pa dag bsko bar bya /
analyzed: gnas khang dang khyams dang khang pa brtseg pa dag bsko bar bya /
translated: They should assign living quarters, courtyards, and multi-storied buildings.

original: khrus dang snum bag gi rnyed pa bstabs par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus dang snum bag gi rnyed pa bstabs par bya'o //
translated: They should provide bathing facilities and oil for the feet.

original: chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya zhing de lta bu'i mgu bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya zhing de lta bu'i mgu bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should give teachings and do whatever else will please them.

original: dgag dbye ma byas pa'i skabs nges 'thab krol ba dag 'ongs na de dag la ngag gis bshes pa'i tshig gis bsus nas lhung bzed dang chos gos blang bar bya /
analyzed: dgag dbye ma byas pa'i skabs nges 'thab krol ba dag 'ongs na de dag la ngag gis bshes pa'i tshig gis bsus nas lhung bzed dang chos gos blang bar bya /
translated: If, when the invitation has not been performed, some people who are fighting come, one should receive them with words of welcome.

original: gnas khang dang khyims dang khang pa brtseg pa dag bsko bar bya /
analyzed: gnas khang dang khyims dang khang pa brtseg pa dag bsko bar bya /
translated: One should show them the dwelling place, the monastery, and the multi-storied building.

original: khrus dang snum bag gi rnyed pa bstabs par bya'o //
analyzed: khrus dang snum bag gi rnyed pa bstabs par bya'o //
translated: One should offer them bathing and oil massage.

original: chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya zhing de lta bu la sogs pa'i gcam gsag mgu bar 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba gzhan de dag kyang bya'o //🔽bdag nyid kyi dngos por ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa dag tu gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa sbyin par bya zhing de lta bu la sogs pa'i gcam gsag mgu bar 'gyur ba'i sbyor ba gzhan de dag kyang bya'o // bdag nyid kyi dngos por ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa dag tu gso sbyong bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should give them the gift of listening to the Dharma, and one should do other such things that are the means of pleasing them.🔽If one does not have the means, one should perform the Poṣadha in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: de ltar byas kyang gal te bdag nyid dang mthun pa'i dngos por ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa dag tu gso spyod bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang gal te bdag nyid dang mthun pa'i dngos por ma grub na dkyil 'khor pa dag tu gso spyod bya'o //
translated: If, even though one has done that, one does not have the means to do it, one should perform the Poṣadha in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: 'o na deng khyod kyis dgag dbye ma yin nam zhes zer ba dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag sdod cig @151b khyed cag glo bur du lhags pa yin gyis don 'di ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'o na deng khyod kyis dgag dbye ma yin nam zhes zer ba dag la tshe dang ldan pa dag sdod cig @151b khyed cag glo bur du lhags pa yin gyis don 'di ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba
translated: you should reply, Venerables, please wait. This is a matter for the permanent residents.

original: ni / gal te 'thab krol byed pa dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: ni / gal te 'thab krol byed pa dag 'di skad ces /
translated: If those who are quarreling say,

original: 'o na khyed cag deng dgag dbye yin na ci'i phyir gso sbyong byed ces zer na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed cag deng dgag dbye yin na ci'i phyir gso sbyong byed ces zer na /
translated: But today you are performing the lifting of restrictions, why are you performing the poṣadha?🔽 If they quarrel in this way, the permanent residents should say to them, Venerables, please wait.

original: de skad zer pa'i 'thab krol byed na de dag la gnyug mar gnas pa de dag gis 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag sdod cig / khyed cag ni glo bur du lhags pa yin pas /
analyzed: de skad zer pa'i 'thab krol byed na de dag la gnyug mar gnas pa de dag gis 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag sdod cig / khyed cag ni glo bur du lhags pa yin pas /
translated: You are visitors.

original: glo bur du lhags pa rnams kyis don 'di bsam mi dgos so //
analyzed: glo bur du lhags pa rnams kyis don 'di bsam mi dgos so //
translated: Visitors do not need to consider this matter.

original: don 'di ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis yin pas deng dgag dbye byed dam sang ngam nyi ma gzhan la byed pa de ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis bsam pa yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: don 'di ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis yin pas deng dgag dbye byed dam sang ngam nyi ma gzhan la byed pa de ni gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis bsam pa yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: The answer is: This is the business of the resident monks. Whether the Invitation is held today, tomorrow, or on another day, it is the business of the resident monks.

original: dong ba dag na dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dong ba dag na dgag dbye bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Invitation should be held when they have left.

original: 'thab krol byed pa de dag gnas de nas dong ba'i 'og tu gso sbyong gi dus su dgag dbye bya ste /
analyzed: 'thab krol byed pa de dag gnas de nas dong ba'i 'og tu gso sbyong gi dus su dgag dbye bya ste /
translated: When they have left means that after those who are quarreling have left that place, the Invitation should be held on the Poṣadha day.

original: dgag dbye'i las 'di ni gso sbyong dang rigs mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i las 'di ni gso sbyong dang rigs mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this procedure for the Invitation is of the same kind as the Poṣadha.

original: dgag dbye'i gzhi'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i gzhi'o zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: This is the explanation of the basis of the Invitation.

original: // / da ni dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Now, the miscellaneous topics connected with the basis of the Invitation will be summarized.

original: de'i phyir nang dang bcas pas bzod pa ma byas par dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nang dang bcas pas bzod pa ma byas par dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: The Invitation should not be held without the consent of those who are present.

original: zhe 'gras pa dang bcas pa dag gis phan tshun bzod pa ma byas par gya tshom du dgag dbye mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa dang bcas pa dag gis phan tshun bzod pa ma byas par gya tshom du dgag dbye mi bya'o //
translated: Those who are hostile should not be dismissed without mutual forbearance.

original: zhag bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis de 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid na de'i dus yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis de 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid na de'i dus yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The time for forbearance is when it will occur in ten days or a half month.

original: zhag bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis dgag dbye de 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid na bzod pa bya ba de'i dus yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu 'am zla ba phyed kyis dgag dbye de 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid na bzod pa bya ba de'i dus yin pa'o //
translated: The time for forbearance is when that dismissal will occur in ten days or a half month.

original: kha cig las ni bdun nam brgyad na zhe'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las ni bdun nam brgyad na zhe'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say: in seven or eight days.

original: gzhung kha cig las ni zhag bdun nam brgyad na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid ni bzod pa bya ba de'i dus yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni zhag bdun nam brgyad na dgag dbye 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid ni bzod pa bya ba de'i dus yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some texts say: The time for forbearance is when that dismissal will occur in seven or eight days.

original: 'dus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽de'i dus zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dus pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni / de'i dus zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: But not for an assembly.🔽The time for forbearance is not for an assembly.🔽Because a scripture declares:

original: 'di ltar lung las dgag dbye'i don du 'dus pa ni bzod pa bya ba de'i dus ma yin no zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar lung las dgag dbye'i don du 'dus pa ni bzod pa bya ba de'i dus ma yin no zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: The time for forbearance is not for an assembly for the sake of dismissing.

original: 'on kyang 'dus pa thams cad kyang de'i dus su mi rung ste /🔽'di ltar bzod par bya bas kyang der sems gtod par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dus pa thams cad kyang de'i dus su mi rung ste / 'di ltar bzod par bya bas kyang der sems gtod par mi nus la /
translated: However, all the assemblies are not suitable at that time.🔽Thus, one who is to be patient is not able to direct the mind there.

original: bzod pa byed pa'i sems kyang skyabs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir @152a * //
analyzed: bzod pa byed pa'i sems kyang skyabs par 'gyur bas de'i phyir @152a * //
translated: And the mind that is to be patient is not able to protect. Therefore,

original: 'dir bye brag med par mdor bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dir bye brag med par mdor bsdus so //
translated: here, without distinction, it is summarized.

original: des bzod pa ma byas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bzod pa ma byas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By that, without having been patient, one should not do the invitation ceremony.

original: nang dang bcas pa des bzod ba ma byas par dgag dbye mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang dang bcas pa des bzod ba ma byas par dgag dbye mi bya ba'o //
translated: By that refers to the internal and external. Without having been patient, one should not do the invitation ceremony.

original: de'i tshe 'dus pa thams cad kyis phan tshun kun dga' bar ma byas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dus pa thams cad kyis phan tshun kun dga' bar ma byas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At that time, all the assemblies should not do it without having made mutual rejoicing.

original: dgag dbye'i dus de'i tshe gnas der 'dus pa'i dge slong thams cad kyis phyag la sogs pas phan tshun kun dga' bar ma byas par 'phral la gya tshom du dgag dbye mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i dus de'i tshe gnas der 'dus pa'i dge slong thams cad kyis phyag la sogs pas phan tshun kun dga' bar ma byas par 'phral la gya tshom du dgag dbye mi bya'o //
translated: At the time of the invitation ceremony, all the monks assembled in that place should not suddenly and haphazardly do the invitation ceremony without having made mutual rejoicing by prostrations and so forth.

original: gshe ba la bzod pa mi gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gshe ba la bzod pa mi gsol bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not do the invitation ceremony without requesting forbearance for abuse.

original: dgag dbye'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dus gzhan gyi tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i dus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi dus gzhan gyi tshe yang ngo //
translated: Not only at the time of the invitation ceremony, but also at other times.

original: 'di ni gnod pa byed pa'i 'khon du 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gnod pa byed pa'i 'khon du 'dzin pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to give up the resentment that causes harm.

original: dge slong mas dge slong la gnas kyi phyi rol du bzod pa gsol bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong la gnas kyi phyi rol du bzod pa gsol bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A nun should not ask a monk for forgiveness outside the monastery.

original: dge slong gis gnas kyi nang du bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis gnas kyi nang du bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
translated: A monk should ask for forgiveness inside the monastery.

original: rkang pa gnyis la phyag byas te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis la phyag byas te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: She should not do it by bowing at his feet.

original: dge slong mas dge slong la bzod pa gsol ba'i tshe na dge slong mas dge slong gi rkang pa gnyis la phyag byas te bzod pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong la bzod pa gsol ba'i tshe na dge slong mas dge slong gi rkang pa gnyis la phyag byas te bzod pa gsol bar mi bya'o //
translated: When a nun asks a monk for forgiveness, she should not ask for forgiveness by bowing at the feet of the monk.

original: 'di ni bzod pa mi blang du mi rung ba'i mgon du gnya' sgron pa'i sgyu thabs spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa mi blang du mi rung ba'i mgon du gnya' sgron pa'i sgyu thabs spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to give up the pretense of bowing down to the neck of the protector who is not fit to receive forgiveness.

original: bzod na phyag byas te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzod na phyag byas te 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he forgives her, she should go away after bowing to him.

original: dge slong gis bzod na dge slong mas dge slong gi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis bzod na dge slong mas dge slong gi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: If the monk consents, the nun should touch her head to the feet of the monk and leave.

original: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de la dge slong gis ma gus par byas te 'gro bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de la dge slong gis ma gus par byas te 'gro bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The monk should not disrespectfully leave the nun who is asking for forgiveness.”

original: dge slong ma bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de la dge slong gis ma gus pa byas te 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de la dge slong gis ma gus pa byas te 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: The monk should not disrespectfully leave the nun who is asking for forgiveness.

original: 'dul bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dul bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should not transgress her.”

original: dge slong ma bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de las dge slong gis 'da' bar mi bya ste /🔽bzod pa dang du blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma bzod pa gsol bar byed pa de las dge slong gis 'da' bar mi bya ste / bzod pa dang du blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The monk should not transgress the nun who is asking for forgiveness.🔽He should accept her forgiveness.

original: bzod par bya ba la sngar shes pa shad kyis spyod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzod par bya ba la sngar shes pa shad kyis spyod du gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should first understand the forgiveness and then make her act.”

original: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa'i gang zag gang gis gang zag gang la bzod pa gsol bar bya ba de la dum bu tshugs su 'phral la bzod pa gsol bar mi bya bar bzod pa gsol ba'i mdun rol du sngar gang zag shad kyis sbyong par byed pa'i
analyzed: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa'i gang zag gang gis gang zag gang la bzod pa gsol bar bya ba de la dum bu tshugs su 'phral la bzod pa gsol bar mi bya bar bzod pa gsol ba'i mdun rol du sngar gang zag shad kyis sbyong par byed pa'i
translated: The person who requests forbearance should not immediately request forbearance from the person from whom forbearance is to be requested, but should first make that person thoroughly understand the method of forbearance.

original: thabs shes pa gcig shad kyis spyod du bcug nas /
analyzed: thabs shes pa gcig shad kyis spyod du bcug nas /
translated: Having made him thoroughly understand the method of forbearance,

original: de'i 'og tu gzod rang gis bzod pa gsol @152b par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzod rang gis bzod pa gsol @152b par bya'o //
translated: he should then request forbearance.

original: 'di ni bzod pa gsol ba thams cad kyi skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa gsol ba thams cad kyi skabs yin no //
translated: This is the case for all requests for forbearance.

original: mi 'dod pa thabs btsal ba la mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thabs btsal ba la mi 'bad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be remiss in seeking the means of not wanting.

original: bzod pa gsol bar bya ba de bzod par mi 'dod na bzod pa gsol bar byed bas thabs gang gis des bzod par 'gyur ba'i thabs de yongs su btsal ba la mi 'bad par mi bya ste 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzod pa gsol bar bya ba de bzod par mi 'dod na bzod pa gsol bar byed bas thabs gang gis des bzod par 'gyur ba'i thabs de yongs su btsal ba la mi 'bad par mi bya ste 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the person from whom forbearance is to be requested does not want to grant forbearance, one should not be remiss in seeking the means by which he will grant forbearance; one should seek it.

original: mi bsgyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi bsgyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be obstinate.

original: thabs btsal ba de yun ring du mi bsdad pa'o //🔽kun nas dkris pa dang ma bral gyi bar du mi bsdad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thabs btsal ba de yun ring du mi bsdad pa'o // kun nas dkris pa dang ma bral gyi bar du mi bsdad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The means of investigation is not to remain for a long time.🔽One should not remain until one is separated from the entanglement.

original: khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhi par ma gyur gyi bar du mi bsdad par mi bya zhing bsdad par bya ste /
analyzed: khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa zhi par ma gyur gyi bar du mi bsdad par mi bya zhing bsdad par bya ste /
translated: One should not remain until the entanglement of anger is pacified, but one should remain.

original: kun nas dkris pa dang bral nas phyis bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang bral nas phyis bzod pa gsol bar bya'o //
translated: After one is separated from the entanglement, one should later ask for forgiveness.

original: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la mi bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzod pa gsol bar byed pa la mi bzod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be impatient when asking for forgiveness.

original: gcig bzod par byed pa ni cig shos kyis kyang bzod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig bzod par byed pa ni cig shos kyis kyang bzod par bya ba'o //
translated: When one asks for forgiveness, the other should also forgive.

original: dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa'i phran tshogs la sogs pa'i skabs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa'i phran tshogs la sogs pa'i skabs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The section on the miscellaneous topics related to the basis of the invitation for confession, etc.

original: dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i gzhi dang 'brel pa phran tshegs la sogs pa'i skabs nas 'byung ba bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation from the section on the miscellaneous topics related to the basis of the invitation for confession, etc. has been completed.

original: dgag dbye'i gzhi rdzogs so zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i gzhi rdzogs so zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The basis of the invitation for confession is completed.

original: // / da ni sra brkyang gi gzhi bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sra brkyang gi gzhi bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the basis of the invitation for the rainy season retreat should be explained.

original: de'i phyir sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said, “You should spread out the floor covering.”

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis sra brkyang zhes bya ba'i chos gos 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis sra brkyang zhes bya ba'i chos gos 'og nas 'byung ba'i cho gas gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: The monks who are the saṃgha should spread out the floor covering called “the spread out floor covering” by means of the rite that will be explained.

original: ji ltar na chos gos la sra brkyang zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos gos la sra brkyang zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is the robe called “the spread out floor covering?”

original: sra brkyang zhes bya ba ni gtan pa ste /🔽'di ltar 'di ni gos dra ba'i phyir gos 'ding bar byed cing rkyong bar byed pa mi 'khums par byed pa'i chos can shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i spang leb la sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang zhes bya ba ni gtan pa ste / 'di ltar 'di ni gos dra ba'i phyir gos 'ding bar byed cing rkyong bar byed pa mi 'khums par byed pa'i chos can shing la sogs pa las byas pa'i spang leb la sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
translated: The spread out floor covering is a mat.🔽In the same way that a mat is called “the spread out floor covering” because it is made of wood and other materials, and it is used to spread out and unroll a robe in order to weave a robe, and it does not allow the robe to shrink, in the same way, the robe is called “the spread out floor covering” because it is used to spread out and unroll a robe in order to weave a robe.

original: de bzhin du spang leb des chos gos dra ba'i phyir chos gos rkyong bar byed pa de ni phran tshegs dag las kyang sra brkyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spang leb des chos gos dra ba'i phyir chos gos rkyong bar byed pa de ni phran tshegs dag las kyang sra brkyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: The Kṣudraka Collection also says, “The spread out floor covering.”

original: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis sra brkyang nye bar gzhag par rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dag gis sra brkyang nye bar gzhag par rjes su gnang ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said, “I allow the monks to spread out the floor covering.”

original: chos gos 'di yang sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos gos 'di yang sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This Dharma robe is also like a mat, so it is called a mat.

original: ji ltar spang leb kyis gos 'ding zhing mi 'khums par sra brkyang gcig la rkyong bar byed pas spang leb de sra brkyang zhes bya ba de bzhin du /🔽chos gos @153a * //
analyzed: ji ltar spang leb kyis gos 'ding zhing mi 'khums par sra brkyang gcig la rkyong bar byed pas spang leb de sra brkyang zhes bya ba de bzhin du / chos gos @153a * //
translated: Just as a mat spreads out a cloth and prevents it from shrinking, spreading it out on a single mat, that mat is called a mat.🔽In the same way,

original: 'dis kyang dge 'dun dbyer med pa dang ro gcig pa dang bya ba gcig pa dang / rnyed pa dang phan yon 'dra bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas gtan pa gcig la 'jog par byed pas de'i phyir chos gos 'di yang sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang dge 'dun dbyer med pa dang ro gcig pa dang bya ba gcig pa dang / rnyed pa dang phan yon 'dra bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas gtan pa gcig la 'jog par byed pas de'i phyir chos gos 'di yang sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
translated: this Dharma robe also establishes the Saṅgha in a single state, by accomplishing indivisibility, single taste, single action, and similar gain and benefit. Therefore, this Dharma robe is also like a mat, so it is called a mat.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir spang leb des gos rkyong bar byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir spang leb des gos rkyong bar byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because that mat spreads out a cloth, it is called a mat.

original: 'dir chos gos 'dis kyang dge slong rnams brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la sbyor bar byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos gos 'dis kyang dge slong rnams brkyang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba la sbyor bar byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here this Dharma robe is also called a mat, because it connects the monks to the action characterized by spreading out.

original: de ltar nas sra brkyang dang 'dra bar chos gos 'di yang bya ba gcig pa nyid kyis dge 'dun mtha' dag la khyab par byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nas sra brkyang dang 'dra bar chos gos 'di yang bya ba gcig pa nyid kyis dge 'dun mtha' dag la khyab par byed pas sra brkyang zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, like the patched robe, this robe is called the patched robe because it is spread out to cover the entire saṃgha through a single action.

original: ci'i phyir de gding bar bya /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de gding bar bya /
translated: Why is it spread out?

original: bting ba la 'bras bu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bting ba la 'bras bu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the result of spreading it out?

original: de'i phyir gsum po dag ji lta ba bzhin du sra brkyang bting na yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba la yang nyes pa med la de lhag ma dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum po dag ji lta ba bzhin du sra brkyang bting na yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba la yang nyes pa med la de lhag ma dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that if the patched robe is spread out in the same way as the three, then there is no offense in eating again, eating in an assembly, going to a village without being invited, or begging for robes, and one will share in the gains.

original: gsum po dag ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum po dag ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the same way as the three🔽means

original: gsum po dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum po dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: the three are

original: 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: keeping, separating, and placing.

original: de dag ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the same as them?

original: sngar spang pa'i ltung byed kyi skabs su 'dir gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes smos pa'i mdo des gtan pa bting ba la 'chad ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag la nyes pa med par bstan pa ji
analyzed: sngar spang pa'i ltung byed kyi skabs su 'dir gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes smos pa'i mdo des gtan pa bting ba la 'chad ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa zhes bya ba gsum po dag la nyes pa med par bstan pa ji
translated: The sutra teaches that there is no fault in the three: explaining, separating and placing when the rains residence is established.🔽Similarly, there is no fault in eating again and again, eating in a group, going to a village without informing, or begging for cloth when the rains residence is established.

original: lta ba'o // de bzhin du sra brkyang bting ba yang yang za ba dang 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba la yang nyes pa med la sra brkyang bting pa'i dge slong de sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ba'i phan yon lnga yang yod do //
analyzed: lta ba'o // de bzhin du sra brkyang bting ba yang yang za ba dang 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba la yang nyes pa med la sra brkyang bting pa'i dge slong de sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ba'i phan yon lnga yang yod do //
translated: And there are five benefits for the fully ordained monk who establishes the rains residence, since he shares in the gains of the other fully ordained monks who establish the rains residence.

original: de lhag ma dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de lhag ma dag dang rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: He shares in the gains of the others.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong de ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong de ste /
translated: The one who is called that is the fully ordained monk who establishes the rains residence.

original: des ji srid du sra brkyang 'byin par mi byed pa de srid kyi bar du yul gzhan na 'dug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: des ji srid du sra brkyang 'byin par mi byed pa de srid kyi bar du yul gzhan na 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: As long as he does not open the robe, he may remain in another place.

original: sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag dang sra brkyang dang 'brel pa'i rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba'i dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag dang sra brkyang dang 'brel pa'i rnyed pa thun mong du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The remaining bhikṣus who have spread out the robe share in the robe and the gains connected with the robe.

original: sra brkyang bting ba la phan yon bcu yod pa las /
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba la phan yon bcu yod pa las /
translated: There are ten benefits of spreading out the robe.

original: 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang @153b 'jog pa dang / yang yang za ba dang 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba dag la nyes pa med pa dang / dge slong lhag ma dag dang rnyed ba thun mong du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba phan yon brgyad ni de ltar dngos su bstan to //
analyzed: 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang @153b 'jog pa dang / yang yang za ba dang 'dus shing za ba dang / ma smras par grong du 'gro ba dang / gos slong ba dag la nyes pa med pa dang / dge slong lhag ma dag dang rnyed ba thun mong du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba phan yon brgyad ni de ltar dngos su bstan to //
translated: Eight benefits are directly taught: not being separated from the robe, not being separated from the bowl, not being separated from the requisites, not being separated from the monks, not being separated from the country, not being separated from the gains, not being separated from the Dharma, and not being separated from the Sangha.

original: smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos kyis ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba gang yin pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa'i gos ji tsam 'dod pa 'chang ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i phan yon tha ma gnyis ni 'dir mdo 'dis mngon sum du bsdu ba ma byas te /
analyzed: smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos kyis ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba gang yin pa dang / rung bar ma byas pa'i gos ji tsam 'dod pa 'chang ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'i phan yon tha ma gnyis ni 'dir mdo 'dis mngon sum du bsdu ba ma byas te /
translated: The benefits of wearing the lower and upper robes and of wearing robes while wandering in the countryside and the last two benefits of wearing any robes not made suitable for wearing are not directly included in this sutra.

original: sngar 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i spong ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i skabs dag tu gsum po bstan pa nyid kyis bsdu ba byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang / 'jog pa'i spong ba'i cho ga bstan pa'i skabs dag tu gsum po bstan pa nyid kyis bsdu ba byas zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are included in the earlier explanation of the ceremony for relinquishing robes and the ceremony for storing robes.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How are they included?

original: 'dir 'bral ba'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe yang snam sbyar khyer bar byed la /
analyzed: 'dir 'bral ba'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ljongs rgyu ba'i tshe yang snam sbyar khyer bar byed la /
translated: When wandering in the countryside, one should carry one’s patched robe in order to avoid the fault of separation.

original: 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ni gos rung bar byed pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ni gos rung bar byed pa yin pas /
translated: One should make robes suitable for wearing in order to avoid the faults of wearing and storing.

original: de la 'di ltar gang gis sra brkyang bting ba de la 'bral ba'i nyes pa med pas /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar gang gis sra brkyang bting ba de la 'bral ba'i nyes pa med pas /
translated: Thus, one who spreads out the patched robe does not incur the fault of separation.

original: de la snam sbyar bskur ba dgos pa med pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la snam sbyar bskur ba dgos pa med pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of that which is not necessary, such as wearing a shawl?

original: de bzhin du de la 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa yang med pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du de la 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i nyes pa yang med pas /
translated: Similarly, there is no fault in wearing or storing it.

original: de la gos rung bar bya ba dgos pa med pas des kyang ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de la gos rung bar bya ba dgos pa med pas des kyang ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of that which is not necessary, such as making it suitable to wear?

original: de ltar na sngar gsum po bstan pa nyid kyis de gnyis bsdu ba byas zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sngar gsum po bstan pa nyid kyis de gnyis bsdu ba byas zin pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the two are already included in the previous presentation of the three.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'bral ba'i nyes pa med kyang stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos khyer zhing ljongs rgyur 'gro ba de bzhin du snam sbyar bskur ba la yang ci'i phyir gus par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'bral ba'i nyes pa med kyang stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos khyer zhing ljongs rgyur 'gro ba de bzhin du snam sbyar bskur ba la yang ci'i phyir gus par mi bya zhe na /
translated: If so, then why is respect not paid to wearing a shawl, since one travels through the countryside wearing the Dharma robes with an upper and lower garment, even though the fault of separation is not incurred?

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pas chos gos bskur ba ni ngo tsha ba'i gnas g-yogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba'i rtags yang dag par bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pas chos gos bskur ba ni ngo tsha ba'i gnas g-yogs par bya ba'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba'i rtags yang dag par bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Wearing the Dharma robes with an upper and lower garment is done to cover the shameful parts and to properly maintain the signs of a renunciate.

original: snam sbyar bskur ba la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snam sbyar bskur ba la ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no need to carry a patched robe.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos bskur zhing ljongs rgyur 'gro ba logs shig tu gsungs pa de ni snam sbyar khyer ba'i khur las thar bar bya ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'i chos gos bskur zhing ljongs rgyur 'gro ba logs shig tu gsungs pa de ni snam sbyar khyer ba'i khur las thar bar bya ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One taught that one should go on an alms round wearing the upper robe and the lower robe separately, in order to demonstrate the benefit of being free from the burden of carrying a patched robe.

original: rung bar ma byas pa'i gos bcang ba logs shig tu gsungs pa de ni rung bar byed pa'i bya ba las thar pa @154a * //
analyzed: rung bar ma byas pa'i gos bcang ba logs shig tu gsungs pa de ni rung bar byed pa'i bya ba las thar pa @154a * //
translated: He taught that one should carry a robe that is not yet fully allowable separately, in order to demonstrate the benefit of being free from the activity of making it fully allowable,

original: dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the benefit of the bliss of pliancy.

original: sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes smos na gang zag gang gis gding bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes smos na gang zag gang gis gding bar bya zhe na /
translated: If it is said that one should spread out the rainy season robe, by whom should it be spread out?

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas de bstan pa'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i khas ma blangs pa dang dbyar ra la ba dang dbyar phyi mar gnas bar khas blangs pa dang dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la de mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas de bstan pa'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i khas ma blangs pa dang dbyar ra la ba dang dbyar phyi mar gnas bar khas blangs pa dang dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la de mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that by way of reversal, it is said, “It does not occur for those who do not undertake the rainy season, for those who violate the rainy season, and for those who undertake the rainy season in another place.”

original: de dag sra brkyang gdeng pa mi 'byung zhing sra brkyang gi phan yon yang med do //
analyzed: de dag sra brkyang gdeng pa mi 'byung zhing sra brkyang gi phan yon yang med do //
translated: For those, the shaking of the rain cover does not occur and the benefits of the rain cover do not exist.

original: dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang / dbyar ral ba gnyis ni gnyi ga la tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med de /
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang / dbyar ral ba gnyis ni gnyi ga la tshogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa med de /
translated: Both those who do not undertake the rainy season and those who violate the rainy season do not have a complete assembly.

original: snga ma shos la ni gnas par khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma shos la ni gnas par khas blangs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the former, there is no undertaking of the rainy season.

original: phyi ma shos ni ral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma shos ni ral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the latter, there is violation of the rainy season.

original: dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la yang de mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la yang de mi 'byung ste /
translated: It also does not occur for those who undertake the rainy season in another place.

original: sra brkyang bting bar gtogs pa'i dge 'dun dang lhan cig dbyar gyi tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting bar gtogs pa'i dge 'dun dang lhan cig dbyar gyi tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not have an assembly of the rainy season together with the Saṅgha that is included in the rain cover.

original: de bas na dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang / dbyar ral ba dang dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la ni re zhig sra brkyang gding ba de mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang / dbyar ral ba dang dbyar gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la ni re zhig sra brkyang gding ba de mi 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, those who do not agree to the rainy season, those who violate the rainy season, and those who agree to the rainy season in another place do not spread out the straw mat.

original: sra brkyang gding ba ni dngos gzhi'i cho ga la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra brkyang gding ba ni dngos gzhi'i cho ga la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because spreading out the straw mat is based on the rite of the actual basis.

original: dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa de ni dngos gzhi'i cho gar gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa de ni dngos gzhi'i cho gar gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who agree to the later rainy season do not belong to the rite of the actual basis.

original: gang gi tshe dge 'dun thams cad dbyar gnas pa snga mar gnas par khas len pa na de dge 'dun gyi rnam par gzhag pa de las 'das te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dge 'dun thams cad dbyar gnas pa snga mar gnas par khas len pa na de dge 'dun gyi rnam par gzhag pa de las 'das te /
translated: When the entire saṅgha agrees to the earlier rainy season, they transgress that saṅgha’s arrangement.

original: dbyar gnas pa phyi mar gnas mkhas len pa de'i tshe na dge 'dun dang lhan cig tshogs pa'i dbyar gnas pa de la med pas de'i phyir de la yang sra brkyang gding ba de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa phyi mar gnas mkhas len pa de'i tshe na dge 'dun dang lhan cig tshogs pa'i dbyar gnas pa de la med pas de'i phyir de la yang sra brkyang gding ba de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When they agree to the later rainy season, they do not have the rainy season that is the assembly together with the saṅgha. Therefore, they also do not spread out the straw mat.

original: sa gzhan la gnas pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: sa gzhan la gnas pa dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Those who live in other places also do not spread out the straw mat.

original: sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The same applies to the spreading of the rainy season retreat.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are on other levels refers to

original: chad pas bcad pa dang spo ba byed pa la sogs pa dag ste /
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa dang spo ba byed pa la sogs pa dag ste /
translated: those who are punished, those who are transferred and so on.

original: de dag ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas ba dag dang ris mi mthun pa yin pas de dag la yang sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byang ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni dge slong rang bzhin du gnas ba dag dang ris mi mthun pa yin pas de dag la yang sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byang ngo //
translated: They are not of the same class as fully ordained monks who maintain their status and they do not spread the rainy season retreat.

original: 'di ltar dge tshul la sogs pa dag la yang sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung bar gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge tshul la sogs pa dag la yang sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung bar gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Although it is said that novices and so on do not spread the rainy season retreat,

original: de @154b dag 'dir ma smos pa ni de dag la las la 'jug pa med pas de'i phyir de dag ni ma smos kyang grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de @154b dag 'dir ma smos pa ni de dag la las la 'jug pa med pas de'i phyir de dag ni ma smos kyang grub pa nyid do //
translated: they are not mentioned here because they do not engage in the rite.

original: de dag nyid 'thob pa yin na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid 'thob pa yin na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they obtain those vows, they do not spread the rainy season retreat.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa de dag nyid 'thob ba ni de dag nyid 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa de dag nyid 'thob ba ni de dag nyid 'thob pa ste /
translated: If those who are on other levels obtain those vows, they do not spread the rainy season retreat.

original: de dag 'thob pa nyid yin na de dag la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag 'thob pa nyid yin na de dag la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: If they obtain those vows, they do not spread the rainy season retreat.

original: tha ma ma gtogs pa dag dang sa gzhan na gnas pa dag dang dge tshul ni rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha ma ma gtogs pa dag dang sa gzhan na gnas pa dag dang dge tshul ni rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the last, those abiding on other levels and novices obtain the benefits of the rainy season retreat.🔽The last of the four statements is those who agree to abide in another residence.

original: sngar dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang dbyar ral ba dang / dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blangs pa dang / gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la de mi 'byung ngo zhes tshig bzhi smos pa'i tha ma gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa de'i lhag ma gsum po dag dang /
analyzed: sngar dbyar gnas par khas ma blangs pa dang dbyar ral ba dang / dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blangs pa dang / gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa dag la de mi 'byung ngo zhes tshig bzhi smos pa'i tha ma gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ma gtogs pa de'i lhag ma gsum po dag dang /
translated: Those who do not agree to abide in the rainy season retreat, those who break the rainy season retreat and those who agree to abide in the latter rainy season do not obtain the benefits of the rainy season retreat.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag dang / dge tshul dag ni 'di ltar sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon mi 'thob pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag dang / dge tshul dag ni 'di ltar sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon mi 'thob pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Those abiding on other levels and novices do not obtain the benefits of the rainy season retreat in this way.

original: 'on kyang de dag sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa'i skal pa ni dbang ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa'i skal pa ni dbang ba ste /
translated: However, they obtain a share of the benefits of the rainy season retreat.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni dbyar gnas pa dag dang / don gcig pa nyid yin pas bzlog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni dbyar gnas pa dag dang / don gcig pa nyid yin pas bzlog par mi bya'o //
translated: They are not to be excluded because they are the same as those abiding in the rainy season retreat.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag ces smos pas gnas nas phyung ba yang rnyed pa dbang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de bsal ba'i phyir gnas nas phyung ba ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa dag ces smos pas gnas nas phyung ba yang rnyed pa dbang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de bsal ba'i phyir gnas nas phyung ba ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To eliminate that possibility, it says, “Those who are expelled do not master it.”

original: gnas nas phyung ba ni dge 'dun las tha dad du gyur pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa mi dbang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas nas phyung ba ni dge 'dun las tha dad du gyur pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir de ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa mi dbang ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since those who are expelled are separate from the saṅgha, it should be understood that they do not master the property of the saṅgha when the summer retreat is concluded.

original: chad pas bcad pa dang spo ba la sogs pa byed pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad du gyur pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa dang spo ba la sogs pa byed pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad du gyur pa nyid ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa dbang ba yin no //
translated: Those who are punished by being demoted, etc., are not separate from the saṅgha. Therefore they master the property of the saṅgha when the summer retreat is concluded.

original: bye ba dag na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba ni de nyid kyis 'thob pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bye ba dag na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba ni de nyid kyis 'thob pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who side with the faction of non-Dharma in a schism obtain it in the same way.

original: lta ba khas len pas dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gnyis su bya ba dag na /
analyzed: lta ba khas len pas dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong gnyis su bya ba dag na /
translated: When two monks who have become monks by accepting the view are in a place where they are performing the rite of spreading out the robes,

original: de na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun par gnas pa'i dge slong dag gi nang du lta ba khas len par song ba'i gang zag ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa la de nyid kyis 'thob pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun par gnas pa'i dge slong dag gi nang du lta ba khas len par song ba'i gang zag ni sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa la de nyid kyis 'thob pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: then an individual who has gone to a place that is not in accord with the Dharma and who has accepted the view obtains the robe that is spread out.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la /🔽de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas nas @155a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la / de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnas nas @155a * //
translated: The term that very one is applied to this.🔽The term that refers to one who is expelled from the Sangha.

original: phyung ba la snyegs te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: phyung ba la snyegs te de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The state of that one is that very one.🔽When schism occurs, those who have gone to a place that is not in accord with the Dharma obtain the robe that is spread out.

original: bye ba dag na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba'i rnyed pa thob pa ni spangs pa'i rnyed pa 'thob pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bye ba dag na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba'i rnyed pa thob pa ni spangs pa'i rnyed pa 'thob pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: This is similar to obtaining the robe that is relinquished.

original: ji ltar spangs pa la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung zhing 'byung ba yang med par gyur pas des sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa mi 'thob pa de bzhin du 'dis kyang mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar spangs pa la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung zhing 'byung ba yang med par gyur pas des sra brkyang bting ba'i rnyed pa mi 'thob pa de bzhin du 'dis kyang mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the spreading of the rainy season residence is not firm for one who has abandoned it, and since it is not firm, one does not obtain the gain of spreading the rainy season residence, so too, one does not obtain it.

original: phan yon gang gi phyir sra brkyang gding ba dang / dge slong gang dag gis sra brkyang gding ba de skabs dang bcas par bstan nas /
analyzed: phan yon gang gi phyir sra brkyang gding ba dang / dge slong gang dag gis sra brkyang gding ba de skabs dang bcas par bstan nas /
translated: The benefits for which the rainy season residence is spread and the monks who spread the rainy season residence are taught with their context.

original: da ni 'dir dngos po gang gding bar bya ba de la sra brkyang nyid du bzhed pa de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dir dngos po gang gding bar bya ba de la sra brkyang nyid du bzhed pa de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, here, the substance that is to be spread should be explained as the very spreading of the rainy season residence.

original: dngos gzhi'i dus kyi dgag dbye'i mthang dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba 'ding ba'i nyi ma'i mthar grub par gos kyi rnyed par bgrang ba'i chos gos gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dus kyi dgag dbye'i mthang dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba 'ding ba'i nyi ma'i mthar grub par gos kyi rnyed par bgrang ba'i chos gos gsum mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The three Dharma robes are counted as the gain of cloth at the end of the day of spreading the rainy season residence, which arises from the cause of the rainy season residence at the time of the main part.

original: dngos gzhi'i dus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The time of the main part is

original: 'di ltar dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug ni sra brkyang gding ba'i nyi ma nyid yin par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyar phyi mar gnas par khas blangs pa la sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir dang ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug ni sra brkyang gding ba'i nyi ma nyid yin par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the invitation to enter the later summer is not a time for spreading out the rainy season robe and because it is said that the sixteenth day of the middle month of autumn is the day for spreading out the rainy season robe.

original: dngos gzhi'i dus de'i dgag dbye zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i dus de'i dgag dbye zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The invitation ceremony at the end of the rainy season retreat is

analyzed: dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po dag gi mjug tu ston zla 'bring po nya la dgag dbye byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the invitation ceremony at the end of the three months of the earlier rainy season, which is performed on the full moon of the middle month of autumn.

original: mthar zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus kyi dgag dbye de nyid mtha' yin te /
analyzed: mthar zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi'i dus kyi dgag dbye de nyid mtha' yin te /

analyzed: dbyar snga ma'i zla ba gsum po de dag gi mtha' yin pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: mtha' de tshun chad du gos kyi rnyed pa byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The robe should be made from the cloth acquired up to that point.

original: dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Arisen from the summer rains refers to

analyzed: dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po de dag bsdus pa'am so so'i rgyu las byung ba'i gos kyi rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: cloth acquired from the cause of the three months of the earlier summer or from the cause of each month.

original: gang la rnyed pa dbyar snga ma zla pa gsum po de dag bsdus pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la rnyed pa dbyar snga ma zla pa gsum po de dag bsdus pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin zhe na /

analyzed: de yang @155b dbyar de las byung ba'i rnyed pa yin gyi /

analyzed: dus gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba'i rnyed pa ni ma yin no /
translated: but not cloth acquired from the cause of another time.

analyzed: 'ding ba'i nyin mo'i mthar grub pa zhes bya ba ni dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po de dag gi dgag dbye ston zla 'bring po nya la byas nas / ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la sra brkyang gding pa'i nyi ma de'i mtha' tshun chad du dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po de dag bsdus pa'am so so'i rgyu las byung ba'i gos rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is called the “end of the three months of the earlier rainy season retreat.”🔽If the invitation ceremony is performed on the full moon of the middle autumn month, then the day of spreading out the sitting mat for the retreat of the later rainy season is the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the three months of the earlier rainy season retreat.🔽

original: gos kyi rnyed par bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed par bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.

translated: The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.🔽The end of the day of spreading out the sitting mat is the end of the first three months of the rainy season retreat.

original: chos gos gsum po de dag 'dir dge slong rnams kyis gnas bsdu ba dang / bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad par bya ba'i sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos gos gsum po de dag 'dir dge slong rnams kyis gnas bsdu ba dang / bde bar gnas par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad par bya ba'i sra brkyang gding bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: These three robes are to be spread out as a mat for the monks to sit on, in order to live comfortably and to use the gifts of donors.

original: de la dngos gzhi'i dus zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: de la dngos gzhi'i dus zhes smos pas ni /
translated: Since the time of the actual ceremony is mentioned,

original: sngar gal te gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar thos par gyur na /
analyzed: sngar gal te gnas par khas blangs pa dag gis dge slong 'thab krol byed pa dag 'ong bar thos par gyur na /
translated: it is understood that the earlier statement, “If those who have agreed to live in a certain place hear that quarrelsome monks are coming,

analyzed: gal te gso sbyong gnyis sam gsum thal bar gyur na dgag dbye bya'o zhes smos pa dang / dong ba dag na dgag dbye bya'o zhes smos bas /
translated: if two or three poṣadhas have passed, they should do the invitation ceremony,” and the statement, “If they have gone, they should do the invitation ceremony,”

original: 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyus dgag dbye'i nyi ma bas sngar ram phyis dgag dbye bya bar bstan pa gang yin pa de bsal bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyus dgag dbye'i nyi ma bas sngar ram phyis dgag dbye bya bar bstan pa gang yin pa de bsal bar shes par bya'o //
translated: refer to the invitation ceremony being done before or after the invitation day because of the cause of quarrelsome monks and so on.

original: dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes smos pas ni dus gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba'i gos kyi rnyed pa bsal to //
analyzed: dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba zhes smos pas ni dus gzhan gyi rgyu las byung ba'i gos kyi rnyed pa bsal to //
translated: Since it says arisen from the cause of summer, it excludes the acquisition of cloth that arises from the cause of another season.

original: gding ba'i nyi ma'i mthar grub pa zhes spos pas ni /
analyzed: gding ba'i nyi ma'i mthar grub pa zhes spos pas ni /

analyzed: dbyar gyi rgyu las byung ba'i rnyed pa dus gzhan du grub pa bsal to //
translated: it excludes the acquisition of cloth that arises from the cause of summer that is completed at another time.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa bgrang bar zhes smos pas ni /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa bgrang bar zhes smos pas ni /
translated: Since it says the acquisition of cloth is counted,
