analyzed: gos kyi don las gzhan pa'i mkhar len dang gtsug lag khang brgyan pa la sogs pa'i don du 'byung ba'i rnyed pa bsal to //
translated: it excludes the acquisition that arises for the purpose of other things than cloth, such as building a fort or decorating a temple.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug gi nyi ma dang bcas pa dag bsdus pa'am so so'i rgyu las byung ba'i gos kyi rnyed pa gang yin pa de las bsgyur ba'i chos gos gsum po gang yin @156a * //
analyzed: dbyar snga ma zla ba gsum po ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug gi nyi ma dang bcas pa dag bsdus pa'am so so'i rgyu las byung ba'i gos kyi rnyed pa gang yin pa de las bsgyur ba'i chos gos gsum po gang yin @156a * //
translated: The three months of the earlier summer, together with the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month, are included. Whatever acquisition of cloth arises from its own cause, from that, whatever the three robes are made,

original: pa ; de dag 'dir sra brkyang gding bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa ; de dag 'dir sra brkyang gding bar bya ba yin no //
translated: those are to be spread out here at the end of the summer retreat.

original: gtsug lag khang gang na gos kyi rnyed pa nges pa gang yin pa de yang 'dir bsdus par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang na gos kyi rnyed pa nges pa gang yin pa de yang 'dir bsdus par shes par bya ste /
translated: Also, the definite acquisition of robes in a monastery should be understood as included here.

original: de lta bas na de dang 'brel pa yang gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dang 'brel pa yang gding bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should also spread out the robes that are related to them.

original: gos kyi don du rnyed pa'i rin dag gis bsgrub pa'i chos gos gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gding bar bya ste /
analyzed: gos kyi don du rnyed pa'i rin dag gis bsgrub pa'i chos gos gsum po gang dag yin pa de dag kyang gding bar bya ste /
translated: The three robes that are produced by the price of robes that are given should also be spread out,

original: gos kyi rin ni gos kyi don du byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos kyi rin ni gos kyi don du byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the price of robes is given for the sake of robes.

original: lung las chos gos gsum zhes dngos su gang gsungs pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: lung las chos gos gsum zhes dngos su gang gsungs pa med mod kyi /
translated: Although the three robes are not directly mentioned in the scriptures,

original: sngags kyi sgo nas gsum du gsungs par mngon te /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas gsum du gsungs par mngon te /
translated: it is clear that they are mentioned in the scriptures by way of the mantra.

original: de ga las shes she na /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang sra brkyang gding bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ga las shes she na / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang sra brkyang gding bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: How is this known?🔽The Buddha said: “Venerables, tomorrow I will spread out the summer robe.

original: khyed cag gis rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung las shes te /
analyzed: khyed cag gis rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i lung las shes te /
translated: You should also take out your robes.”

original: gal te gcig bu zhig gding bar bya ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rang rang gi chos gos gcig dbyung bar bya'o zhes gcig gi tshig tu gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te gcig bu zhig gding bar bya ba nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rang rang gi chos gos gcig dbyung bar bya'o zhes gcig gi tshig tu gsungs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If only one of the three robes is to be spread out, then the text would say, “One should spread out one’s own Dharma robe.”

original: lung las rang rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes mang po'i tshig tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las rang rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes mang po'i tshig tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the text says, “One should spread out one’s own Dharma robes,” in the plural.

original: gcig cig byin gyis brlabs pa la gsum char gyi dbyung ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig cig byin gyis brlabs pa la gsum char gyi dbyung ba yang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it would be illogical for all three to be spread out for the sake of one.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:🔽“Venerable, is it proper to spread out the rainy season robe for the saṃgha?”

original: btsun pa gang zag gis snam sbyar gyi sra brkyang gding du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa gang zag gis snam sbyar gyi sra brkyang gding du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: “Upāli, it is not proper.

original: gal te dge 'dun la phul na ni rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun la phul na ni rung ngo //
translated: But if it is offered to the saṃgha, it is proper.”

original: bla gos dang mthang gos kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “The upper robe and the lower robe are the same.”

original: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis smos pas chos gos gsum char sra brkyang nyid du gding bar mngon no //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis smos pas chos gos gsum char sra brkyang nyid du gding bar mngon no //
translated: Since the upper robe and the lower robe are mentioned, it is clear that all three robes are spread out for the rainy season.

original: de lta bas na dge slong ma rnams kyi yang chos gos lnga char sra brkyang nyid du gding bar 'dis bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong ma rnams kyi yang chos gos lnga char sra brkyang nyid du gding bar 'dis bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus, this passage also teaches that the five robes of nuns are to be spread out on the platform.

original: dge 'dun gyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The robes of the Saṅgha

original: dge 'dun gyi chos gos gsum sra brkyang du gding ba yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi chos gos gsum sra brkyang du gding ba yin te /
translated: are the three robes of the Saṅgha that are spread out on the platform.

original: de ni dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are consecrated by the Saṅgha.

original: chos gos gang gding bar 'os pa de bstan pa'i phyir bshad brdab ma byas pa dang ya yor ma gyur ba dang ma rmugs pa dang ma zegs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: chos gos gang gding bar 'os pa de bstan pa'i phyir bshad brdab ma byas pa dang ya yor ma gyur ba dang ma rmugs pa dang ma zegs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to teach which robes are suitable to be spread out on the platform, the text says, “not patched, not torn, not rotten, and not eaten by moths.”

original: bshad brdab ma byas pa zhes bya ba la bshad brdab ces bya ba ni /🔽snam bu bzhin du spu bshad cing brdabs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad brdab ma byas pa zhes bya ba la bshad brdab ces bya ba ni / snam bu bzhin du spu bshad cing brdabs pa ste /
translated: Not patched means not patched like a blanket.

original: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni bshad @156b brdab ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni bshad @156b brdab ma byas pa'o //
translated: Not torn means not torn like a blanket.🔽Not rotten means not rotten like a blanket.🔽Not eaten by moths means not eaten by moths like a blanket.

original: ya yor ma gyur ba zhes bya ba la ya yor zhes bya ba ni grva dag 'phyangs pa'i phyir mi mnyam par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: ya yor ma gyur ba zhes bya ba la ya yor zhes bya ba ni grva dag 'phyangs pa'i phyir mi mnyam par 'dug pa'o //
translated: The phrase not made into a mat means that it is not uneven because the corners have not been cut off.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:🔽It is uneven because the warp and weft threads are not evenly woven.🔽That which is not like that is not made into a mat.🔽The phrase not made into a rug means that it is not a rug.

original: 'thag pa'i tshe bar bar du rgyu sbun ma bcug cing seng seng bor gyur pa'o zhes kyang zer te /
analyzed: 'thag pa'i tshe bar bar du rgyu sbun ma bcug cing seng seng bor gyur pa'o zhes kyang zer te /
translated: A rug is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a rug.

original: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ya yor ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ya yor ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase not made into a blanket means that it is not a blanket.🔽A blanket is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a blanket.

original: ma rmugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rmugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase not made into felt means that it is not felt.🔽Felt is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not felt.🔽The phrase not made into cloth means that it is not cloth.🔽Cloth is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not cloth.🔽The phrase not made into a garment means that it is not a garment.

original: rmugs pa zhes bya ba ni sril dang bya dang byi ba dang / aud tsa ting ka dang bye ba la sogs pas mchus rmugs pa ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa zhes bya ba ni sril dang bya dang byi ba dang / aud tsa ting ka dang bye ba la sogs pas mchus rmugs pa ste /
translated: A garment is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a garment.

original: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ma rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ma rmugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase not made into a patch means that it is not a patch.🔽A patch is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a patch.

original: ma zegs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma zegs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase not made into a cover means that it is not a cover.

original: zegs pa zhes bya ba ni sha srab pa ste /
analyzed: zegs pa zhes bya ba ni sha srab pa ste /
translated: A cover is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a cover.

original: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ma zegs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas pa gang yin pa de ni ma zegs pa'o //
translated: The phrase not made into a wrapping means that it is not a wrapping.🔽A wrapping is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a wrapping.

original: kha bsgyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase not made into a cushion means that it is not a cushion.

original: bkru bshal 'ba' zhig dang kha bsgyur ba byas pa ste /
analyzed: bkru bshal 'ba' zhig dang kha bsgyur ba byas pa ste /
translated: A cushion is made by repeatedly inserting weft threads and is soft and thick.🔽 That which is not like that is not a cushion.🔽The phrase not made into a pillow means that it is not a pillow.

original: bkru bshal 'ba' zhig byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bkru bshal 'ba' zhig byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase merely washed and rinsed means

original: bcag pa dang brdab pa med par bkru bshal byas pa nyi tshe byas pa'o //
analyzed: bcag pa dang brdab pa med par bkru bshal byas pa nyi tshe byas pa'o //
translated: that the robe is washed and rinsed without being beaten or pounded.

original: kha bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase dyed means

original: de ltar bkru bshal 'ba' zhig byas pa'i 'og tu kha bsgyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kha dog bsgyur bar byas pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar bkru bshal 'ba' zhig byas pa'i 'og tu kha bsgyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis kha dog bsgyur bar byas pa'o /
translated: that after merely washing and rinsing the robe, it is dyed with a color that is suitable.

original: chos gos ma brdabs pa rung ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos ma brdabs pa rung ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The phrase a suitable robe that is not beaten refers to the same robe that is not beaten.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text states:

original: chos gos ma brdabs pa rung ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos gos ma brdabs pa rung ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is a suitable robe that is not beaten?

original: ma brdabs pa ni bcags pa'o //
analyzed: ma brdabs pa ni bcags pa'o //
translated: 'Not beaten' means 'not pounded.'

original: de nyid rung ba yin pas ma brdabs pa rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rung ba yin pas ma brdabs pa rung ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is 'suitable' because it is suitable. Therefore, it is called 'not beaten and suitable.'

original: chos gos kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa de yang de yin pas kha bsgyur ba mi gding bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos kha bsgyur ba gang yin pa de yang de yin pas kha bsgyur ba mi gding bar mi bya'o //
translated: Since the robe that is dyed is also that robe, it is said, 'Do not spread out the dyed robe.'

original: yongs su ma spyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni sus kyang yongs su ma spyad pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma spyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni sus kyang yongs su ma spyad pa ste /
translated: The phrase not used means that it has not been used by anyone.

original: yongs su spyad pa zhes bya ba ni rnying par gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: yongs su spyad pa zhes bya ba ni rnying par gyur pa yin pas /
translated: “Used” means “old.”

original: chos gos rnying par gyur pas sra brkyang 'ding bar byed na ma bting bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos rnying par gyur pas sra brkyang 'ding bar byed na ma bting bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one spreads out a robe that is old and worn, it is called “spread out.”🔽The treatise declares:

original: de ltar yang gzhung ni chos gos rnying bar gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhung ni chos gos rnying bar gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is an old robe?

original: dge slong gis spyad pa'i chos gos gsum gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin ni //
analyzed: dge slong gis spyad pa'i chos gos gsum gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin ni //
translated: It is any one of the three robes used by a monk.”

original: sra ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos gos dengs pa bsal to //
analyzed: sra ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos gos dengs pa bsal to //
translated: The word “firm” excludes a robe that is worn out.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: The treatise on the questions of the son of the brahmin Upatiṣya declares:

original: chos gos dengs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gos dengs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a worn out robe?

original: chos gos gang dge slong gi lus las dengs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gos gang dge slong gi lus las dengs pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is a robe that is worn out on the body of a monk.”

original: dengs pa ni zad pa yin pas de ltar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dengs pa ni zad pa yin pas de ltar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since “worn out” means “used up,” it means “not used up.”

original: @157a * // mthud ma can dang lhan rings can dang lhan pa can dang chag can dang / gzungs can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @157a * // mthud ma can dang lhan rings can dang lhan pa can dang chag can dang / gzungs can ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those with a seam, those with a long seam, those with patches, those with a hole, those without a dhāraṇī.

original: ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di lnga char dang so sor sbyar ro //🔽mthud ma can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di lnga char dang so sor sbyar ro // mthud ma can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “without” is to be connected with each of the five.

original: dum bu rigs mi mthun pas mthud ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: dum bu rigs mi mthun pas mthud ma byas pa ste /
translated: Those with a seam are those whose robes are not sewn together with pieces of different colors.

original: de lta bu ma mthud pa ni mthud ma can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ma mthud pa ni mthud ma can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those without a seam are those who do not sew their robes together in that way.

original: lhan rings can zhes bya ba ni lhan pa ring pos glan pa ste /
analyzed: lhan rings can zhes bya ba ni lhan pa ring pos glan pa ste /
translated: Those with a long seam are those who sew their robes together with a long seam.

original: de lta bus ma glan pa ni lhan rings can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus ma glan pa ni lhan rings can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those without a long seam are those who do not sew their robes together in that way.

original: lhan pa can zhes bya ba ni gang la chu bur gyi rnam pa ltar glo ba'i lhan pa gzhan gyis glan pa ste /
analyzed: lhan pa can zhes bya ba ni gang la chu bur gyi rnam pa ltar glo ba'i lhan pa gzhan gyis glan pa ste /
translated: Those with patches are those who sew patches onto their robes, like the patches on a child’s clothing.

original: de lta bus ma glan pa ni lhan pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus ma glan pa ni lhan pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those without patches are those who do not sew patches onto their robes in that way.

original: cha ga can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cha ga can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those with a hole are those who make a hole in their robes.🔽Those without a hole are those who do not make a hole in their robes.

original: chos gos dag gi mtha' thog thag tu skud pa'i tshoms kyis cha ga btab pa ste /
analyzed: chos gos dag gi mtha' thog thag tu skud pa'i tshoms kyis cha ga btab pa ste /
translated: Those with a border are those who sew a border of cloth around the edges of their robes.

original: de lta bus ma btab pa ni cha ga can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus ma btab pa ni cha ga can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not so anointed is not anointed.

original: gzungs can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzungs can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is anointed is a dhāraṇī.

original: mtha' zags pa dag la skud pas dkris shing gzungs btab pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' zags pa dag la skud pas dkris shing gzungs btab pa ste /
translated: It is a dhāraṇī that is tied with a string to the end of a robe and anointed.

original: de lta bus gzungs ma btab pa ni gzungs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bus gzungs ma btab pa ni gzungs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not so anointed is not a dhāraṇī.

original: spangs pa dang rgyu ma brtags pa dang bral phrad ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spangs pa dang rgyu ma brtags pa dang bral phrad ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not abandoned, not a cause, not examined, not separated, and not joined.

original: 'dir yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra so sor sbyar ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra so sor sbyar ste /
translated: Here the term “not” is applied to each of these.

original: spangs pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma brtags pa ma yin pa dang bral phrad ma yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: spangs pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu ma brtags pa ma yin pa dang bral phrad ma yin pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is not abandoned, not a cause, not examined, not separated, and not joined.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni chos gos gzhag pa ste /
translated: Abandoned means to put aside one’s robes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: Here the text is the Sūtra Requested by the Bhikṣu Brahmāyus,🔽which states:

original: chos gos bzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gos bzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is putting aside one’s robes?

original: chos gos gang zhag bcu 'das pa dang / zhag gcig bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gos gang zhag bcu 'das pa dang / zhag gcig bral ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is when one’s robes are separated for one day after ten days have passed.”

original: de ltar ma gyur pa ni spangs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur pa ni spangs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not so is not abandoned.

original: rgyu ma brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ma brtags pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: Unanalyzed cause means an improper cause.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de nyid las rgyu ma brtags pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /🔽de lta bu ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de nyid las rgyu ma brtags pa ni rung ba ma yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te / de lta bu ma yin pa ni /
translated: The text says, “An unanalyzed cause is an improper cause.”

original: rgyu ma brtags pa ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: rgyu ma brtags pa ma yin pa'o /
translated: A cause that is not like that is not an unanalyzed cause.

original: bral phrad zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bral phrad zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Separated and joined means

original: phyag dar khrod la bya ste /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod la bya ste /
translated: a discarded rag.

original: 'di ltar sngar bor ba'i tshe na ba dag po dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bor ba'i tshe na ba dag po dang bral ba yin la /
translated: When it is discarded, it is separated from its owner.

original: phyis blangs pa'i tshe na bdag po gzhan dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis blangs pa'i tshe na bdag po gzhan dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is picked up, it is joined to another owner.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: The text says, “In the Questions of the Monk Bhikṣuṇḍala Sūtra it says:

original: chos gos bral phrad gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gos bral phrad gang zhe na /
translated: What is a robe that is separated and joined?

original: chos gos gang lam ka nas byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos gos gang lam ka nas byung ba ste /
translated: A robe that is found on the road,

original: lam du bor ba las rnyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lam du bor ba las rnyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: a robe that is found on the road after being discarded.”

original: @157b de lta bu ma yin pa ni bral phrad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: @157b de lta bu ma yin pa ni bral phrad ma yin pa'o //
translated: A robe that is not like that is not separated and joined.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni da lta spong bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni da lta spong bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Abandoned means not only that which is abandoned now but also

original: sngon lan cig spangs par gyur pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngon lan cig spangs par gyur pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to be abandoned once and for all.

original: dras shing drubs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dras shing drubs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Woven” means

original: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ste /
translated: suitable to be consecrated.

original: de'i phyir sbyar ma yang byin gyis brlab tu rung bar gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyar ma yang byin gyis brlab tu rung bar gsungs pa gang yin pa de yang 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what is said to be suitable to be consecrated is also included in this.

original: zin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs par zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ Used” means completely used.

original: lnga pa'o zhes bya ba ni srid du khru lnga pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa'o zhes bya ba ni srid du khru lnga pa ste /
translated: “ Five cubits” means five cubits in length.

original: 'dis zheng du khru gsum pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis zheng du khru gsum pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This also includes three cubits in width.

original: lhag ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ The rest” means

original: khru tshad lhag pa dang / sum phrugs lhag ma yang rung ba ste /
analyzed: khru tshad lhag pa dang / sum phrugs lhag ma yang rung ba ste /
translated: more than a cubit, or even more than three cubits.

original: sra brkyang 'di la dge 'dun gyis khyab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lhag pa la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sra brkyang 'di la dge 'dun gyis khyab par bya ba yin pa'i phyir lhag pa la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Since this is a blanket for the saṃgha, there is no fault in having extra.

original: dge 'dun nang na nyung ba dge slong bzhi yod na de'i phyir dge slong bzhi'i tshad kyi chos gos sum phrugs bzhi man chad gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun nang na nyung ba dge slong bzhi yod na de'i phyir dge slong bzhi'i tshad kyi chos gos sum phrugs bzhi man chad gding bar bya'o //
translated: If there are four monks in the Sangha, then the monks should spread out the robes for the four monks.

original: kha cig na re chos gos sum phrugs bzhi pas lhag par bting ba la yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos gos sum phrugs bzhi pas lhag par bting ba la yang nyes pa med de /
translated: Some say that there is no fault in spreading out more than the three robes for four monks,

original: sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dang / dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: sbyin pa po rnams kyi bsod nams spel ba'i phyir dang / dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te /
translated: because it increases the merit of the donors and it increases the acquisition of the monks.

original: de lta bas na chos gos sum phrugs ji snyed 'byor pa de snyed kyi gding du rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos gos sum phrugs ji snyed 'byor pa de snyed kyi gding du rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to spread out as many robes as are available.

original: sngar ma bting ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar ma bting ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not spread out before

original: lo gzhan la sra brkyang nyid du sngar ma bting ba'i chos gos rung gi / sngar bting ba ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: lo gzhan la sra brkyang nyid du sngar ma bting ba'i chos gos rung gi / sngar bting ba ni mi rung ngo //
translated: means that it is suitable to spread out robes that were not spread out before in the other years, but it is not suitable to spread out those that were spread out before.

original: bting ba'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽sprog ma'i nang du bting ba'o //
analyzed: bting ba'o zhes bya ba ni / sprog ma'i nang du bting ba'o //
translated: It is spread out🔽means that it is spread out inside a bag.

original: gzebs kyi sprog ma'i nang du brkyang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzebs kyi sprog ma'i nang du brkyang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is spread out inside a bag that is sewn together.

original: du ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also many is said.

original: chos gos sum phrugs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: chos gos sum phrugs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is connected with “three robes.”

original: dge 'dun gyi tshogs du ma yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi tshogs du ma yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is a multitude of saṃgha assemblies,

original: chos gos sum phrugs du ma yang gding du rung ngo //
analyzed: chos gos sum phrugs du ma yang gding du rung ngo //
translated: many three robes are also suitable to be spread.

original: de ji snyed pas gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ji snyed pas gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As many as there are, they should be spread.

original: chos gos sum phrugs te ji snyed yod pa de snyed 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong yang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gos sum phrugs te ji snyed yod pa de snyed 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong yang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that as many as there are three robes, that many monks should be appointed to spread them.

original: de ni chos gos gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa dag byung nas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni chos gos gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa dag byung nas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since that is a consecration of another robe, therefore, after the consecrations have arisen,

original: gang gi phyir sra brkyang gding ba de ni chos gos gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sra brkyang gding ba de ni chos gos gzhan byin gyis brlabs pa yin pas /
translated: since that spreading of the summer retreat is a consecration of another robe,

original: de'i phyir sra brkyang 'ding ba'i nyin par dge slong rang rang gi chos gos sngar @158a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sra brkyang 'ding ba'i nyin par dge slong rang rang gi chos gos sngar @158a * //
translated: therefore, on the day of spreading the summer retreat, each monk should spread his own robe.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa dag dbyung bar bya zhing de dag phyung nas gzod sra brkyang gding bar bya'o //
