translated: By doing two or three subsequent actions.🔽By doing two or three of those actions of washing, etc.,

original: bkru ba la sogs pa de dag las gnyis sam gsum gyi las rjes su bsgrub pas gdon mi za bar sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: bkru ba la sogs pa de dag las gnyis sam gsum gyi las rjes su bsgrub pas gdon mi za bar sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: one should definitely do the preliminary actions.

original: zin pa zhig drub na rang gis kha ba srubs gnyis sam gsum drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zin pa zhig drub na rang gis kha ba srubs gnyis sam gsum drub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is finished, he should sew two or three stitches himself.

original: gal te chos gos de byas zin pa zhig drub na de'i tshe sra brkyang 'ding bas de'i 'og tu srubs gcig gam gnyis tsam drub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te chos gos de byas zin pa zhig drub na de'i tshe sra brkyang 'ding bas de'i 'og tu srubs gcig gam gnyis tsam drub par bya ba'o //
translated: If that robe has been made, then by spreading the robe, he should sew one or two stitches.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong sra brkyang 'ding bas sra brkyang du 'ding ba'i chos gos bkru bar bya ba dang drub par bya ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya ba la sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong sra brkyang 'ding bas sra brkyang du 'ding ba'i chos gos bkru bar bya ba dang drub par bya ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya ba la sngon du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who spreads the sitting mat should first wash, sew, and dye the robe that is to be spread as the sitting mat.

original: gal te byas zin pa zhig rnyed na de'i 'og tu khab srubs gnyis sam gsum drub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te byas zin pa zhig rnyed na de'i 'og tu khab srubs gnyis sam gsum drub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he finds one that has already been made, he should then sew two or three patches on it.

original: mnos pa dang rang byed pa dang de'i mjug dag tu go rims bzhin du 'ding bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnos pa dang rang byed pa dang de'i mjug dag tu go rims bzhin du 'ding bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sitting mat is spread in order, respectively, to take up, to make, and to conclude the vow.

original: gding ro bting ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gding ro bting ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should generate the thought, “I am spreading the sitting mat.”

original: mnos pa zhes bya ba ni dang po dge 'dun las sra brkyang du gding ba'i chos gos mnos pa'i che'o //
analyzed: mnos pa zhes bya ba ni dang po dge 'dun las sra brkyang du gding ba'i chos gos mnos pa'i che'o //
translated: Taking up refers to first taking up the robe that is to be spread as the sitting mat from the Saṅgha.

original: rang byed pa zhes bya ba ni gal te chos gos de sngar byas ma zin ba zhig na sra brkyang 'ding ba rang gis bkru ba dang drub pa dang kha bsgyur ba dag la sngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / zin pa zhig drub na rang gis khab srubs gnyis sam gsum 'drub par byed pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: rang byed pa zhes bya ba ni gal te chos gos de sngar byas ma zin ba zhig na sra brkyang 'ding ba rang gis bkru ba dang drub pa dang kha bsgyur ba dag la sngon du 'gro bar bya ba dang / zin pa zhig drub na rang gis khab srubs gnyis sam gsum 'drub par byed pa'i tshe'o //
translated: One's own work means that if one has not yet made the robe, then one should wash, sew, and dye the cloth before spreading the mat. If one has already made the robe, one's own work is when one sews two or three stitches.

original: de'i mjug dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i mjug dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the end of that means

original: sra brkyang gding bar bya ba de bting zin pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang gding bar bya ba de bting zin pa'i tshe'o //
translated: when one has finished spreading the mat.

original: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order means

original: mnos pa'i tshe na gding bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro //🔽rang @160a * //
analyzed: mnos pa'i tshe na gding bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste ma brtsams pa'i phyir ro // rang @160a * //
translated: when one is taking up the practice, one should think, I will spread the mat, because one has not yet begun.

original: byed pa'i tshe na gding ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i tshe na gding ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: When one is doing one's own work, one should think, I am spreading the mat,

original: 'ding ba'i las brtsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ding ba'i las brtsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has begun the work of spreading the mat.

original: de'i mjug dag tu bting ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mjug dag tu bting ngo snyam du sems bskyed par bya ste zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At the end of that, one should think, I have spread the mat, because it is finished.

original: dang po nyams na mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po nyams na mi 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that it does not occur if the first is impaired.

original: mnos pa'i tshe na 'ding bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems bskyed par bya ba de ma byas te nyams na yang 'og ma gnyis byas na sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ba ma yin te 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mnos pa'i tshe na 'ding bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems bskyed par bya ba de ma byas te nyams na yang 'og ma gnyis byas na sra brkyang gding ba mi 'byung ba ma yin te 'byung ngo //
translated: If one does not generate the thought “I will spread it at the time of accepting it,” then even if it is impaired, if the latter two are done, it is not that the spreading of the straw mat does not occur; it occurs.🔽Venerables, tomorrow I will spread the straw mat, so each of you should bring out your robes.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang sra brkyang 'ding bar 'gyur gyi khyed cag gis rang rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes tshogs pa la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la sra brkyang gding bar 'gyur ba'i mdun rol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang sra brkyang 'ding bar 'gyur gyi khyed cag gis rang rang gi chos gos rnams dbyung bar bya'o zhes tshogs pa la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la sra brkyang gding bar 'gyur ba'i mdun rol /
translated: This is said to the assembly.

original: ston zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga'i dgongs kar sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des dge 'dun thams cad mtshams kyi nang du tshogs pa la de skad brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po tshes bco lnga'i dgongs kar sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des dge 'dun thams cad mtshams kyi nang du tshogs pa la de skad brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: The day before the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month, the monk who will spread the straw mat should say this to the entire saṃgha gathered within the confines of the saṃgha.

original: rang rang gi chos gos gsum po dag sngar byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags phyung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang rang gi chos gos gsum po dag sngar byin gyis brlabs pa'i sngags phyung shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of each one should recite the mantra for consecrating his own three Dharma robes is that he should recite the mantra for consecrating the three robes.

original: 'du ba'i skabs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du ba'i skabs rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The time for the assembly is the time for the monks to gather.

original: tshes bcu drug gi nang par sra brkyang gding ba'i don du dge 'dun 'du ba de'i skabs ni gnas mal bsham pa dang gand'i brdung ba dang dris pa'i tshig gis yang dag par bsgom dag ste /
analyzed: tshes bcu drug gi nang par sra brkyang gding ba'i don du dge 'dun 'du ba de'i skabs ni gnas mal bsham pa dang gand'i brdung ba dang dris pa'i tshig gis yang dag par bsgom dag ste /
translated: The time for the assembly is the time for the monks to gather on the morning of the sixteenth day in order to spread out the straw mat. At that time, the bedding should be arranged, the gavel should be struck, and the announcement should be made.

original: de dag sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des rjes su bsgrub cing las su bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des rjes su bsgrub cing las su bya ba'o //
translated: That monk who is spreading out the straw mat should carry out and perform those duties.

original: dris pa'i tshig gis yang dag par bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig gis yang dag par bsgo ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The announcement is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir gand'i brdungs zhes dril ba la 'di'i phyir ro zhes dge slong rnams la lan btab pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams gnas der 'du bar yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ci'i phyir gand'i brdungs zhes dril ba la 'di'i phyir ro zhes dge slong rnams la lan btab pa'i tshig gis dge slong rnams gnas der 'du bar yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: When the monk is asked, Venerable one, why was the gavel struck? he should reply, For this reason, and with those words he should announce to the monks that they should gather in that place.

original: dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bdug spos dri zhim pos bdugs pa du ma gzeb kyi sbrog mar lhan cig bzhag pa thogs te rga na rims su 'dug pas gding bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bdug spos dri zhim pos bdugs pa du ma gzeb kyi sbrog mar lhan cig bzhag pa thogs te rga na rims su 'dug pas gding bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba na /
translated: Having taken up a bundle of robes that have been offered flowers and incense, and that have been fumigated with fragrant incense, and having placed them on the lap of the monk who is spreading the robes, the monk who is spreading the robes should be established in the practice of spreading the robes in the order of seniority.

original: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i chos gos sum phrugs dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bdug spos dri zhim pos bdug pa phrugs gcig gam gnyis sam du ma ji snyed 'byor ba gzeb kyi sprog ma gcig tu lhan cig bzhag pa sra brkyang 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong
analyzed: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i chos gos sum phrugs dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bdug spos dri zhim pos bdug pa phrugs gcig gam gnyis sam du ma ji snyed 'byor ba gzeb kyi sprog ma gcig tu lhan cig bzhag pa sra brkyang 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong
translated: The bundle of robes that have been offered flowers and incense, and that have been fumigated with fragrant incense, and that have been placed together in a bundle, whether one, two, or many, as many as are available, should be placed on the lap of the monk who is spreading the robes.

original: gi pang bar thogs te dge slong rgan rims kyi mdun du 'dug pas sra brkyang gding bar bsgrub @160b bar bya'o //
analyzed: gi pang bar thogs te dge slong rgan rims kyi mdun du 'dug pas sra brkyang gding bar bsgrub @160b bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who is spreading the robes should be established in the practice of spreading the robes by sitting in front of the senior monk in the order of seniority.

original: dus gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: At what time? Therefore it is said:🔽On the sixteenth day.

original: tshes bcu drug la'o zhes bya ba smras te chos bcu drug gi nang par ro //
analyzed: tshes bcu drug la'o zhes bya ba smras te chos bcu drug gi nang par ro //
translated: In the first half of the month.

original: zla ba gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: zla ba gang gi tshe zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: In which month? Therefore it is said:

original: ston zla 'bring po'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The middle autumn month.

original: ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la'o //
analyzed: ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la'o //
translated: The middle autumn month is the sixteenth day of the month.

original: ci zhig gis bsgrub bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig gis bsgrub bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what is it accomplished? Therefore, it is said:

original: lan gsum bzlas pas so zhes bya bas smras so //
analyzed: lan gsum bzlas pas so zhes bya bas smras so //
translated: By reciting the three refuges.

original: ci zhig lan gsum bzlas pa zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig lan gsum bzlas pa zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is recited three times? Therefore, it is said:

original: gding ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gding ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is spread.

original: je dang por dge slong thams cad la gding ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pas bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: je dang por dge slong thams cad la gding ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pas bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: First, it is accomplished by reciting the mantra May the saṅgha of noble ones listen! three times to all the monks.

original: 'di'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for this is:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: chos gos 'di ni dge 'dun gyis sra brkyang du blo mthun par bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: chos gos 'di ni dge 'dun gyis sra brkyang du blo mthun par bgyis pa lags /
translated: This Dharma robe has been made by the saṅgha in agreement for the rainy season.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pa ni sra brkyang 'ding bar bskos pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pa ni sra brkyang 'ding bar bskos pa lags te /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, have been appointed to spread the rainy season.

original: 'di ltar gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde bar gnas par bgyi ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad pa'i slad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams bde bar gnas par bgyi ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad pa'i slad du /
translated: In this way, in order to gather the saṅgha together, to make the monks live comfortably, and to use the gifts given by the donors,

original: bdag sra brkyang 'ding ba dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pas chos gos 'dis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang gding bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdag sra brkyang 'ding ba dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi pas chos gos 'dis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang gding bar bgyi'o //
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, will spread this robe for the saṅgha to spread out.

original: gnas gang du sra brkyang bting bar chos gos rnying pa rnams dang yang mi 'bral na /
analyzed: gnas gang du sra brkyang bting bar chos gos rnying pa rnams dang yang mi 'bral na /
translated: In whatever place the spread-out robe is not separated from the old robes,

original: gsar pa rnams dang lta ci smos zhes lan gsum bzlas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsar pa rnams dang lta ci smos zhes lan gsum bzlas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: how much less so from the new ones.”

original: dge slong re re'i mdun du 'dug ste bting ngo zhes go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong re re'i mdun du 'dug ste bting ngo zhes go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand that it is spread out in front of each monk.

original: de ltar dge 'dun thams cad la gding ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pas bsgrubs nas de'i 'og tu sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des gnas brtan man chad nas dge slong thams cad kyi mdun du rgan rims kyis 'dug ste /
analyzed: de ltar dge 'dun thams cad la gding ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum bzlas pas bsgrubs nas de'i 'og tu sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong des gnas brtan man chad nas dge slong thams cad kyi mdun du rgan rims kyis 'dug ste /
translated: Having thus accomplished the spreading to all the Saṅgha by reciting the mantra I spread it to all the Saṅgha three times, then the monk who spreads the rainy season retreat should sit in order of seniority in front of all the monks, starting with the elder.

original: dge slong re re la yang bting ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum gsum bzlas pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong re re la yang bting ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum gsum bzlas pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: He should accomplish it by reciting the mantra I spread it to each monk three times to each one.

original: 'di'i sngags ni gnas brtan nam btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni gnas brtan nam btsun pa'am tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: The mantra for this is: Venerable elder, or venerable, or venerable one endowed with life, please listen.

original: chos gos 'di ni dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang du blo mthun par bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: chos gos 'di ni dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang du blo mthun par bgyis pa lags /
translated: This Dharma robe is agreed upon by the Saṅgha as the rainy season robe.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ni sra brkyang 'ding bar bskos pa lags te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ni sra brkyang 'ding bar bskos pa lags te /
translated: I, the monk named so-and-so, am appointed to spread the rainy season retreat.

original: de'i slad du 'di ltar gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams la bde bar gnas par bgyi ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad pa'i slad du /🔽bdag sra brkyang 'ding ba dge slong @161a * //
analyzed: de'i slad du 'di ltar gnas bsdu ba dang / dge slong rnams la bde bar gnas par bgyi ba dang / sbyin pa po rnams kyis sbyin par bya ba'i chos yongs su spyad pa'i slad du / bdag sra brkyang 'ding ba dge slong @161a * //
translated: Therefore, in order to gather the saṅgha together like this, to bring about the well-being of the monks, and to make the gifts of the donors fully utilized,🔽I, the monk so-and-so, will now set out the long tongue.🔽

original: ming 'di zhes bgyi pas chos gos 'dis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang bting las te /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bgyi pas chos gos 'dis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang bting las te /
translated: For that purpose, I, the monk so-and-so, will spread this robe for the saṅgha to spread the floor covers.

original: gnas gang du sra brkyang bting bar chos gos rnying pa rnams dang yang mi 'bral na /
analyzed: gnas gang du sra brkyang bting bar chos gos rnying pa rnams dang yang mi 'bral na /
translated: In whatever place the floor covers are spread, the old robes will not be separated,

original: gsar pa rnams dang lta ci smos zhes lan gsum bzlas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsar pa rnams dang lta ci smos zhes lan gsum bzlas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: let alone the new ones.”

original: gzhan gyis ni legs par bting ngo shin tu bting ngo 'di la rnyed pa dang phan yon gang yod pa de bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni legs par bting ngo shin tu bting ngo 'di la rnyed pa dang phan yon gang yod pa de bdag gi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Others should say, ‘It is well spread, it is very well spread. Whatever gain and benefit there is from this belongs to me.’

original: de ltar sra brkyang 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong des gnas brtan man chad nas dge slong thams cad kyi mdun du rgan rims kyis 'dug ste /
analyzed: de ltar sra brkyang 'ding bar byed pa'i dge slong des gnas brtan man chad nas dge slong thams cad kyi mdun du rgan rims kyis 'dug ste /
translated: Thus, the monk who spreads the rainy season retreat in this way should sit in the order of seniority in the presence of all the monks, beginning with the most senior monk.

original: dge slong re re la bting ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum gsum bzlas pas bsgrubs pa na /
analyzed: dge slong re re la bting ngo zhes bya ba'i sngags lan gsum gsum bzlas pas bsgrubs pa na /
translated: He should accomplish the recitation of the mantra three times for each monk, saying, “I spread the rainy season retreat for each monk.”

original: gnas brtan la sogs pa dge slong gzhan de res kyang de'i 'phral 'phral la sngags 'di la na re re bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan la sogs pa dge slong gzhan de res kyang de'i 'phral 'phral la sngags 'di la na re re bzlas par bya'o //
translated: The most senior monk and so on, each in turn, should immediately recite this mantra once.

original: 'di'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for this is:

original: legs par bting ngo shing tu bting ngo //
analyzed: legs par bting ngo shing tu bting ngo //
translated: “Well spread! Very well spread!

original: 'di la rnyed pa dang phan yon gang yod pa de bdag gi yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rnyed pa dang phan yon gang yod pa de bdag gi yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Whatever gain and benefit there is in this belongs to me.”

original: 'di la rjes su yi rang ba ni nyams su myong ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su yi rang ba ni nyams su myong ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Rejoicing in this is like experiencing it.

original: gang la las sra brkyang 'ding ba 'di nyams su myong ba la sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung bar de bzhin du gang la la sra brkyang 'ding pa na gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sra brkyang bting ba 'di nyams su ma
analyzed: gang la las sra brkyang 'ding ba 'di nyams su myong ba la sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung bar de bzhin du gang la la sra brkyang 'ding pa na gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis sra brkyang bting ba 'di nyams su ma
translated: Just as the benefits and advantages of the observance of the poṣadha vows arise for those who actually observe the poṣadha vows,

original: myong bas gnyid sad pa la sogs pa'i dus na sra brkyang bting bar thos nas 'di la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de la yang sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong bas gnyid sad pa la sogs pa'i dus na sra brkyang bting bar thos nas 'di la rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de la yang sra brkyang bting ba'i phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: so too, the benefits and advantages of the observance of the poṣadha vows arise for those who, due to the influence of sleep and so on, do not experience the observance of the poṣadha vows but who, when they awaken from sleep and so on, hear about the observance of the poṣadha vows and rejoice in it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gang gi sra brkyang 'ding ba mngon sum du gyur ba na gnyid la sogs pa'i dbang gis las nyams su ma myong yang byis sad pa na rjes su yi rang ba byed na rjes su yi rang ba de ni las nyams su myong ba dang 'dra bar shes
analyzed: gang gi sra brkyang 'ding ba mngon sum du gyur ba na gnyid la sogs pa'i dbang gis las nyams su ma myong yang byis sad pa na rjes su yi rang ba byed na rjes su yi rang ba de ni las nyams su myong ba dang 'dra bar shes
translated: Even though the observance of the poṣadha vows is not experienced due to the influence of sleep and so on, when the ignorant rejoice in it upon awakening, that rejoicing is known to be like the experience of the action.

original: par bya'o // 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las de thos nas legs par bting ngo shin tu bting ngo zhes rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de dag gis kyang sra brkyang bting bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: par bya'o // 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las de thos nas legs par bting ngo shin tu bting ngo zhes rjes su yi rang bar byed pa de dag gis kyang sra brkyang bting bar brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text of the scriptures states: “Having heard that, they should say, ‘Well spread! Very well spread!’ and those who rejoice in that should also say, ‘The rains retreat has been well spread.’”

original: gang gis de'i rjes su yi rang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de'i rjes su yi rang bar bya zhe na /
translated: By whom should one rejoice in that?

original: de'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum du gyur pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “By those who are present.”

original: de bting ba'i phyir tshogs pa byin pas so //
analyzed: de bting ba'i phyir tshogs pa byin pas so //
translated: Because they spread the rains retreat, they are the assembly that gives.

original: da ni sra brkyang gding ba'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de ji ltar yongs su @161b bskyang pa'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sra brkyang gding ba'i dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de ji ltar yongs su @161b bskyang pa'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the ritual for how the monk who spreads the rains retreat should care for the Dharma robe spread for the saṅgha during the rains retreat will be explained.

original: de'i phyir dus dus su bsang bar bya ba srad par bya sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus dus su bsang bar bya ba srad par bya sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “From time to time it should be aired, stretched, and shaken.”

original: ser bu'i dad la bsad pa dang nyi ma la bsrad pa dang / rdul sprug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ser bu'i dad la bsad pa dang nyi ma la bsrad pa dang / rdul sprug par bya ba'o //
translated: It should be aired in the breeze, stretched in the sun, and shaken to remove dust.

original: khyim du ba can dang rdul can du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim du ba can dang rdul can du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not keep it in a smoky or dusty place.

original: gnas khang la sogs pa gang du du ba 'thul ba dang rdul 'thul ba der gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnas khang la sogs pa gang du du ba 'thul ba dang rdul 'thul ba der gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not keep it in a place where smoke or dust is present, such as a house.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang sra brkyang du gding ba'i chos gos de'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang du gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang sra brkyang du gding ba'i chos gos de'o //
translated: One should not keep it in a royal palace.

original: de dang 'bral bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang 'bral bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not be separated from it.

original: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong de sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs kyis chod par 'bral bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong de sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs kyis chod par 'bral bar mi bya'o //
translated: The monk who has spread the sitting mat should not be separated from the robe that he has spread as a sitting mat, by going outside the boundary at dawn.

original: khyer te gzhan du 'gro bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyer te gzhan du 'gro bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not take it and go elsewhere.

original: des sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de khyer te mtshams kyi phyi rol gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan nam grong gzhan du 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: des sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos de khyer te mtshams kyi phyi rol gyi gtsug lag khang gzhan nam grong gzhan du 'gro bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: The monk who has spread the sitting mat should not take the robe that he has spread as a sitting mat and go outside the boundary to another monastery or another village.

original: mi gtsang ba'i skyabs su 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i skyabs su 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not enter a place of unclean refuge.

original: des chos gos de khyer te phyi rol che chung gi gnas su 'jug par mi bya'o //🔽bla gab med par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang de khyer te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des chos gos de khyer te phyi rol che chung gi gnas su 'jug par mi bya'o // bla gab med par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang de khyer te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not enter a large or small house outside with that robe.🔽One should not stay in the open air with that robe.

original: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong las gzhan pa'i gang zag gis chos gos de gzhag pa dang bsrel ba dang bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang 'ding ba'i dge slong las gzhan pa'i gang zag gis chos gos de gzhag pa dang bsrel ba dang bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not place, carry, or send that robe to a person other than the monk who spreads the straw mat.

original: de dag ni sra brkyang gding ba'i cho ga yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni sra brkyang gding ba'i cho ga yin te /
translated: These are the rules for spreading the straw mat.

original: dper na gos gding ba dang 'dra ba'i sra brkyang spang leb yin pa dang 'dra bar dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams gyi phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung ba'i sra brkyang yang chos gos 'di yin pas /
analyzed: dper na gos gding ba dang 'dra ba'i sra brkyang spang leb yin pa dang 'dra bar dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams gyi phan yon dang rnyed pa 'byung ba'i sra brkyang yang chos gos 'di yin pas /
translated: Just as a mat is spread, the straw mat is spread. Just as a mat is spread, the rainy season is entered. Just as a mat is spread, the robe is spread.

original: de'i phyir sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sra brkyang dang 'dra bas sra brkyang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is like a straw mat, it is called a straw mat.

original: de gding ba'i cho ga ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: de gding ba'i cho ga ni ji skad bstan pa de dag yin no //
translated: The rite of spreading is just as it has been taught.

original: sra brkyang bting ba'i cho ga bshad zin to /
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba'i cho ga bshad zin to /
translated: The rite of spreading the straw mat has been explained.

original: // / da ni sra brkyang dbyung ba'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni sra brkyang dbyung ba'i cho ga bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the rite of taking up the straw mat should be explained.

original: de'i phyir dbyung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, taking up is of two kinds:

original: rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba dang bcos ma'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba dang bcos ma'o zhes bya ba smras te / rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: natural, and artificial.🔽Natural means

original: byed rgyu med par rang nyid 'ding ba'i 'jug pa dang 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu med par rang nyid 'ding ba'i 'jug pa dang 'bral ba'o //
translated: the natural taking up of spreading without a cause.

original: bcos ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcos ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Artificial means

original: las la sogs pa'i tshogs blo sngon du btang ste dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: las la sogs pa'i tshogs blo sngon du btang ste dbyung ba'o //
translated: taking up by a gathering of monks, etc.🔽By what kind of natural taking up is it accomplished?

original: rang 'jug pa dang bral ba rnam pa gang gis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba ni /
analyzed: rang 'jug pa dang bral ba rnam pa gang gis 'grub par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba ni /
translated: The natural taking up is

original: sra brkyang pas mtshams @162a * //
analyzed: sra brkyang pas mtshams @162a * //
translated: the taking up of the straw mat by the end of the summer retreat.

original: gzhan du phyin pa dang byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar ba dang / de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan du phyin pa dang byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar ba dang / de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that one is separated from the rite of entering the rainy season retreat if one goes elsewhere, or if the consecration of the retreat site is not performed, or if dawn breaks while one is within the boundary, or if one is separated from the saṃgha that belongs to the same region of the retreat site.

original: rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba ni gnas skabs gsum po 'di dag la 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang 'jug pa dang 'bral ba ni gnas skabs gsum po 'di dag la 'byung ste /
translated: One is separated from the rite of entering the rainy season retreat in three circumstances:

original: sra brkyang bas mtshams kyi gnas gzhan du phyin pa dang / mtshams gang du de bting ba'i mtshams der byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge slong thams cad ma lus par med pa'i tshe der skya rengs shar ba dang / byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge 'dun gyi na mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa gang zag gang la rgyun bcad pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: sra brkyang bas mtshams kyi gnas gzhan du phyin pa dang / mtshams gang du de bting ba'i mtshams der byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge slong thams cad ma lus par med pa'i tshe der skya rengs shar ba dang / byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge 'dun gyi na mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa gang zag gang la rgyun bcad pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: if one goes to another place within the boundary due to the rite of spreading the new sitting mat; if dawn breaks while one is within the boundary, but all the fully ordained monks who consecrate the boundary are not present; or if one is separated from the saṃgha that belongs to the same region of the retreat site.

original: de la dang po gnyis kyis ni der gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad kyi sra brkyang bting ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis kyis ni der gtogs pa'i dge 'dun thams cad kyi sra brkyang bting ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: The first two types of monks who leave the saṃgha that possesses the maṇḍala are excluded from the maṇḍala’s own rite of spreading the straw mat.

original: tha mal ni gang zag gang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa rgyun chad pa de nyi tshe ba'i sra brkyang bting ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha mal ni gang zag gang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa rgyun chad pa de nyi tshe ba'i sra brkyang bting ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: The last type of monk who is excluded from the maṇḍala’s own rite of spreading the straw mat is the individual who is a member of that maṇḍala but whose continuum has been severed.

original: sra brkyang bting ba ni dbyar gyi gnas kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba ni dbyar gyi gnas kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the rite of spreading the straw mat follows the rite of the rainy season retreat.🔽Just as the rite of spreading the straw mat is not performed in a place other than the place of the rainy season retreat, in the same way, the rite of spreading the straw mat is excluded from the rite of the rainy season retreat in another place.

original: gang gi phyir ji ltar sra brkyang gding ba de'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas su mi 'byung ba de bzhin du dbyung ba yang gnas gzhan du gnas pa nyid na 'jig bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sra brkyang des mtshams gzhan du phyin na sra🔽brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ji ltar sra brkyang gding ba de'i phyir dbyar gnas pa'i gnas las gzhan pa'i gnas su mi 'byung ba de bzhin du dbyung ba yang gnas gzhan du gnas pa nyid na 'jig bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sra brkyang des mtshams gzhan du phyin na sra🔽brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the rite of spreading the straw mat is performed in another place, the rite of spreading the straw mat is excluded from the rite of the rainy season retreat.

original: gang gi phyir byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge slong thams cad sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas de nas bral bar gyur pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i dge slong thams cad sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas de nas bral bar gyur pa nyid yin na /
translated: Because all fully ordained monks who consecrate the boundary leave that place where the boundary is spread.

original: ji ltar snam sbyar la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gzhan dag gis rgyun bcad pa nyid dang / mtshams tha dad pa na gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar snam sbyar la sogs pa byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos gos gzhan dag gis rgyun bcad pa nyid dang / mtshams tha dad pa na gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the other robes such as the patched robe that are consecrated are severed and remain in different boundaries,

original: sra brkyang 'di yang rgyun chad pa nyid na de la 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid du 'byung zhing /
analyzed: sra brkyang 'di yang rgyun chad pa nyid na de la 'bral ba'i spang ba nyid du 'byung zhing /
translated: so too, if the boundary is severed, then the offense of separation occurs.

original: spang pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos gos la ji ltar sra brkyang gding ba nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: spang pa nyid du gyur pa'i chos gos la ji ltar sra brkyang gding ba nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the offense of discarding occurs for the robe that is discarded, so too,🔽if the boundary is discarded, then the offense of discarding occurs.

original: byung ba yang 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar na yang sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byung ba yang 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar na yang sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the sun rises within the boundary without the consecrator, then the boundary is severed and the offense of separation occurs.

original: gang gi phyir dge slong gang dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyis dbyar gyi gnas de'i mtshams kyi dkyil @162b 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa des dkyil 'khor de gtan gtong zhing rgyun gcod par byed pa de la dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag sra brkyang
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge slong gang dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyis dbyar gyi gnas de'i mtshams kyi dkyil @162b 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa des dkyil 'khor de gtan gtong zhing rgyun gcod par byed pa de la dge slong lhag ma gzhan dag sra brkyang
translated: Because if the Saṅgha of monks who have agreed to stay in a rainy season retreat in a certain place were to abandon and discontinue that boundary enclosure of the rainy season residence, then the other remaining monks who are staying at ease in that spread-out retreat

original: bting ba de la bag yangs su gnas pa gang yin pa nyid dang / dge slong de dag la sra brkyang bting ba de phan yon dang rnyed pa'i gzhir gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur pa de'i phyir dkyil 'khor kyi khongs su gtogs pa bcad na yang sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: bting ba de la bag yangs su gnas pa gang yin pa nyid dang / dge slong de dag la sra brkyang bting ba de phan yon dang rnyed pa'i gzhir gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur pa de'i phyir dkyil 'khor kyi khongs su gtogs pa bcad na yang sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro
translated: would lose the benefits and the basis for gain that is the spread-out retreat. Therefore, even if the boundary enclosure is abandoned, the spread-out retreat is automatically relinquished.

original: // 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: // 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gang gi phyir de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes bya ba'i gang zag gcig gis sra brkyang bting ba de 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zag gang dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyi dbyar gyi gnas de'i mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes bya ba'i gang zag gcig gis sra brkyang bting ba de 'jig par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gang zag gang dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyi dbyar gyi gnas de'i mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor
translated: Because the saṃgha that belongs to the maṇḍala of that saṃgha is destroyed by a single person called a schismatic, therefore, the saṃgha that belongs to the maṇḍala of the boundary of the rainy season retreat of the saṃgha that has accepted the rainy season retreat is destroyed.

original: gyi khongs su gtogs pa gtan pa btang zhing rgyun bcad pa de la sra brkyang dbyung ba'i 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyi khongs su gtogs pa gtan pa btang zhing rgyun bcad pa de la sra brkyang dbyung ba'i 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: The saṃgha that belongs to the boundary of the rainy season retreat of the saṃgha that has accepted the rainy season retreat is freed from the entry of the lifting of the rainy season retreat.

original: bting ba'i rgyun dang 'bral ba dang rjes su 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bting ba'i rgyun dang 'bral ba dang rjes su 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is freed from the continuity of the lifting of the rainy season retreat and freed from subsequent entry.

original: ro gcig pa'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the single entity is destroyed.

original: rang 'jug pa dang bral ba rnam pa gsum smos pa de dag las dang po gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyas par bshad zin na /
analyzed: rang 'jug pa dang bral ba rnam pa gsum smos pa de dag las dang po gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rgyas par bshad zin na /
translated: The characteristics of the first two of those three types of freedom from entry have already been explained in detail.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes smos pa de rnam pa gang gis dus gang gi tshe na de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par 'gyur ba de ma bstan pas /
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes smos pa de rnam pa gang gis dus gang gi tshe na de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par 'gyur ba de ma bstan pas /
translated: The phrase “his circle is split” is not explained in terms of what kind of form and at what time his circle is split.

original: de'i phyir bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dir skabs gzhan bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'dir skabs gzhan bstan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand this, another topic is presented here.

original: de'i phyir ma lta bu'i tshig drug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma lta bu'i tshig drug ste /
translated: Thus, there are six statements like “mother.”

original: sbyor bas 'gro ba dang / nges par byed pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / zhig par 'gyur ba dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa dang / mtshams las 'da' ba'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: sbyor bas 'gro ba dang / nges par byed pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba dang / zhig par 'gyur ba dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa dang / mtshams las 'da' ba'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: They are: going by application, making certain, becoming final, being destroyed, the stream of thought being cut off, and transgressing the boundary.

original: de dag ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes bya ba de'i bye brag tu bshad par gyur pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa zhes bya ba de'i bye brag tu bshad par gyur pa dag yin te /
translated: These are the explanations of the phrase “his circle is split.”

original: tshig de dag ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa'i gang zag de'i sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur pa dag gis ma dang 'dra zhing ma'i gnas lta bu dag yin pas de'i phyir ma lta bu'i tshig drug ces bya🔽ste / sbyor bas 'gro ba la sogs pa drug po dag byung ba ni de'i dkyil @163a * //
analyzed: tshig de dag ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa'i gang zag de'i sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur pa dag gis ma dang 'dra zhing ma'i gnas lta bu dag yin pas de'i phyir ma lta bu'i tshig drug ces bya ste / sbyor bas 'gro ba la sogs pa drug po dag byung ba ni de'i dkyil @163a * //
translated: Therefore, they are called the six terms like a mother,

original: 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs ba chad pa de yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs ba chad pa de yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six activities of going and so on occur for that person who is expelled from the community of that saṃgha.

original: de la sbyor bas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sbyor bas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Going by means of preparation means

original: sbyor ba nges pas mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba nges pas mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba'o //
translated: going beyond the boundary through the certainty of preparation.

original: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Certainty means

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du nges pa med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du nges pa med par byed pa'o //
translated: making the boundary uncertain.

original: mthar thug par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Reaching the end means

original: chos gos brtsams pa zin par byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos brtsams pa zin par byas pa'o //
translated: completing the preparation of the robe.

original: zhig par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos brtsams pa ma zin pa'i bar skabs su rkyen 'ga' zhig gis rgyun chad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhig par gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos brtsams pa ma zin pa'i bar skabs su rkyen 'ga' zhig gis rgyun chad par gyur pa'o //
translated: “It is destroyed” means that the continuity of the robe is interrupted by some condition before the robe is completed.

original: bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The continuity of the intention is interrupted” means

original: chos gos la re ba byung ba rgyun chad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos la re ba byung ba rgyun chad par gyur pa'o //
translated: that the continuity of the expectation of the robe is interrupted.

original: mtshams las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is beyond the boundary” means

original: the tshom za ba'i sbyor bas mtshams las 'da' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i sbyor bas mtshams las 'da' bar byed pa'o //
translated: that one goes beyond the boundary with the application of doubt.

original: de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de ji ltar chad par brjod par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de ji ltar chad par brjod par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is it said that they are expelled from the community of that maṇḍala?

original: de la de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “That is so for that.”

original: gang zag gang sbyor bas 'gro ba la sogs pa rang 'jug pa dang bral ba'i rgyu kun du spyod pa de la de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa de rnam par gzhag gi dge 'dun thams cad la ni de rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang zag gang sbyor bas 'gro ba la sogs pa rang 'jug pa dang bral ba'i rgyu kun du spyod pa de la de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa de rnam par gzhag gi dge 'dun thams cad la ni de rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: For that person who engages in going and so forth with application, the cause of being separated from the engagement of oneself, that expulsion from the community of that maṇḍala is established, but it is not established for the entire saṅgha.

original: ji ltar sra brkyang gis mtshams gzhan du phyin pa dang byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar ba zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa gnyis kyis dge 'dun thams cad la sra brkyang dbyung bar rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur
analyzed: ji ltar sra brkyang gis mtshams gzhan du phyin pa dang byin gyis rlob par byed pa med par mtshams kyi nang du skya rengs shar ba zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa gnyis kyis dge 'dun thams cad la sra brkyang dbyung bar rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur
translated: Just as the boundary is released by the two previously explained factors, the dawn rising within the boundary without going to another boundary or consecrating the boundary, all monks are released from the boundary.🔽

original: ba de ltar 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba de ltar 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as the proclamation of the end of the rains retreat is not done in another boundary, and the proclamation of the rains retreat is not done inside the boundary without consecration, in the same way, this does not change.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gang zag gang la de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par gyur pa de nyid la sra brkyang 'byung bar rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba te /
analyzed: gang zag gang la de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par gyur pa de nyid la sra brkyang 'byung bar rang 'jug pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba te /
translated: For any person who is expelled from the mandala, the proclamation of the end of the rains retreat is not done for that person alone, and the proclamation of the rains retreat is not done for that person alone.

original: de nyid kyi sra brkyang bting ba las gyur pa'i rnyed pa dang phan yon dag ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi sra brkyang bting ba las gyur pa'i rnyed pa dang phan yon dag ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The acquisition and benefits that arise from the proclamation of the end of the rains retreat for that person alone are stopped.

original: des dge 'dun gzhan gyi ni ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dge 'dun gzhan gyi ni ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not stopped for other saṅghas.

original: de ltar na ma lta bu'i tshig drug po de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur ba de bstan to ;
analyzed: de ltar na ma lta bu'i tshig drug po de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur ba de bstan to ;
translated: Thus, these six terms like mother indicate that one who belongs to that maṇḍala is expelled.

original: / dus gang gi tshe ma lta bu'i tshig drug po de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: / dus gang gi tshe ma lta bu'i tshig drug po de dag gis de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: At what time is one who belongs to that maṇḍala expelled?

original: mtshams las 'das pa na de 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshams las 'das pa na de 'grub po zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “When one transgresses the boundary, that is accomplished.”

original: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i mtshams las 'das pa na de chad pa de 'grub @163b po ;
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i mtshams las 'das pa na de chad pa de 'grub @163b po ;
translated: When one transgresses the boundary of that maṇḍala, that expulsion is accomplished.

original: / ci gang yang rung bas mtshams las 'da' na 'am zhe na /🔽ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: / ci gang yang rung bas mtshams las 'da' na 'am zhe na / ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: Is it the case that anyone who transgresses the boundary is expelled?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, therefore it is said, “By the mind of a nonreturner.”

original: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyis mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gang na sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos 'dug pa der phyir mi 'ong bar dam bcas pa'i sems kyis mtshams las 'das te 'gro na de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de
analyzed: dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge 'dun gyis mtshams kyi dkyil 'khor gang na sra brkyang du bting ba'i chos gos 'dug pa der phyir mi 'ong bar dam bcas pa'i sems kyis mtshams las 'das te 'gro na de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de
translated: The Saṅgha who have taken the vow of the rainy season retreat who go beyond the boundary of the enclosure where the Dharma robe spread for the rainy season retreat exists, with the mind of a nonreturner, then at that time, those who belong to that enclosure

original: chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chad par 'gyur te /
translated: are expelled.

original: 'dis ni sbyor bas 'gro ba de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor bas 'gro ba de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches that those who belong to the enclosure of the one who goes by preparation are expelled.🔽Is expulsion only by going by preparation?

original: ci sbyor bas 'gro ba 'ba' zhig gis do chad par zad dam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci sbyor bas 'gro ba 'ba' zhig gis do chad par zad dam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: No, therefore it is said:

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du de skyes na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du de skyes na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If it arises outside the boundary, also.

original: mtshams kyi nang nas 'gro ba'i tshe na phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems ma skyes su zin kyang mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa de nyid na phyir mi 'ong bar nges pa'i sems de skyes na yang /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang nas 'gro ba'i tshe na phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems ma skyes su zin kyang mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa de nyid na phyir mi 'ong bar nges pa'i sems de skyes na yang /
translated: Even though the mind of a nonreturner does not arise when going outside the boundary, if the mind definitely not returning arises when one reaches outside the boundary,

original: de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, one is expelled from the retinue of that maṇḍala.

original: 'dis ni nges par byed pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs par chad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par byed pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs par chad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that one is expelled from the retinue of that maṇḍala by the act of expulsion.

original: ci bye brag med pa kho nas mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa na de chad par 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci bye brag med pa kho nas mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa na de chad par 'gyur ram zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Does one become expelled from the retinue of that maṇḍala at that time, when the nonreturner mind arises, regardless of whether one has gone beyond the boundary or not?

original: de'i phyir chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med na de'i tshe nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med na de'i tshe nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, that is not so. Therefore it says: “When there is no connection with the thought of making Dharma robes.”

original: chos gos bya'o snyam du sems pa'i chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa des /
analyzed: chos gos bya'o snyam du sems pa'i chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa gang yin pa des /
translated: The thought of making Dharma robes is the thought of making Dharma robes, thinking, “I will make Dharma robes.”

original: der ro gcig pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang rjes su song pa nyid gang yin pa'i rjes su 'brel ba de med na /
analyzed: der ro gcig pa nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa nyid dang rjes su song pa nyid gang yin pa'i rjes su 'brel ba de med na /
translated: When there is no connection with that, no connection with the thought of making Dharma robes, no single taste, no connection with the same taste, no following, no subsequent engagement, no subsequent attainment,

original: mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe nyid na de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de'i chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa'i dus de'i tshe nyid na de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de'i chad par 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind of a nonreturner arises at a time that is beyond the boundary or outside the boundary, at that very time, one who belongs to that boundary is expelled.

original: 'dis ni sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges par byed par de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs bstan to /
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges par byed par de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs bstan to /
translated: This passage explains the two types of expulsion by means of preparation and by means of the rite.

original: ci chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis de'i tshe chad par 'gyur bar zad dam zhe na ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir yod na byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis de'i tshe chad par 'gyur bar zad dam zhe na ma yin no // de'i phyir yod na byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Does expulsion occur only when one is not connected to the thought of making robes?🔽No, it also occurs when one is connected to that thought.

original: gal te chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa yod na ni de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par mi 'gyur @164a * //
analyzed: gal te chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa yod na ni de'i tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par mi 'gyur @164a * //
translated: If one is connected to the thought of making robes, then one is not expelled from that boundary.

original: te ; gang gi tshe chos gos byed par 'gyur ba nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de yang chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: te ; gang gi tshe chos gos byed par 'gyur ba nyid rgyun chad par 'gyur ba de nyid kyi tshe de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de yang chad par 'gyur te /
translated: When the process of making the robe is interrupted, then the saṃgha is also interrupted.

original: 'dis kyang sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges par byed pa de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges par byed pa de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the other states of the two types of going and determining through application.🔽Does the saṃgha break up merely through the absence of the intention to make the robe outside the boundary or beyond the time?

original: ci mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis de chad par 'gyur bar zad dam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci mtshams las 'das pa'i dus dang mtshams kyi phyi rol du chos gos bya ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis de chad par 'gyur bar zad dam zhe na ma yin te de'i phyir /
translated: No, therefore it is said:

original: phyir 'ongs na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phyir 'ongs na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: When returning, it also breaks.

original: sra brkyang gding ba'i mtshams su phyir 'ongs na yang chos gos byed par 'gyur ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa nyid chad par gyur na de'i tshe yang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sra brkyang gding ba'i mtshams su phyir 'ongs na yang chos gos byed par 'gyur ba'i bsam pas rjes su 'brel pa nyid chad par gyur na de'i tshe yang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa de chad par 'gyur te /
translated: When returning to the boundary of the robe-making ceremony, if the saṃgha breaks up due to the absence of the intention to make the robe, then at that time the saṃgha that belongs to that boundary also breaks up.

original: gang zag de nyi tshe la sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dis kyang sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges bar byed pa de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag de nyi tshe la sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dis kyang sbyor bas 'gro ba dang nges bar byed pa de gnyis kyi bye brag gi gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
translated: This also teaches the other specific states of the two, going by means of preparation and going by means of definite separation.

original: byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad na'o zhes gang smos pa de la byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad pa'i gnas skabs du yod ce na /
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad na'o zhes gang smos pa de la byed par 'gyur ba nyid chad pa'i gnas skabs du yod ce na /
translated: As for the phrase “if the state of being a goer is severed,” how many states of severing the state of being a goer are there?

original: de'i phyir byed par 'gyur ba'i mthar thug pa dang brtsams pa zhig pa dang bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa gsum la de gnas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byed par 'gyur ba'i mthar thug pa dang brtsams pa zhig pa dang bsam pa'i rgyun chad pa gsum la de gnas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “It abides in three states: the final state of being a goer, the state of having begun but not yet completed the action of going, and the state of having interrupted the continuum of intention.”

original: chos gos bya'o snyam du bsams pa gang yin ba de mthar thug par gyur pa dang / brtsams pa zhig par gyur pa dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad par gyur ba zhes bya ba de gsum gyi gnas skabs la byed par 'gyur ba chad pa des gnas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos gos bya'o snyam du bsams pa gang yin ba de mthar thug par gyur pa dang / brtsams pa zhig par gyur pa dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad par gyur ba zhes bya ba de gsum gyi gnas skabs la byed par 'gyur ba chad pa des gnas par sbyar ro //
translated: The three occasions are: when the thought “I will make a Dharma robe” is completed, when the work on it is destroyed, and when the continuity of the thought is interrupted.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The passage is explained as follows.

original: chos gos byed par 'dod pa de mthar thug par gyur pa'i dus dang / de brtsams pa zhig par gyur pa'i dus dang / de'i bya ba'i bsam pa'i rgyun chad par gyur pa'i dus na yang byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de rgyun chad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos byed par 'dod pa de mthar thug par gyur pa'i dus dang / de brtsams pa zhig par gyur pa'i dus dang / de'i bya ba'i bsam pa'i rgyun chad par gyur pa'i dus na yang byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba de rgyun chad par rig par bya'o //
translated: When the thought “I will make a Dharma robe” is completed, when the work on it is destroyed, and when the continuity of the thought of making it is interrupted, the continuity of the action is known to be interrupted.

original: de lta bas na phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba 'am /
translated: Therefore, when a non-returner passes beyond the boundary with a non-returner mind,

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa'i gang zag chos gos byed par 'gyur ba nyid mthar thug par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa'i gang zag chos gos byed par 'gyur ba nyid mthar thug par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: or when a non-returner mind arises outside the boundary, the person making a Dharma robe will complete it.

original: brtsams pa zhig par gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: brtsams pa zhig par gyur ba 'am /
translated: If the rite is destroyed or

original: bya ba'i bsam pa rgyun chad par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad @164b pa yin pas /
analyzed: bya ba'i bsam pa rgyun chad par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad @164b pa yin pas /
translated: if the intention to perform it is interrupted, then the rite is interrupted.

original: de la sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the spreading of the straw mat is suspended, and one is excluded from the rite.

original: 'dis ni mthar thug par gyur pa dang / zhig par gyur pa dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthar thug par gyur pa dang / zhig par gyur pa dang / bsam pa'i rgyun chad pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that the rite is interrupted by the completion of the rite, by the destruction of the rite, and by the interruption of the continuity of the intention.

original: ci nges par gyur pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par 'gyur ba zad dam zhi na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci nges par gyur pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad par 'gyur ba zad dam zhi na ma yin te /
translated: Is it only by the completion of the rite that the rite is interrupted?

original: de'i phyir yid gnyis ni nges par 'byin par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid gnyis ni nges par 'byin par byed pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, it is not. Therefore, it is said: Doubt is like the one who causes the rite to be suspended.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa de gnyis ni nges pa des de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du phyir mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa de gnyis ni nges pa des de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang bral bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: One who transgresses the boundary with anāgāmin mind and one who generates anāgāmin mind outside the boundary are both expelled from the maṇḍala circle of that saṃgha and are suspended from their duties.

original: yid gnyis kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du yid gnyis za bas kyang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yid gnyis kyis mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du yid gnyis za bas kyang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One who transgresses the boundary with doubt and one who generates doubt outside the boundary are also expelled from the maṇḍala circle of that saṃgha and are suspended from their duties.

original: ci'i phyir 'ong bar bya 'am 'on te phyir 'ong bar mi bya snyam pa de lta bu'i sems gcig tu ma nges pas mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa na de lta bu'i sems skyes pas kyang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing gang zag de'i sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'ong bar bya 'am 'on te phyir 'ong bar mi bya snyam pa de lta bu'i sems gcig tu ma nges pas mtshams las 'da' zhing 'gro ba dang / mtshams kyi phyi rol du son pa na de lta bu'i sems skyes pas kyang de'i dkyil 'khor gyi khongs su gtogs pa chad cing gang zag de'i sra brkyang dbyung ba rang 'jug pa dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he thinks, Why should I return? Or, I will not return, then he transgresses the boundary and goes.🔽If he thinks, I will not return, but I will make robes, then he transgresses the boundary and goes.🔽If he thinks, I will not return, nor will I make robes, then he transgresses the boundary and goes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro ba na de 'di snyam du ci'i phyir 'ong bar bya zhing chos gos bya 'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'gro ba na de 'di snyam du ci'i phyir 'ong bar bya zhing chos gos bya 'am /

original: de la chos gos bya ba'i @165a * //
analyzed: de la chos gos bya ba'i @165a * //
translated: With regard to that, the thought of making Dharma robes
