original: zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dag gi 'phros non pa'i lhag ma ste /
analyzed: zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dag gi 'phros non pa'i lhag ma ste /
translated: The term “remainder” in the phrase “even in the remainders” refers to the remainders of the strips of cloth that have been cut to width.

original: zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dag gi 'phros ma non pa'i phyogs tshun chad kyi glegs bu dag go //
analyzed: zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dag gi 'phros ma non pa'i phyogs tshun chad kyi glegs bu dag go //
translated: The remainders are the pieces of cloth that are not covered by the strips of cloth that have been cut to width.

original: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma de dag phan tshun srid mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma de dag phan tshun srid mnyam par bya'o //
translated: “Even” means that the remainders should be made even with each other.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The nature of this is just that.

original: dbus nas gzhan du tshal bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dbus nas gzhan du tshal bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The “other side” of the middle is the extension of the pieces in the various directions.

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dbus ma gnyis kyi bar gyi glegs bu'o //
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni zheng du thal rangs su btang ba'i snam phran dbus ma gnyis kyi bar gyi glegs bu'o //
translated: The “middle” is the tablet between the two middle pieces, which are extended crosswise.

original: de nas gzhan du glegs bu'i 'phro zhes bya ba ni /🔽dbus nas g-yas g-yon gzhan du snam phran zheng du thal rangs su btang ba @172a * //
analyzed: de nas gzhan du glegs bu'i 'phro zhes bya ba ni / dbus nas g-yas g-yon gzhan du snam phran zheng du thal rangs su btang ba @172a * //
translated: “The other side” of that is the extension of the tablet.

original: dag gis glegs bu'i 'phro'o //
analyzed: dag gis glegs bu'i 'phro'o //
translated: The “other side” of the middle is the extension of the pieces to the right and left, which are extended crosswise.🔽The “other side” of the middle is the extension of the tablet.

original: phyogs phyogs su lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs phyogs su lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In the various directions” means that the tablet is extended in all directions.

original: g-yas g-yon gyi glegs bu thams cad la khyab par bya ba'i phyir phyogs phyogs su zhes zlos bur bya ste /🔽g-yas phyogs kyi tshal bu rnams kyi 'phro yang g-yas phyogs su phyi brgyud du ba lta la /
analyzed: g-yas g-yon gyi glegs bu thams cad la khyab par bya ba'i phyir phyogs phyogs su zhes zlos bur bya ste / g-yas phyogs kyi tshal bu rnams kyi 'phro yang g-yas phyogs su phyi brgyud du ba lta la /
translated: “In the various directions” is repeated in order to pervade all the tablets to the right and left.🔽The extension of the pieces to the right is on the right side of the outer edge.

original: g-yon phyogs kyi tshal bu rnams kyi 'phro yang g-yon phyogs su phyi brgyud du blta ba'o //
analyzed: g-yon phyogs kyi tshal bu rnams kyi 'phro yang g-yon phyogs su phyi brgyud du blta ba'o //
translated: The extension of the pieces to the left is on the left side of the outer edge.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That is its nature.

original: de ltar snam phran snrel zhi nyid dang lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang / dbus nas gzhan du tshal bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba de gsum gyis ni srid du btang pa'i glegs bu dag drub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar snam phran snrel zhi nyid dang lhag ma mnyam pa nyid dang / dbus nas gzhan du tshal bu'i 'phro phyogs phyogs su lta ba nyid ces bya ba de gsum gyis ni srid du btang pa'i glegs bu dag drub pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the three, namely, the warp threads are not even, the rest are even, and the edges of the cloth are not even, indicate the weaving of the cloth that has been cut to size.

original: mtha' bskor ba nyid ces bya ba ni chu zheng gi mtha' 'khor bar kun dga' bo mtha' skor gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' bskor ba nyid ces bya ba ni chu zheng gi mtha' 'khor bar kun dga' bo mtha' skor gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: The edge is even means that the edge of the cloth is even all around, Ananda.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is just that.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhi po de dag bsdus pas drubs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhi po de dag bsdus pas drubs pa'i chos gos gang yin pa de byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four aspects are included. The patched robe that is woven should be consecrated.

original: 'di skad bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ;
translated: This is what is taught.

original: ji ltar srid du btang ba'i tshal bu rnams kyi sna mtho dman du 'dug pas snam phran snal zhi nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar chos gos de drub par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid du btang ba'i tshal bu rnams kyi sna mtho dman du 'dug pas snam phran snal zhi nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar chos gos de drub par bya'o //
translated: The warp threads are not even because the edges of the cloth that has been cut to size are not even. The patched robe should be woven like that.

original: tshal bu gcig gi sna glegs bu'i 'phros non pa'i lhag ma ma non pa ji tsam yod pa de tsam du de las gzhan pa'i glegs bu lhag ma dag kyang de dang mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: tshal bu gcig gi sna glegs bu'i 'phros non pa'i lhag ma ma non pa ji tsam yod pa de tsam du de las gzhan pa'i glegs bu lhag ma dag kyang de dang mnyam par bya'o //
translated: The remaining part of the cloth that is not covered by the edge of the first piece should be equal to the remaining part of the other pieces.

original: dbus kyi snam bu la ltos nas g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs gnyis su glegs bu'i 'phro phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi snam bu la ltos nas g-yas g-yon gyi phyogs gnyis su glegs bu'i 'phro phyogs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The edge of the cloth should be turned to the right and left in relation to the middle piece.

original: ngas bzhi kun nas 'khor bar kun dga' bo'i mtha' skor gyis 'phro thams cad bskor bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngas bzhi kun nas 'khor bar kun dga' bo'i mtha' skor gyis 'phro thams cad bskor bar bya'o //
translated: I enjoin that all four edges be turned around Ānanda.

original: cho ga 'di ni rab tu byung ba gzhan dag las dge slong rnams kyis chos gos tha dad par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni rab tu byung ba gzhan dag las dge slong rnams kyis chos gos tha dad par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This rule is for the monks to make their robes different from those of other renunciants.

original: gos gang la chos gos kyi don du rnam pa de lta bur byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gos gang la chos gos kyi don du rnam pa de lta bur byin gyis brlab par bya zhe na /
translated: On what kind of robe should one bless it in this way for the purpose of the Dharma robe?

original: de'i phyir mthang gos dang bla gos dang snam sbyar la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthang gos dang bla gos dang snam sbyar la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “on the lower robe, the upper robe, and the patched robe.”

original: gsum char la yang rnam pa de lta bur drub cing byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum char la yang rnam pa de lta bur drub cing byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should also fashion and consecrate all three in that way.

original: mthang gos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthang gos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called lower robe

original: nang du bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: nang du bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: is what is worn inside.🔽The so-called upper robe

original: bla gos zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stod du bgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla gos zhes bya ba ni lus kyi stod du bgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: is what is worn on the upper part of the body.🔽The so-called patched robe

original: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam phran tu dras te sbyar ba las gos kyi rigs gang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam phran tu dras te sbyar ba las gos kyi rigs gang 'byung ba'o //
translated: is whatever kind of cloth is made by cutting and patching together strips.

original: dge slong mas ni shing nga dbung chad dang rdul gzan rnam pa @172b gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong mas ni shing nga dbung chad dang rdul gzan rnam pa @172b gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A nun’s is any kind of tree bark or cotton cloth.

original: dge slong mas sngar bstan pa'i chos gos gsum dang 'di gnyis dang lnga byin gyis brlab par bya'o /
analyzed: dge slong mas sngar bstan pa'i chos gos gsum dang 'di gnyis dang lnga byin gyis brlab par bya'o /
translated: A nun should consecrate five robes: the three taught above and these two.🔽Any kind

original: rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: dras shing drubs pa ma yin yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: dras shing drubs pa ma yin yang rung ba'o //
translated: that it need not be cut and sewn.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma chos gos zin pas sras brkyang phyung nas gal te chos gos lnga po gang yang rung bdag las chos gos gcig dang nub cig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma chos gos zin pas sras brkyang phyung nas gal te chos gos lnga po gang yang rung bdag las chos gos gcig dang nub cig mtshams kyi phyi rol du bral na spang pa'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is: “A fully ordained nun who has finished her robes, if she goes outside the boundary for one night with one robe, any of the five robes, she commits a downfall that requires relinquishment.”

original: chos gos lnga po dag ces bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos dang shing nga dpung bcad dang rdul gzan zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: chos gos lnga po dag ces bya ba ni snam sbyar dang bla gos dang mthang gos dang shing nga dpung bcad dang rdul gzan zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The five robes are the outer robe, the upper robe, the lower robe, the chest covering, and the sweat-cloth.

original: brnyan po yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brnyan po yod cing bdog na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If she has a substitute and it is available.

original: gal te chos gos dras shing drubs pa brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na /
analyzed: gal te chos gos dras shing drubs pa brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na /
translated: If she has a substitute robe that has been cut and sewn,

original: de'i tshe de yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: then at that time she should consecrate it.

original: gal te mi bdog na ni dras shing drubs pa ma yin pa la yang byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te mi bdog na ni dras shing drubs pa ma yin pa la yang byin gyis brlab par bya ba ste /
translated: If she does not have one, then she should consecrate one that has not been cut and sewn.

original: chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pas 'dus par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pas 'dus par mi bya'o //
translated: She should not go to the village without consecrating her robe.

original: de dag gzhag ste skya rengs 'char ba 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gzhag ste skya rengs 'char ba 'da' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should not pass the time until dawn has come, having put them aside.

original: chos gos byas pa gsum mam lnga po de dag gzhag ste skya rengs 'char pa 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos byas pa gsum mam lnga po de dag gzhag ste skya rengs 'char pa 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not pass the time until dawn has come, having put aside those three or five robes that have been made.

original: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o //
analyzed: brnyan po yang yod cing bdog na'o //
translated: But if he has a substitute.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: chos gos yod na skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pas 'da' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos yod na skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su chos gos byin gyis ma brlabs pas 'da' bar mi bya'o //
translated: If he has a robe, he should not pass the time until dawn has come without consecrating the robe.

original: gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not have another, he may consecrate one that is not dyed.

original: kha bsgyur ba 'am brnyan po gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: kha bsgyur ba 'am brnyan po gzhan med na kha ma bsgyur ba'i gos la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: This means that if he does not have another dyed robe or substitute, he may consecrate one that is not dyed.

original: ma dras pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma dras pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He may also consecrate one that is not woven.

original: dras pa gzhan med na ma dras pa la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: dras pa gzhan med na ma dras pa la yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: This means that if he does not have another woven robe, he may consecrate one that is not woven.

original: de la gal te 'byor na lhan thabs glan no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gal te 'byor na lhan thabs glan no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he has the means, he should have it dyed.

original: ma dras pa de la gal te lhan thabs zhes bya ba glegs bu'i 'phro bdog na glan bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma dras pa de la gal te lhan thabs zhes bya ba glegs bu'i 'phro bdog na glan bar bya ba'o //
translated: If that unwoven cloth has a piece of cloth called a “patch” attached to it, it should be sewn together.

original: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyim du rung ba'i rnam pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also, with regard to the form that is suitable for a monk’s household.

original: khyim du rung ba zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i khyim du spyad du rung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim du rung ba zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i khyim du spyad du rung ba'o //
translated: “Suitable for a monk’s household” means suitable to be used in a householder’s home.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Form” means

original: de lta bu'i gos kyi rnam pa ste kha tshar dang phun tshar gyi mtha' gcad du rung ba dag slong gi chos gos kyi rnam pa nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gos kyi rnam pa ste kha tshar dang phun tshar gyi mtha' gcad du rung ba dag slong gi chos gos kyi rnam pa nyid du ma red pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: a form of cloth like that, with a fringe and a hem that can be cut. It means that which is not yet woven into the form of a Dharma robe.

original: gzhan med na de la @173a * //
analyzed: gzhan med na de la @173a * //
translated: If one does not have another,

original: yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: yang byin gyis brlabs pa 'chags pa'o //
translated: one should perform the consecration.

original: phying pa dang la ba dang be'u phrug dang kla ma dang sengs pa ni mi dra bar lhan thabs glan zhing drub pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phying pa dang la ba dang be'u phrug dang kla ma dang sengs pa ni mi dra bar lhan thabs glan zhing drub pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Mats, blankets, sheepskin, felt, and coarse cloth are not to be woven,” means

original: chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: that one should consecrate them as Dharma robes.

original: 'di ltar gzhan las spu can ni chos gos gsum po nyid du byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan las spu can ni chos gos gsum po nyid du byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: Thus, it is said that one should not consecrate the three robes as wool.

original: 'on kyang la pa dang be'u phrug dag la spu byi ba yang srid pas 'dir de gnyis bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang la pa dang be'u phrug dag la spu byi ba yang srid pas 'dir de gnyis bzung ngo //
translated: However, since it is possible that wool may be found on goats and calves, these two are included here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni mi 'dra ba dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag lnga po 'di dag ni mi 'dra ba dag yin te /
translated: Here, the text says, “Monks, these five are dissimilar:

original: phying ba thams cad dang / la ba thams cad dang / be'u phrug thams cad dang ; klam pa thams cad dang / gos sengs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: phying ba thams cad dang / la ba thams cad dang / be'u phrug thams cad dang ; klam pa thams cad dang / gos sengs pa thams cad de /
translated: all felt, all blankets, all calves, all rugs, and all woolen cloth.

original: lhan thabs glan te bcang par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan thabs glan te bcang par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: They should be kept after mending them.”

original: gnas mal mi gtsang bas gos par gyur na de'i mdo la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas mal mi gtsang bas gos par gyur na de'i mdo la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a bedding or seat becomes soiled, it should be applied to that sūtra.

original: dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi mal cha dang stan la mi gtsang bas gos par gyur na de'i mod kho na la mi brkyang bar bkru bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi mal cha dang stan la mi gtsang bas gos par gyur na de'i mod kho na la mi brkyang bar bkru bar bya ba'o //
translated: If a bedding or seat of the Saṅgha or an individual becomes soiled, it should be washed immediately without stretching it.

original: dge 'dun gyi rtsva'i khri dang khri'u ma gtogs pa stan yan chad la de ma yin pa'i gding ba med pa dang gding g-yogs la mang bar chang ma bcug bar nye bar spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rtsva'i khri dang khri'u ma gtogs pa stan yan chad la de ma yin pa'i gding ba med pa dang gding g-yogs la mang bar chang ma bcug bar nye bar spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for the grass seats and benches of the community, one should not use the bedding of the community without the bedding of one's own, and one should not use the community's bedding without inserting one's own cloth between.

original: dge 'dun gyi rtsva'i khri dang khri'u ma gtogs pa tha na stan yan chad dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dge 'dun gyi gding pa ma yin pa rang gi gding ba med par longs spyad par mi bya ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gding g-yogs la yang gang zag gi gos kyi bar chad ma bcug par spyad par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rtsva'i khri dang khri'u ma gtogs pa tha na stan yan chad dge 'dun gyi gnas mal dge 'dun gyi gding pa ma yin pa rang gi gding ba med par longs spyad par mi bya ba dang / dge 'dun gyi gding g-yogs la yang gang zag gi gos kyi bar chad ma bcug par spyad par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Except for the grass seats and benches of the community, one should not use the bedding of the community without the bedding of one's own, and one should not use the community's bedding without inserting one's own cloth between.

original: rtsva'i khri dang khri'u zhes bya ba ni rtsva mun dza dang gres ma la sogs pa'i thag pas brgyus pa'i khri dang khri'u ste /
analyzed: rtsva'i khri dang khri'u zhes bya ba ni rtsva mun dza dang gres ma la sogs pa'i thag pas brgyus pa'i khri dang khri'u ste /
translated: Grass seats and benches are seats and benches woven with grass such as muñja grass and straw.

original: de la ni gding ba gzhan med kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: de la ni gding ba gzhan med kyang rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable for them to not have other bedding.

original: stan yan chad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan yan chad ces bya ba ni /
translated: Bedding and so on means🔽and so on refers to cushions and so forth.

original: mal stan lta zhog gi tha mal par 'dug pa'i stan yan chad la yang gding ba med par 'dug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mal stan lta zhog gi tha mal par 'dug pa'i stan yan chad la yang gding ba med par 'dug par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not sit down on any seat, not even an ordinary one, without first spreading a mat.

original: des na 'dir yan lag gis reg pa tsam la yang gding ba gzhug dgos par rig par bya'o //🔽de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na 'dir yan lag gis reg pa tsam la yang gding ba gzhug dgos par rig par bya'o // de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that one must spread a mat even when one is just going to touch the bed with one’s limbs.

original: dge 'dun gyi gding ba ma yin pa'o //🔽gding ba med par nye bar spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gding ba ma yin pa'o // gding ba med par nye bar spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not that” refers to a mat belonging to the Saṅgha.

original: gang zag gi gding ba med par ro //🔽gding g-yogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag gi gding ba med par ro // gding g-yogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not use it without a mat” means without a mat belonging to an individual.

original: 'dir steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang thang la gzhar @173b ba'i gdang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir steng nas bgo ba'i gos dang thang la gzhar @173b ba'i gdang ba la bya ste /
translated: “Covering” refers to a cloth that is spread over the top and a cloth that is spread on the ground.

original: dge 'dun gyi gding g-yogs de la yang gang zag gi gos kyi bar chad ma bcug par nye bar spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gding g-yogs de la yang gang zag gi gos kyi bar chad ma bcug par nye bar spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not use a covering belonging to the Saṅgha without first putting a cloth belonging to an individual between it and oneself.

original: thams cad kyi khra bo phal char ma nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /🔽thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi khra bo phal char ma nyams pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /🔽thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “All” refers to a multicolored cloth that is mostly undamaged.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang zag gi la sar ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gang zag gi la sar ngo //
translated: Not only the Saṃgha’s, but also an individual’s.

original: khra bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Multicolored” means

original: par thang dang dre'u rdog dang za 'og la sogs pa tshon ris can thams cad do //
analyzed: par thang dang dre'u rdog dang za 'og la sogs pa tshon ris can thams cad do //
translated: all that is variegated, such as a painting, a patchwork, a brocade, and so on.

original: phal cher ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phal cher ma nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Mostly undamaged” means

original: ha cang rnying pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ha cang rnying pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: not very old.

original: de yang stan yan chad la de ma yin pa'i gding ba med pa dang / gding g-yogs la yang bar chad ma bcug bar nye bar spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang stan yan chad la de ma yin pa'i gding ba med pa dang / gding g-yogs la yang bar chad ma bcug bar nye bar spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should not use a seat or anything else that is not a mat, or a mat that is not spread out, or a mat that is spread out but not properly.

original: skabs 'dir de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs 'dir de ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this context, “anything else”

original: khra bo ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi ma yin pa gnyi ga gzung ngo //
analyzed: khra bo ma yin pa dang / dge 'dun gyi ma yin pa gnyi ga gzung ngo //
translated: means both that which is not multicolored and that which does not belong to the Saṃgha.

original: ngan ngon tsam dang dre ma can gyis mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngan ngon tsam dang dre ma can gyis mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not use a poor-quality or dirty mat” means

original: gding ba ngan ngon can dang gding ba dri ma can gyis dge 'dun gyi 'am gang zag gi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya ba'o//
analyzed: gding ba ngan ngon can dang gding ba dri ma can gyis dge 'dun gyi 'am gang zag gi gnas mal la spyad par mi bya ba'o//
translated: one should not use a poor-quality mat or a dirty mat on a seat belonging to the Saṃgha or an individual.

original: gding ba bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gding ba bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should keep a mat” means

original: gang zag gis bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is to be used by a person.

original: de ni stug na gcig kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽gding ba de'o //
analyzed: de ni stug na gcig kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni / gding ba de'o //
translated: It is suitable if it is thick, even if it is single.

original: sengs pa ni nyi rim mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sengs pa ni nyi rim mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This refers to the sitting mat.🔽If it is thin, it should be made double.

original: sengs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sengs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This refers to the sitting mat.

original: sang seng du gyur pa yin na nyi rim du bya dgos so //
analyzed: sang seng du gyur pa yin na nyi rim du bya dgos so //
translated: If it is thin, it should be made double.

original: khra khra po mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽stug po yang rung sengs ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: khra khra po mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni / stug po yang rung sengs ba yang rung ste /
translated: It should not be variegated.

original: gding ba khra bo bkra ba khra khra bor 'dug par bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba khra bo bkra ba khra khra bor 'dug par bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Whether it is thick or thin, the sitting mat should not be used if it is variegated, colorful, or has many colors.

original: de la glegs bu'i 'phro bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la glegs bu'i 'phro bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A border should be made on it.

original: gding ba de la chos gos kyi glegs bu'i tshal pa lta bu bya'o //
analyzed: gding ba de la chos gos kyi glegs bu'i tshal pa lta bu bya'o //
translated: A border should be made on the sitting mat, like the border on a Dharma robe.

original: phyogs gang du du zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gang du du zhig bya zhe na /
translated: In which direction should the border be made?

original: de'i phyir 'og rol gyis sum cha'i dang por ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'og rol gyis sum cha'i dang por ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “In the first third from below.”

original: 'og rol zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og rol zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Below” means

original: rkang pa'i mtha' logs su'o //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mtha' logs su'o //
translated: at the edge of the feet.

original: sum cha zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i mtha' logs su sum cha bor la stod du sum gnyis bor ba'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: sum cha zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i mtha' logs su sum cha bor la stod du sum gnyis bor ba'i mtshams su'o //
translated: The third is the third part of the foot. Having left out the third part, the middle part is left out.

original: dang por ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang por ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first is the first part of the lower part.

original: sum cha'i mtshams de nyid 'og rol gyi cha'i dang po yin pas de nyid du bcad de chos gos kyi tshal bu 'dra bar glegs bu'i 'phro gcig bya bar zad kyi mthar yang mi bya dbus su yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sum cha'i mtshams de nyid 'og rol gyi cha'i dang po yin pas de nyid du bcad de chos gos kyi tshal bu 'dra bar glegs bu'i 'phro gcig bya bar zad kyi mthar yang mi bya dbus su yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since that very third part is the first part of the lower part, it is cut there. It is only necessary to make one continuation of the cloth like a piece of Dharma robe, not at the end, not in the middle, this is the meaning.

original: glegs bu gcig pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glegs bu gcig pa byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not consecrate a single piece.🔽The consecration of a single piece is the consecration of a single piece of cloth.

original: gding ba ste de'i phyir sngar 'og rol gyi sum cha'i dang por ro zhes smos pas glegs bu phyed dang gnyis bar @174a * //🔽bya bar bstan pa yin no //🔽g-yan pa dgab pa de dang ldan pas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gding ba ste de'i phyir sngar 'og rol gyi sum cha'i dang por ro zhes smos pas glegs bu phyed dang gnyis bar @174a * // bya bar bstan pa yin no // g-yan pa dgab pa de dang ldan pas bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since it is said at the first of the lower third part, it is taught that one should make one and a half pieces.🔽One should keep it with the knee-protectors.

original: dge slong g-yan pa dang ldan pas g-yan pa dgab pa de bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong g-yan pa dang ldan pas g-yan pa dgab pa de bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should keep it with the knee-protectors means that a monk with knee-problems should keep the knee-protectors.

original: de zhag lnga'am drug cing sbyang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de zhag lnga'am drug cing sbyang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That should be washed every five or six days.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa de zhag lnga'am drug cing bkru bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa de zhag lnga'am drug cing bkru bar bya ba'o //
translated: That should be washed every five or six days.

original: srin bal gyi dang bal gyi dang sha na'i dang par ma'i rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srin bal gyi dang bal gyi dang sha na'i dang par ma'i rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Cotton, wool, silk, and linen are suitable.

original: chos gos nyid dang gos lhag nyid du yang de dag las byas pa'i gos rung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos nyid dang gos lhag nyid du yang de dag las byas pa'i gos rung ba'o //
translated: Those made from those are suitable as robes and extra robes.

original: rnams su ma byas pa dang gos ma ni mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnams su ma byas pa dang gos ma ni mi rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those not made from those, and those not made from cloth, are not suitable.

original: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos la sogs pa dang / gsom las byung ba'i gos ni mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos la sogs pa dang / gsom las byung ba'i gos ni mi rung ba ste /
translated: Cloth from the wish-fulfilling tree, and so forth, and cloth from the śālmali tree are not suitable.

original: spang pa'i zhu ba las nyes byas byed pa nyid kyis mi rung ba'i khongs su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang pa'i zhu ba las nyes byas byed pa nyid kyis mi rung ba'i khongs su gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in the Questions of Upāli that they are included in the unsuitable due to the act of committing a misdeed.

original: skra las byas pa dang gcer bu pa dang bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par len pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: skra las byas pa dang gcer bu pa dang bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par len pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: Also, those made from hair, and those who take up the naked ascetic and owl practices, are not suitable.

original: mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also should be supplied.

original: skra'i la ba ba yang dag par len pa dang gcer bu pa yang dag par len pa dang / bya 'ug pa yang dag par len pa ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skra'i la ba ba yang dag par len pa dang gcer bu pa yang dag par len pa dang / bya 'ug pa yang dag par len pa ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to take up the practice of the matted hair, the naked, or the owl.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the Questions of the Brahmin Boy Uttara says:

original: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po /
translated: “If you take up the three banners of the tīrthikas,

original: gcer bu pa nyid dang / bya 'ug pa pa nyid dang / skra'i la pa ba nyid 'chang bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan 'tshang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcer bu pa nyid dang / bya 'ug pa pa nyid dang / skra'i la pa ba nyid 'chang bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro // mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gsum po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan 'tshang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the practice of the naked, the practice of the owl, and the practice of the matted hair, you will incur a serious violation.🔽If you take up a banner of the tīrthikas other than these three, you will incur an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gzhan de dag kyang yang dag par blangs pa sngon du gtong bas 'chang na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan de dag kyang yang dag par blangs pa sngon du gtong bas 'chang na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you take up any of the other banners after first taking up the practice of the tīrthikas, you will incur a serious violation.

original: de la sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la sbom po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this context, “serious violation” means

original: skra las byas pa dang / gcer bu pa dang / bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par lan pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skra las byas pa dang / gcer bu pa dang / bya 'ug pa pa yang dag par lan pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If one wears the hair of a horse, or is naked, or wears owl feathers, one should understand that it is a serious transgression belonging to the side of schism in the Saṅgha.🔽The other is that,

original: gzhan bstan pa ni de'o zhes bya ba ni gsum po de dag las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gzhan bstan pa na ma rung ba de ste nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no //🔽de dag kyang yang dag bar blang ba sngon du btang bas 'chang na ni sbom por 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang dag par blang ba sdom du gtong pa las gzhan pa yang dag par blang @174b ba sngon du gtong ba ma yin pas 'chang na de yang rung
analyzed: gzhan bstan pa ni de'o zhes bya ba ni gsum po de dag las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gzhan bstan pa na ma rung ba de ste nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no // de dag kyang yang dag bar blang ba sngon du btang bas 'chang na ni sbom por 'gyur bas de'i phyir yang dag par blang ba sdom du gtong pa las gzhan pa yang dag par blang @174b ba sngon du gtong ba ma yin pas 'chang na de yang rung
translated: if one wears any other sectarian symbol besides those three, it is a wrong action.

original: ba ma yin te de ni nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ba ma yin te de ni nyes byas byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: If one wears them after first properly taking them up, it is a serious transgression. Therefore, if one wears them without first taking them up, it is also not right, and it is a wrong action.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gang ci yang rung ba 'chad na /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan gang ci yang rung ba 'chad na /
translated: If one wears any sectarian symbol,

original: yang dag par blang ba sngon du btang bas kyang rung /
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba sngon du btang bas kyang rung /
translated: It is also permissible to hold them after first taking them up properly.

original: yang dag par blang ba sngon du ma btang bas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba sngon du ma btang bas kyang rung ste /
translated: It is also permissible to hold them without first taking them up properly.

original: de dag thams cad la dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pas 'chang ba ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad la dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pas 'chang ba ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one holds them with the belief that they are pure and liberating, then one commits a serious offense.

original: dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pa med na ni skra'i lab pa dang gcer bu pa dang / bya 'ug pa gsum ni sbom po nyid du logs shig tu gsungs pas /
analyzed: dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pa med na ni skra'i lab pa dang gcer bu pa dang / bya 'ug pa gsum ni sbom po nyid du logs shig tu gsungs pas /
translated: If one does not hold them with the belief that they are pure and liberating, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct for holding any of the other sectarian symbols, except for the three—the topknot, the naked state, and the owl feathers—which are said to be serious offenses.

original: de gsum las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan la dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: de gsum las gzhan pa'i mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan la dag pa dang grol bar 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: Therefore, if one holds any of the other tīrthika symbols, except for these three, without the belief that they are pure and liberating, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yang dag par blang ba sngon du ma btang bas 'dzin pa thams cad la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: yang dag par blang ba sngon du ma btang bas 'dzin pa thams cad la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one holds any of the other tīrthika symbols without first taking them up properly, then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skra 'bal pa dang lo ma gyon pa dang g-yang gzhi'i smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas 'tsho ba dang gso ras dang yan lag gi sbubs dang gos thams cad sngo ba dang / gdengs ka lta bu dang kha tshar ring po dang ral ga dang /
analyzed: skra 'bal pa dang lo ma gyon pa dang g-yang gzhi'i smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas 'tsho ba dang gso ras dang yan lag gi sbubs dang gos thams cad sngo ba dang / gdengs ka lta bu dang kha tshar ring po dang ral ga dang /
translated: Shaving the head, wearing garments of bark, wearing a lower and upper garment of antelope skin, wearing a cloth of hair, wearing a cloth of all types of hair, wearing a cloth with fringes, wearing a cloth with a fringe like a peacock’s neck, wearing a cloth with long fringes, wearing a cloth with a fringe like a goat’s beard, wearing a turban, wearing a cloth of goat’s wool, and wearing a cloth of camel’s wool.

original: gtsug tor dang / mgo dkris pa dang / ra phyar dang rnga bal gyi snam bu dang / mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan yang ngo zhes bya ba mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gtsug tor dang / mgo dkris pa dang / ra phyar dang rnga bal gyi snam bu dang / mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan yang ngo zhes bya ba mi rung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “It is not proper to wear the banner of the tīrthikas.”

original: skra 'bal pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skra 'bal pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Shaving the head means

original: mu stegs can gyi brtul zhugs skra 'thog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi brtul zhugs skra 'thog par byed pa'o //
translated: to shave the head as a tīrthika observance.

original: lo ma gyon pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lo ma gyon pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Wearing garments of bark means

original: lo ma dang shun pa la sogs pa gyon pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma dang shun pa la sogs pa gyon pa'o //
translated: to wear garments of bark, tree bark, and so forth.🔽Wearing a lower and upper garment of antelope skin means🔽to wear garments made of deer skin.🔽Wearing a cloth of hair means🔽to wear a cloth made of human hair.🔽Wearing a cloth of all types of hair means🔽to wear a cloth made of the hair of all types of animals.🔽Wearing a cloth with fringes means🔽to wear a cloth with fringes made of hair.🔽Wearing a cloth with a fringe like a peacock’s neck means🔽to wear a cloth with a fringe like a peacock’s neck.🔽Wearing a cloth with long fringes means🔽to wear a cloth with long fringes.

original: g-yang gzhi'i smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yang gzhi'i smad g-yogs stod g-yogs dang bcas pas 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Wearing a cloth with a fringe like a goat’s beard means

original: ri dags kyi pags pa'i 'o //
analyzed: ri dags kyi pags pa'i 'o //
translated: to wear a cloth with a fringe like a goat’s beard.🔽Wearing a turban means

original: gso ras zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gso ras zhes bya ba ni /
translated: to wear a turban.🔽Wearing a cloth of goat’s wool means🔽to wear a cloth made of goat’s wool.🔽Wearing a cloth of camel’s wool means🔽to wear a cloth made of camel’s wool.

original: gso ma las byas ba'i gos seng seng po'o //
analyzed: gso ma las byas ba'i gos seng seng po'o //
translated: The garment made of silk is a garment of a yellowish color.

original: yan lag gi gos sbubs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi gos sbubs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The garment with a border is

original: dor ma la sogs pa'i gos so //
analyzed: dor ma la sogs pa'i gos so //
translated: a garment such as trousers, etc.

original: gos thams cad sngo ba zhes bya ba ni gos ril gyis sngo ba bkag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gos thams cad sngo ba zhes bya ba ni gos ril gyis sngo ba bkag pa yin gyi /
translated: The garment that is all blue is a garment that is all blue.

original: gos thams cad ser ba dang dmar ba ni ma bkag go //🔽gdengs ka lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos thams cad ser ba dang dmar ba ni ma bkag go // gdengs ka lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The garment that is all yellow or all red is not prohibited.

original: gos kyi kha tshar sprul mgo'i gdengs ka lta bur ring por byed pa'o //🔽kha tshar ring po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos kyi kha tshar sprul mgo'i gdengs ka lta bur ring por byed pa'o // kha tshar ring po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The garment with a border like a snake’s hood is a garment with a border that is long like the hood of a snake.

original: gos kha tshar ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: gos kha tshar ma bcad pa'o //
translated: The garment with a long border is a garment with an uncut border.

original: ral ga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ral ga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The garment with a fringe is a garment with a fringe.

original: shing nga dpung bcad las gzhan pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shing nga dpung bcad las gzhan pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The garment with a pattern should be understood as having a pattern other than that of a lion’s mane.

original: dper na lham yu rings kyi rnam pa las lham sgrog gu can gyi rnam pa cung zad gzhan @175a * //🔽pa dang 'dra'o //🔽gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na lham yu rings kyi rnam pa las lham sgrog gu can gyi rnam pa cung zad gzhan @175a * // pa dang 'dra'o // gtsug tor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, the pattern of a sandal is slightly different from the pattern of a sandal with a strap.

original: gtsug tor mthon po'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor mthon po'o //
translated: The turban is a high turban.

original: mgo dkris pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mgo dkris pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The head covering is

original: thod la sogs pa ste gtsug tor pa yin no //
analyzed: thod la sogs pa ste gtsug tor pa yin no //
translated: The turban is the head.

original: ra phyar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ra phyar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The winnowing basket is

original: ra ba la las byas pa'i phyar ba'o //
analyzed: ra ba la las byas pa'i phyar ba'o //
translated: the winnowing basket made of bamboo.

original: rda bal gyi snam bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rda bal gyi snam bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The woolen blanket is

original: rnga mo'i bal las byas pa'i snam bu'o //
analyzed: rnga mo'i bal las byas pa'i snam bu'o //
translated: the blanket made of camel wool.

original: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The banner of the non-Buddhists is🔽the banner of the non-Buddhists.

original: de dag las gzhan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the rest is self-evident.

original: bu la sa'i 'dab ma gang tsam dang mar me'i snying po tsam des kyang snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu la sa'i 'dab ma gang tsam dang mar me'i snying po tsam des kyang snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even with a leaf of the pulastya tree and the wick of a lamp, one should share in order to be equal.

original: zas ni tha na shing pu la sa'i lo ma gang tsam nges kyang dbang ba thams cad la snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: zas ni tha na shing pu la sa'i lo ma gang tsam nges kyang dbang ba thams cad la snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: Even with food as little as a leaf of the pulastya tree, one should share in order to be equal with all.

original: gos ni than mar me'i snying po tsam des kyang dbang ba thams cad la snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: gos ni than mar me'i snying po tsam des kyang dbang ba thams cad la snyoms par bya ba'i phyir bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: Even with clothing as little as the wick of a lamp, one should share in order to be equal with all.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
translated: Here, the text is from the Ksudraka Collection:

original: dge slong dag da lta bas na zas kyi rnyed pa byung na pu la sa'i lo mas kyang snyoms par byas te bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag da lta bas na zas kyi rnyed pa byung na pu la sa'i lo mas kyang snyoms par byas te bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: Monks, therefore, when you get food, you should share it equally, even if it is just a leaf of potherb.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa byung na mar me'i snying po tsam gyi sbyor bas kyang snyoms par byas te bgo bsha' bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa byung na mar me'i snying po tsam gyi sbyor bas kyang snyoms par byas te bgo bsha' bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When you get clothing, you should share it equally, even if it is just a wick for a butter lamp.

original: la ba dang de lta bu dag ni btsongs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: la ba dang de lta bu dag ni btsongs te'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A robe and such should be sold” means

original: bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bgo bsha' bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that you should share it.

original: la ba dang la ba lta bu'i gos gzhan gang dag gcad du mi rung ba de dag ni btsongs te bgo bsha' bya'o //
analyzed: la ba dang la ba lta bu'i gos gzhan gang dag gcad du mi rung ba de dag ni btsongs te bgo bsha' bya'o //
translated: A robe and other garments that are not suitable to be cut up should be sold and shared.

original: mi gsheg pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gsheg pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It should not be cut up” means

original: la ba dang de lta bu dag ni de las gzhan pa'i gos gzhan du mi gsheg pa nyid yin no //🔽rnyed pa bgo ba la lnga bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: la ba dang de lta bu dag ni de las gzhan pa'i gos gzhan du mi gsheg pa nyid yin no // rnyed pa bgo ba la lnga bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that a robe and such should not be cut up into other garments.🔽“There are five actions in the distribution of gains” means

original: rnyed pa bgo ba la bya ba lnga bya ba'o//
analyzed: rnyed pa bgo ba la bya ba lnga bya ba'o//
translated: that there are five actions in the distribution of gains.

original: rnyed pa bgo pa la bya ba lnga bya ba de dag gang zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa bgo pa la bya ba lnga bya ba de dag gang zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: deng rnyed pa bgod par 'gyur gyis bar khyed cag gis tshogs par bya'o zhes dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba dang / gand'i brdung ba dang / tshul shing bram pa dang / bgrang ba dang / so so'i skal ba brim pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: deng rnyed pa bgod par 'gyur gyis bar khyed cag gis tshogs par bya'o zhes dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba dang / gand'i brdung ba dang / tshul shing bram pa dang / bgrang ba dang / so so'i skal ba brim pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The five actions are to inform the Saṅgha that today the property will be distributed, to strike the gandi, to count the votes, to distribute the property and to distribute the individual shares.

original: rnyed pa bgo pa'i dus su bya ba lnga po de dag go rims bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa bgo pa'i dus su bya ba lnga po de dag go rims bzhin du bya'o //
translated: These five actions are to be performed at the time of distributing the property in the order stated.

original: tha ma yan chad byed pa nyid ma 'ongs pa dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha ma yan chad byed pa nyid ma 'ongs pa dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The last is the right of the present monks.

original: rnyed pa bgo ba'i dus su bya ba lnga po de dag gi go rims kyi tha ma ni so so'i skal ba brim pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa bgo ba'i dus su bya ba lnga po de dag gi go rims kyi tha ma ni so so'i skal ba brim pa ste /
translated: The last of the five actions to be performed at the time of distributing the property is to distribute the individual shares.

original: gong ma bzhi lta ci smos kyi /
analyzed: gong ma bzhi lta ci smos kyi /
translated: What need is there to mention the first four?

original: tha ma de yan chad byed pa na dge @175b slong gzhan glo bur du 'ongs pa yang rnyed pa'i skal ba dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma de yan chad byed pa na dge @175b slong gzhan glo bur du 'ongs pa yang rnyed pa'i skal ba dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The last is the right of the present monks.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i rnyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i rnyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a definite acquisition.

original: dge 'dun tsam la spyir spags te phul ba'i rnyed pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun tsam la spyir spags te phul ba'i rnyed pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is an acquisition that is generally offered to the community.

original: dper na dus ston chen po dag gi tshe lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dus ston chen po dag gi tshe lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the case of a great festival.

original: dbyar gnas pa'i rgyu las byung ba la sogs pa'i rnyed pa nges pa gzhan dag la ni glo bur du 'ongs kyang mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa'i rgyu las byung ba la sogs pa'i rnyed pa nges pa gzhan dag la ni glo bur du 'ongs kyang mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: In the case of other definite acquisitions, such as those arising from the cause of the rains retreat, the newly arrived monks are not entitled to a share.

original: bya ba lnga po 'jug tu ma byin pa nyid la ni glo bur du 'ongs pa nyid dbang bar bstan na /
analyzed: bya ba lnga po 'jug tu ma byin pa nyid la ni glo bur du 'ongs pa nyid dbang bar bstan na /
translated: If the newly arrived monks are entitled to a share in the five duties, then the newly arrived monks are entitled to a share.

original: 'jug tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug tu phyin pa la ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If they are not entitled to a share in the five duties, then how are they to be provided for?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: 'jug tu phyin pa nyid na mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jug tu phyin pa nyid na mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: They are not entitled to a share when they have arrived.

original: bya ba lnga po thams cad mjug tu phyin pa nyid ni 'ongs pa de ni der rnyed pa mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba lnga po thams cad mjug tu phyin pa nyid ni 'ongs pa de ni der rnyed pa mi dbang ngo //
translated: When they have arrived, they are not entitled to a share of the five duties.

original: de ni rnyed pa chung du la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa chung du la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This also applies to a small acquisition.

original: sngar bstan pa la sogs pa de ni rnyed pa chung du la yang bya'i /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa la sogs pa de ni rnyed pa chung du la yang bya'i /
translated: That which was previously explained should be done even for a small acquisition.

original: rnyed pa chen po 'ba' zhig la bya bar ma zad do //
analyzed: rnyed pa chen po 'ba' zhig la bya bar ma zad do //
translated: It is not only for a great acquisition.

original: rnyed pa'i bya ba der zhugs nas song ba nyid yin yang mi dbang ba ma yin ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i bya ba der zhugs nas song ba nyid yin yang mi dbang ba ma yin ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even if one has entered that activity of acquisition and has gone elsewhere, one is not a non-recipient.

original: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis rnyed pa 'brim par byed pa'i bya ba der gal te dge slong de zhugs par gyur na gnas skabs de dang bya ba de byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis rnyed pa 'brim par byed pa'i bya ba der gal te dge slong de zhugs par gyur na gnas skabs de dang bya ba de byas pa yin pas /
translated: If a monk has entered that activity of distributing the acquisition, for whatever reason, such as staying during the rainy season, then having done that activity and that situation,

original: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams las 'das te song yang rnyed pa de dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi mtshams las 'das te song yang rnyed pa de dbang ba yin no //
translated: even if he has gone beyond the boundary of the monastery, he is a recipient of that acquisition.

original: de'i phyir 'gro bas mnod pa bcol bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba mi gang gi phyir rnyed pa de dbang ba de'i phyir dge slong 'gro bas rang gi skal ba nod pa gzhan la bcol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro bas mnod pa bcol bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba mi gang gi phyir rnyed pa de dbang ba de'i phyir dge slong 'gro bas rang gi skal ba nod pa gzhan la bcol bar bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one should entrust the acceptance of one’s share to a visitor. For that reason, a monk should entrust the acceptance of his own share to another, a visitor, because he is a recipient of that acquisition.

original: khas blangs pa dang ldan par ma mnos na bsab par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang ldan par ma mnos na bsab par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not accept the share that one has agreed to take, one must make it up.

original: mnod do zhes khas blangs pa dang ldan pas gal te rnyed pa ma mnos na de'i tshe sgo nas bsab par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: mnod do zhes khas blangs pa dang ldan pas gal te rnyed pa ma mnos na de'i tshe sgo nas bsab par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: If one has agreed to take a share, but does not take it when it is offered, then one must make it up.

original: rnyed pa chung ngu la pa na lnga la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa chung ngu la pa na lnga la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A small share is five paṇas and so on.

original: rnyed pa chung ngu la yang gal te mnod par khas blangs pa dang ldan pas ma mnos na /
analyzed: rnyed pa chung ngu la yang gal te mnod par khas blangs pa dang ldan pas ma mnos na /
translated: If one has agreed to take a small share, but does not take it when it is offered,

original: bgo skal masha ka lnga 'am de bas lhag pa yin na de la bsab par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: bgo skal masha ka lnga 'am de bas lhag pa yin na de la bsab par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: then one must make it up if the share is five or more paṇas.

original: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not take it if one is not asked.

original: bdag pos ma bcol na de'i skal ba mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag pos ma bcol na de'i skal ba mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: If one is not asked by the owner, one should not take the share.

original: slob dpon nam mkhan po'i ni mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: slob dpon nam mkhan po'i ni mnod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But one should take the share of the preceptor or the master.

original: de gnyis kyi na ma bcol na yang ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi na ma bcol na yang ngo //
translated: If one is asked by either of them, one should take it.

original: yid gcugs pa'i gnas kyi don du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid gcugs pa'i gnas kyi don du yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also for the sake of a trustworthy person.

original: gang zag gang yid @176a * //
analyzed: gang zag gang yid @176a * //
translated: What kind of person is it?🔽

original: gcugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin na de'i don du yang ma bcol kyang mnod par bya'o //🔽rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin na de'i don du yang ma bcol kyang mnod par bya'o // rang gi phyogs dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i don du mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a person is a place of trust, then for his sake one should accept it even without being asked.🔽One should not do it for the sake of one who is not on one's own side.

original: bye ba'i phyogs su song ba'i don du yang mnod par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye ba'i phyogs su song ba'i don du yang mnod par mi bya ba'o //
translated: This means that one should not accept it for the sake of one who has gone over to the side of the enemy.

original: de ni gnas mal la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni gnas mal la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This also applies to bedding.🔽This means that one should not accept it without being asked.

original: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni gnas mal la yang rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni gnas mal la yang rig par bya ba ste /
translated: This also applies to bedding.

original: gang gis bcol tam gang la yid gcugs pa yod pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de'i don du mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis bcol tam gang la yid gcugs pa yod pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur kyang de'i don du mnod par bya'o //
translated: If one is asked by someone who is not present, or by someone who is a place of trust, one should accept it for his sake even if one is not present.

original: zas la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This also applies to food.

original: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma bcol na mnod par mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba ste /
translated: This means that one should not accept it without being asked.

original: de dag ni gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one should not give an opportunity for others to speak.

original: gzhan gyi don du mnod pa pha rol la go par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du mnod pa pha rol la go par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should understand for the sake of others as for the sake of others, one should understand.

original: gzhan gyi don du rnyed pa dang gnas mal la sogs pa mnod pa gang zag pha rol po gzhan dag la go par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du rnyed pa dang gnas mal la sogs pa mnod pa gang zag pha rol po gzhan dag la go par bya ba ste /
translated: One should understand for the sake of others as for the sake of others, one should understand the share of gain and dwelling place, etc.

original: 'di yang gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan gyi tshig gi skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also in order to prevent the opportunity for others' words.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nod par byed par pha rol la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nod par byed par pha rol la go bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, One should understand for the sake of others.

original: mi dbang bas nang du zhugs te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dbang bas nang du zhugs te mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not enter the inner quarters of those who are not kings.

original: rnyed pa mi dbang bas gang dag dbang ba de dag gi nang du zhugs te skal ba mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa mi dbang bas gang dag dbang ba de dag gi nang du zhugs te skal ba mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter the inner quarters of those who are not kings and accept a share of gain there.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the text says:

original: de lta bas na dge slong gis gzhan gyi rnyed par 'jug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong gis gzhan gyi rnyed par 'jug par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, a monk should not enter the gain of others.

original: 'dir dpe gzhan yang tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' mgron du ma pos pas zan zos nas de nas yon ras yug chen mnos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpe gzhan yang tshe dang ldan pa nye dga' mgron du ma pos pas zan zos nas de nas yon ras yug chen mnos pa yin no //
translated: Here, there is another example: the Venerable Upasena, having eaten food as a guest, then accepted a large cloth as a gift.

original: dbang ba gcig nyid kyis shin tu mang po thob pa la mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang ba gcig nyid kyis shin tu mang po thob pa la mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no reason why a single owner should not obtain many things.

original: gang zag dbang ba gcig nyid kyis rnyed pa shin tu mang po thob pa la mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag dbang ba gcig nyid kyis rnyed pa shin tu mang po thob pa la mi dbang ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no reason why a single owner should not obtain many things.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te gtsug lag khang na dge slong gcig pu 'dug par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gtsug lag khang na dge slong gcig pu 'dug par gyur la /
translated: If a single monk were to stay in a monastery,

original: der rnyed pa shin tu mang po grub par gyur kyang /
analyzed: der rnyed pa shin tu mang po grub par gyur kyang /
translated: and many things were to be obtained there,

original: dbang ba nyung ba mi dbang ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbang ba nyung ba mi dbang ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: there would be no reason why a small owner should not be the owner of those things.

original: snyed pa de de nyid kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snyed pa de de nyid kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that those things belong to him alone.

original: 'dir khungs ni rgan zhugs de gnyis 'di snyam du bdag cag gnyis la ras yug chen brgya ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir khungs ni rgan zhugs de gnyis 'di snyam du bdag cag gnyis la ras yug chen brgya ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here is the source: Those two old men thought, “How could we get a hundred large cloths?

original: gzhan nas 'jug tu gzhug par bya'o snyam du sems so zhes gsungs pa dang / ded dpon gyis dge @176b 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang du rnyed pa mang po bskur ba na /
analyzed: gzhan nas 'jug tu gzhug par bya'o snyam du sems so zhes gsungs pa dang / ded dpon gyis dge @176b 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang du rnyed pa mang po bskur ba na /
translated: When a caravan leader sent much wealth to the monastery for the sake of the Saṅgha,

original: gtsug lag khang de na dge slong gcig bu zhig gnas pa de 'gyod pas mi len pa nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang de na dge slong gcig bu zhig gnas pa de 'gyod pas mi len pa nas /
translated: a single monk living in that monastery did not accept it out of regret.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni de na gang gnas pa de'i yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //🔽bye ba na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de ni de na gang gnas pa de'i yin no zhes rjes su gnang ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no // bye ba na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Bhagavān allowed it, saying, “That belongs to whoever lives there.”🔽When the Saṅgha is divided, those who side with what is not Dharma do not control the Saṅgha’s wealth.

original: dge 'dun bye ba na gang zag gang chos kyi phyogs dang mthun pa spangs te chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi dbang pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun bye ba na gang zag gang chos kyi phyogs dang mthun pa spangs te chos ma yin pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag tu song ba gang yin pa de dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa mi dbang pa'o //
translated: When the Saṅgha is divided, those who abandon the side of Dharma and go to the side of what is not Dharma do not control the Saṅgha’s wealth.

original: de'i dus kyi rnyed pa la ni ches ring du gnas na gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi rnyed pa la ni ches ring du gnas na gnas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it remains for a long time, it remains for that time.

original: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa'i dus der 'byung ba'i rnyed pa ni de'i dus kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa la sogs pa'i dus der 'byung ba'i rnyed pa ni de'i dus kyi rnyed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which arises at the time of the summer retreat and so on is called the gain of that time.

original: de la ni gang zag dus ches yun ring du dbyar gyi nang na gnas gnas na /
analyzed: de la ni gang zag dus ches yun ring du dbyar gyi nang na gnas gnas na /
translated: If the person stays in the summer retreat for a very long time,

original: dus de bas thung ba zhig gnas par ma gyur du zin kyang de rnyed pa de la gnas pa nyid yin pas rnyed pa de'i skal ba dbang ba'o //
analyzed: dus de bas thung ba zhig gnas par ma gyur du zin kyang de rnyed pa de la gnas pa nyid yin pas rnyed pa de'i skal ba dbang ba'o //
translated: even if he stays for a shorter time than that, he still remains in that gain, so he is entitled to a share of that gain.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gang dus ches yun ring du 'dug 'dug nas gnas gzhan du song ba de ni de'i dus kyi rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang dus ches yun ring du 'dug 'dug nas gnas gzhan du song ba de ni de'i dus kyi rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin te /
translated: If one stays for a very long time and then goes to another place, that is the gain of that time.

original: de ni song ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni song ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of one who has gone.

original: babs pa dang shi bar gyur pa gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: babs pa dang shi bar gyur pa gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also by falling and dying.

original: 'di gnyis kyang ches ring du gnas gnas pa yin na des dus kyi rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang ches ring du gnas gnas pa yin na des dus kyi rnyed pa dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: If these two are kept for a long time, they are called “obtained by the power of time.”🔽Because these two are also called “obtained by the power of need,” if one has no need for them, they are not obtained.

original: 'di ltar 'di gnyis la yang rnyed pa dgos pa yod de 'ga' zhig la dbul lam /🔽bu lon pa yod dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di gnyis la yang rnyed pa dgos pa yod de 'ga' zhig la dbul lam / bu lon pa yod dam /
translated: For example, if one has no need for them, such as if one is not poor, or if one has no debts,

original: nad g-yog la yo byad drug ma 'byor na de sbyin par bya ba nyid dang / dge slong rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyi brlabs pa la sogs par shi ba'i rnyed pa'i skal ba dang spyad pa'i sgo de lta bu dag yod la /
analyzed: nad g-yog la yo byad drug ma 'byor na de sbyin par bya ba nyid dang / dge slong rnams kyis shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyi brlabs pa la sogs par shi ba'i rnyed pa'i skal ba dang spyad pa'i sgo de lta bu dag yod la /
translated: or if one is not sick and has no need for a nurse, or if one does not have the six articles needed for a ritual, or if one has no need for the share of the deceased, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead monk, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead nun, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead novice, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead novice nun, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead layperson, or if one has no need for the articles of a dead layperson who is not a monk, then they are not obtained.

original: babs pa la ni dngos su dgos pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: babs pa la ni dngos su dgos pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if one has need for them, they are obtained, because they are needed in reality.

original: rnyed pa ni ji ltar rnam par nges par byed pa ltar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni ji ltar rnam par nges par byed pa ltar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The presentation of “obtained by the power of need” is like the presentation of “obtained by the power of action.”

original: rnyed pa ni bdag po dag gis rnyed pa 'di ni 'di ltar rnam par nges par bya'o zhes bsngos shing ji ltar rnam pa nges par byas pa de'i rjes su 'brang bas rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni bdag po dag gis rnyed pa 'di ni 'di ltar rnam par nges par bya'o zhes bsngos shing ji ltar rnam pa nges par byas pa de'i rjes su 'brang bas rnam par gzhag par bya ba ste /
translated: The owner of the gain determines it and it is established by following that determination.

original: gtsug lag khang 'di na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas mal dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa longs spyad par @177a * //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang 'di na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas mal dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa longs spyad par @177a * //
translated: The gain is for the monks who live in this monastery to enjoy bedding, alms, and so on.

original: bya'o zhe'am / dgun nam dgun smad dam dpyid dam sos ka 'am /
analyzed: bya'o zhe'am / dgun nam dgun smad dam dpyid dam sos ka 'am /
translated: Or it is for the summer, winter, or spring rainy season or for the autumn rainy season.

original: dbyar ram ston gnas pa'i dge 'dun rnams la rnyed pa 'di 'bul gyi 'di na gnas pa'i dus tshigs 'di'i khengs su gtogs pas spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
analyzed: dbyar ram ston gnas pa'i dge 'dun rnams la rnyed pa 'di 'bul gyi 'di na gnas pa'i dus tshigs 'di'i khengs su gtogs pas spyad par bya'o zhe'am /
translated: Or it is for the Saṅgha who live in this rainy season.🔽Or it is for whoever lives in this house or this home.

original: gang la la gnas khang 'di 'am khang khyim 'di na gnas pa de la rnyed pa 'di khud par 'bul gyi des 'di spyad par bya'o zhes de ltar yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang ngam /🔽dus tshigs sam /
analyzed: gang la la gnas khang 'di 'am khang khyim 'di na gnas pa de la rnyed pa 'di khud par 'bul gyi des 'di spyad par bya'o zhes de ltar yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang ngam /🔽dus tshigs sam /
translated: The owner of the gain gives it to them and they enjoy it.

original: gnas khang dag gi dbang du byas te dge 'dun nam gang zag gang la rnyed pa bsngos shing rnam par nges par byas pa de ni de kho na bzhin du gtsug lag khang dang / dus tshigs dang / gnas khang de na dge 'dun nam gang zag su gnas pa dag gis 'khrul ba med par spyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas khang dag gi dbang du byas te dge 'dun nam gang zag gang la rnyed pa bsngos shing rnam par nges par byas pa de ni de kho na bzhin du gtsug lag khang dang / dus tshigs dang / gnas khang de na dge 'dun nam gang zag su gnas pa dag gis 'khrul ba med par spyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: In terms of the dwelling place, if the offering is dedicated to a particular person or the Saṅgha, then that person or the Saṅgha may use it without error.

original: de ni yon bdag gis rnam par nges par byas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni yon bdag gis rnam par nges par byas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: This is in terms of the donor’s dedication.

original: 'thob pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnyed pa ni ji ltar rnam par nges par byed pa ltar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'thob pa rnams kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni / rnyed pa ni ji ltar rnam par nges par byed pa ltar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, in terms of the recipients.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The term also is stated to indicate that the offering is established in accordance with the dedication.

original: 'di ni gang gi tshe yon bdag gis rnam par nges par ma byas pa de'i tshe rnyed pa thob pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rnam par nges par byas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang gi tshe yon bdag gis rnam par nges par ma byas pa de'i tshe rnyed pa thob pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rnam par nges par byas pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: This is from the perspective of those who have obtained the property when the owner has not determined it.

original: khas blangs pa dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyogs gnyis kyis khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: khas blangs pa dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyogs gnyis kyis khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //
translated: When the two parties, the one who accepts and the one who does not accept, have made a rule, such as, “This large house is yours,

original: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o //
analyzed: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o //
translated: this large house is ours,

original: lam po che 'di ni khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: lam po che 'di ni khyed kyi'o //
translated: this road is yours,

original: lam po che 'di ni nged kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur khrims su bya ba bcas na /🔽gal te phyogs cig shos kyi rnam par nges par byas pa'i khyim la sogs pa gang yin pa de nas phyogs cig shos kyi rnyed pa gang thob pa de ni phyogs de mi dbang ste /
analyzed: lam po che 'di ni nged kyi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bur khrims su bya ba bcas na / gal te phyogs cig shos kyi rnam par nges par byas pa'i khyim la sogs pa gang yin pa de nas phyogs cig shos kyi rnyed pa gang thob pa de ni phyogs de mi dbang ste /
translated: this road is ours,”🔽then if the property is obtained from the house, etc., determined by one party, that property belongs to that party.

original: khyim la sogs pa de phyogs gang gir rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs de dbang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim la sogs pa de phyogs gang gir rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs de dbang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The house, etc., determined to belong to one party, should be understood to belong to that party.

original: gal te gcig gi phyogs su byas pa'i khyim du phyogs gnyi ga dus gcig tu tshogs te /
analyzed: gal te gcig gi phyogs su byas pa'i khyim du phyogs gnyi ga dus gcig tu tshogs te /
translated: If the two sides of the house come together at the same time,

original: rnyed pa mnyam du grub par gyur na yang rnyed pa de dag khyim de phyogs gang gi rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe dbang gi / phyogs cig shos mi dbang ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa mnyam du grub par gyur na yang rnyed pa de dag khyim de phyogs gang gi rnam par nges par byas pa'i phyogs de nyi tshe dbang gi / phyogs cig shos mi dbang ste /
translated: and the wealth is established equally, then that wealth belongs to the side of the house that is determined by the direction of the side that is established. The other side does not have control over it.

original: phyogs des thob tu zin kyang phyogs cig shos la dbul bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: phyogs des thob tu zin kyang phyogs cig shos la dbul bar bya dgos so //
translated: Even if the other side obtains it, it must be given to the other side.

original: ji ste dbang ba'i phyogs des byin na ni mi dbang ba'i phyogs kyis @177b kyang ci bder longs spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ste dbang ba'i phyogs des byin na ni mi dbang ba'i phyogs kyis @177b kyang ci bder longs spyad du rung ngo //
translated: If the side that has control gives it, then the side that does not have control can also use it as it wishes.

original: la la 'di snyam du dogs te /
analyzed: la la 'di snyam du dogs te /
translated: Some think as follows:

original: khyim der phyogs gnyi gas rnyed pa grub pa na phyogs cig shos kyis kyang rnyed pa grub pa yin na de'i skal ba cig shos la dbul ci dgos snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyim der phyogs gnyi gas rnyed pa grub pa na phyogs cig shos kyis kyang rnyed pa grub pa yin na de'i skal ba cig shos la dbul ci dgos snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: If the two sides of the house establish the wealth, then the other side also establishes the wealth. What need is there to give the share of the other side?🔽In order to dispel this doubt, he says,

original: thams cad kyis phul na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis phul na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: even if all give it.

original: spyin bdag thams cad kyis gang gi tshe rnyed pa 'bul bar byed du zin kyang de'i tshe 'thob pa rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de'i rjes su 'brang bas rnyed pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyin bdag thams cad kyis gang gi tshe rnyed pa 'bul bar byed du zin kyang de'i tshe 'thob pa rnams kyis rnam par gzhag pa byas pa de'i rjes su 'brang bas rnyed pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: When all the benefactors offer their gifts, the monks who have established the boundaries follow the established boundaries and know how to distribute the gifts.

original: 'o na 'di skad ces gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi dbye ba de'i tshe dge slong dag gis khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'di skad ces gang gi tshe dge 'dun gyi dbye ba de'i tshe dge slong dag gis khyim che ge mo ni khyed kyi'o //
translated: But it is said, “When the Saṅgha is divided, the monks make agreements such as, ‘This house belongs to you,

original: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o zhes de dang de ltar khrims su bya ba bcas nas dbyar gnas par khas len par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: khyim che ge mo ni nged kyi'o zhes de dang de ltar khrims su bya ba bcas nas dbyar gnas par khas len par byed do zhes gsungs pas /
