translated: this house belongs to us.’ They accept the rainy season retreat after making such agreements.”

original: 'dir dbyar gyi dus su bye ba dag gi phyogs gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir dbyar gyi dus su bye ba dag gi phyogs gnyis kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it said that the two sides of the divided Saṅgha make such agreements during the rainy season?

original: 'dir dbyar gyi dus su bye ba dag gi phyogs gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'dir dbyar gyi dus su bye ba dag gi phyogs gnyis ni dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: The two sides of the divided Saṅgha during the rainy season are merely an example.

original: dgun la sogs pa dag gi dus tshigs gzhan dang sde tshan gzhan dag la yang 'di rung bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dgun la sogs pa dag gi dus tshigs gzhan dang sde tshan gzhan dag la yang 'di rung bas de'i phyir /
translated: Since this is also appropriate for other seasons and other groups, such as winter and so on,

original: 'dir spyir mdor bsdus so //
analyzed: 'dir spyir mdor bsdus so //
translated: it is generally summarized here.

original: gal te zas la yang de ltar rnam par nges par byas par gyur na de'i tshe phyogs cig shos kyis rjes su ma gnang na /
analyzed: gal te zas la yang de ltar rnam par nges par byas par gyur na de'i tshe phyogs cig shos kyis rjes su ma gnang na /
translated: If one determines food in this way, then if one side does not permit it,

original: phyogs gzhan gyis bza' bar mi bya ste ;
analyzed: phyogs gzhan gyis bza' bar mi bya ste ;
translated: one should not eat it on the other side.

original: de lta bas na rnyed pa thams cad la yang rjes su gnang ba nyid yin na ni nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnyed pa thams cad la yang rjes su gnang ba nyid yin na ni nyes pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if all gains are permitted, one should understand that there is no fault.

original: dge 'dun yongs su ma bcad na las kyi mtshams kyis yongs su bcad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun yongs su ma bcad na las kyi mtshams kyis yongs su bcad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the Saṅgha is not determined, it is determined by the boundary of the rite.

original: sbyin bdag gis 'di skad ces bdag gis dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis 'di skad ces bdag gis dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer zhing /
translated: The donor says, “I offer to the Saṅgha.”

original: dge 'dun gang dag la 'bul ba yongs su ma bcad par rnyed pa rnam par nges par ma byas na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gang dag la 'bul ba yongs su ma bcad par rnyed pa rnam par nges par ma byas na /
translated: If the Saṅgha to whom the offering is made is not determined, the gain is not determined.

original: de'i tshe las kyi mtshams kyis dge 'dun yongs su gcad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyi mtshams kyis dge 'dun yongs su gcad par bya ste /
translated: At that time, the Saṅgha should be determined by the boundary of the rite.

original: las kyi mtshams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las kyi mtshams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The “boundary of activity” is the boundary of activity.

original: las byar rung ba'i mtshams te /
analyzed: las byar rung ba'i mtshams te /
translated: The boundary of activity is the boundary of activity.

original: mtshams chen po bcad pa'i gnas na ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
analyzed: mtshams chen po bcad pa'i gnas na ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
translated: In a place where a large boundary has been established, it is within a radius of one and a half yojanas.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas rtsig pas bskor ba na ni phyir 'i rtsig pa'i mtha' tshun chad do //
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa'i gnas rtsig pas bskor ba na ni phyir 'i rtsig pa'i mtha' tshun chad do //
translated: In a place that is not a large boundary but is surrounded by a wall, it is within the outer wall.

original: mtshams ma bcad pa'i rtsig pas ma bskor ba'i gnas na ni wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa'i snas gar sleb pa'i mtha' tshun chad do //🔽dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams gcad pa'i gnas @178a * //
analyzed: mtshams ma bcad pa'i rtsig pas ma bskor ba'i gnas na ni wa kha nas chu 'dzag pa'i snas gar sleb pa'i mtha' tshun chad do // dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams gcad pa'i gnas @178a * //
translated: In a place that is not a large boundary and is not surrounded by a wall, it is within the area reached by the sound of a cough from the gate.

original: na ni de nyid kyi mtha' tshun chad do //
analyzed: na ni de nyid kyi mtha' tshun chad do //
translated: In a place where a boundary of a maṇḍala has been established, it is within that boundary.

original: grong gi gnas na ni grong gi nye 'khor gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
analyzed: grong gi gnas na ni grong gi nye 'khor gyi mtha' tshun chad do //
translated: In a place that is a village, it is within the vicinity of the village.

original: mtshams de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa de dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa de dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the property belongs to the monks who are within those boundaries.

original: 'di la gcig la sogs pa de ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la gcig la sogs pa de ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “that very one” refers to one and so on.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir phul pa'i rnyed pa 'di la gang zag gcig la sogs pa'i dge 'dun du ma langs pa mtshams gcig gi nang du gtogs pa rnams ni dge 'dun nyid dang 'dra ste /🔽de dag rnyed pa de dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir phul pa'i rnyed pa 'di la gang zag gcig la sogs pa'i dge 'dun du ma langs pa mtshams gcig gi nang du gtogs pa rnams ni dge 'dun nyid dang 'dra ste / de dag rnyed pa de dbang ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the Sangha of many individuals, such as one, who are within the same boundary, control that property.

original: dper na dge slong skyes pa 'am bud med 'ga' zhig la brten nas dbyar gnas par khas len cing gnas de na bud med la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pa 'bul bar byed na mtshams de'i nang du gtogs pa rnams kyi rnyed pa de /
analyzed: dper na dge slong skyes pa 'am bud med 'ga' zhig la brten nas dbyar gnas par khas len cing gnas de na bud med la sogs pas dge 'dun gyi phyir rnyed pa 'bul bar byed na mtshams de'i nang du gtogs pa rnams kyi rnyed pa de /
translated: For example, if one accepts the rainy season retreat in dependence on a male or female lay person, and if that lay person offers property to the Sangha, then that property belongs to the Sangha within that boundary.

original: gal te bdag gis 'di nyid kyi dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer la /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis 'di nyid kyi dge 'dun la phul lo zhes zer la /
translated: If the lay person says, “I offer this to the Sangha of this place,”

original: gal te de na gang zag gzhan med na ni rnyed pa de mtshams kyis bstabs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de na gang zag gzhan med na ni rnyed pa de mtshams kyis bstabs pa yin no //
translated: then if there are no other individuals in that place, that property is offered to the Sangha of that boundary.

original: gal te 'di khyod kho na la phul lo zhes zer na ni rnyed pa de rten gyis bstabs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di khyod kho na la phul lo zhes zer na ni rnyed pa de rten gyis bstabs pa yin te /
translated: If the lay person says, “I offer this to you alone,” then that property is offered to the Sangha of that individual.

original: rten gyi dbang gis grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽chos kyi rnyed pa ni de smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rten gyi dbang gis grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // chos kyi rnyed pa ni de smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase “established by the power of the basis.”🔽The acquisition of the Dharma is the property of those who teach it.

original: chos la phul ba'i rnyed pa na chos smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la phul ba'i rnyed pa na chos smra ba rnams dbang ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The acquisition of the Dharma that is offered to the Dharma is the property of those who teach the Dharma.

original: 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa dag las mya ngan las 'das pa la phul ba ni mchod rten gyi dang 'dra bar gzhag go zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'dul ba bye brag tu bshad pa dag las mya ngan las 'das pa la phul ba ni mchod rten gyi dang 'dra bar gzhag go zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The Vinaya-vibhāṣā says, “That which is offered to nirvāṇa is like that which is offered to a caitya.”

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, you should understand that this refers to the acquisition of the Dharma that is taught, etc.,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi rnyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to the acquisition of the Dharma of nirvāṇa.

original: gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa ni 'dir de nyid kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la /🔽gtsug lag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa ni 'dir de nyid kyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la / gtsug lag ces bya ba ni /
translated: The limit of that is the retention of a single verse of scripture.🔽The term scripture refers to

original: drang srong gis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: drang srong gis gsungs pa ste /
translated: the words of the ṛṣis.

original: de'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa ni chos kyi rnyed pa dbang ba 'di la chos smra ba de nyid kyi phyir mtha' yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dzin pa ni chos kyi rnyed pa dbang ba 'di la chos smra ba de nyid kyi phyir mtha' yin no //
translated: The one who memorizes one verse of this Dharma teaching is the one who has obtained the Dharma, and the one who has obtained the Dharma is the one who has obtained the ultimate.

original: mdo 'di ni rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gzhung las byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni rtsod pa'i gzhi'i gzhung las byung ngo //
translated: This sūtra is quoted in the text of the treatise on the topics of dispute.

original: mtshan mi mthun pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la cig shos yod na mi dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan mi mthun pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la cig shos yod na mi dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the other is present, one does not have the right to the property of the dead when the signs do not match.

original: mtshan ma mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge tshul gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge tshul gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la ni /
translated: When the signs match, the property of the dead belongs to the class of fully ordained monks and novices.

original: dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma dag mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma dag mi dbang ngo //
translated: Fully ordained nuns, probationary nuns, and novice nuns do not have the right to it.

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang @178b dge tshul ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad de la yang dge slong dang dge tshul dag mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang @178b dge tshul ma'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad de la yang dge slong dang dge tshul dag mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Similarly, the property of the dead belonging to the class of fully ordained nuns, probationary nuns, and novice nuns does not belong to fully ordained monks and novices.

original: ci thams cad du yang zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci thams cad du yang zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it always so? No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir cig shos yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir cig shos yod na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if the other is present.”

original: cig shos zhes bya ba mtshan mthun pa yod na mtshan mi mthun pa mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba mtshan mthun pa yod na mtshan mi mthun pa mi dbang ngo //
translated: The other means that if there is one of the same gender, one of the opposite gender is not allowed.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gang na mtshan mthun pa yod pa de na mtshan mi mthun pa mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gang na mtshan mthun pa yod pa de na mtshan mi mthun pa mi dbang ngo //
translated: If there is one of the same gender, one of the opposite gender is not allowed.

original: gang na mtshan mthun pa med pa de na ni mtshan mi mthun pa yang dbang ngo //
analyzed: gang na mtshan mthun pa med pa de na ni mtshan mi mthun pa yang dbang ngo //
translated: If there is not one of the same gender, then one of the opposite gender is allowed.

original: mdo 'di ni gleng gzhi'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni gleng gzhi'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
translated: This sūtra is found in the text of the nidāna.

original: gnas nas phyung ba'i yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas nas phyung ba'i yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same is true of what is removed from the place.

original: gnas nas phyung ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la yang gnas nas ma phyung ba cig shos yod na gnas nas phyung ba mi dbang la /
analyzed: gnas nas phyung ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la yang gnas nas ma phyung ba cig shos yod na gnas nas phyung ba mi dbang la /
translated: If there is one of the same gender in the possessions of the dead that are included in the continuum of what is removed from the place, then what is removed from the place is not allowed.

original: gnas nas ma phyung ba med na ni gnas nas phyung ba dbang ngo //
analyzed: gnas nas ma phyung ba med na ni gnas nas phyung ba dbang ngo //
translated: If there is not one of the same gender, then what is removed from the place is allowed.

original: med na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is not, then also.

original: ma spangs pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la ni ma spangs pa cig shos med na yang spangs pa mi dbang ba'o ;
analyzed: ma spangs pa'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la ni ma spangs pa cig shos med na yang spangs pa mi dbang ba'o ;
translated: If there is not one of the same gender in the possessions of the dead that are included in the continuum of what is not abandoned, then what is abandoned is not allowed.

original: / ci dus thams cad du 'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: / ci dus thams cad du 'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not.

original: de'i phyir rgyu las sems ma log na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu las sems ma log na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “as long as the mind has not turned away from the cause.”

original: ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis de gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas pa'i rgyu de las sems ma log cing bzlog par ma byas pa de gnas nas ma phyung ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la gnas nas ma phyung ba
analyzed: ltung ba ma mthong ba la sogs pa'i rgyu gang gis de gnas nas dbyung ba'i las byas pa'i rgyu de las sems ma log cing bzlog par ma byas pa de gnas nas ma phyung ba'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la gnas nas ma phyung ba
translated: As long as the mind has not turned away from the cause that is, has not turned away from and has not abandoned the cause for which the act of ejecting him from the monastery was performed, he is still considered to be a member of the order and is entitled to a share of the property of the order.

original: cig shos med na yang mi dbang gi / rgyu las sems log na ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: cig shos med na yang mi dbang gi / rgyu las sems log na ni dbang ngo //
translated: However, if the mind has turned away from the cause, he is no longer entitled to a share.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang dbang lags /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang dbang lags /
translated: What is the scriptural basis for this?

original: de dag las gang gis dang por sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de'i de mnod par bya ba nyid la de ni tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag las gang gis dang por sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // de'i de mnod par bya ba nyid la de ni tha dad pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Buddha said, “Those who abandon the initial form of a sinful view are entitled to a share.”🔽The root text states, “The property of the deceased is to be given to him, but he is not entitled to a separate share.”

original: spangs pa de'i shi ba'i yo byad de mnod par bya ba nyid las /
analyzed: spangs pa de'i shi ba'i yo byad de mnod par bya ba nyid las /
translated: The property of the deceased is to be given to him, but he is not entitled to a separate share.

original: spangs pa de ni ma spangs pa dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa de ni ma spangs pa dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: That relinquishment is not different from the non-relinquishment.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: spangs pa de dag gi shi ba'i yo byed de dag mnod par bya ba nyid la spangs pa de dag ni ma spangs pa dag dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spangs pa de dag gi shi ba'i yo byed de dag mnod par bya ba nyid la spangs pa de dag ni ma spangs pa dag dang tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who have taken up the property of the deceased who have relinquished should not take up the property of the deceased who have relinquished, because that relinquishment is not different from the non-relinquishment.

original: spangs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad pa ni /🔽spangs pa cig shos yod kyang ma spangs pa yang dbang ste /
analyzed: spangs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad pa ni / spangs pa cig shos yod kyang ma spangs pa yang dbang ste /
translated: The property of the deceased who have relinquished

original: spangs pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa ni dge 'dun las tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not to be taken up by those who have relinquished, even if it exists, because relinquishment is not different from the Saṅgha.🔽That which is different is different.

original: tha dad pa'i la ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni //🔽khas blangs pa dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyogs tha dad pa'i shi @179a * //🔽ba'i yo byad la ni phyogs de gnyis tha dad pa yin pas /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i la ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni // khas blangs pa dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyogs tha dad pa'i shi @179a * // ba'i yo byad la ni phyogs de gnyis tha dad pa yin pas /
translated: This is accepted.🔽The property of the deceased who have relinquished is different from the property of the deceased who have not relinquished, because those two positions are different.

original: phyogs tha dad pa'i shi ba'i yo byad blang bar bya ba nyid la tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs tha dad pa'i shi ba'i yo byad blang bar bya ba nyid la tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The property of the deceased who have relinquished is to be taken up by those who have relinquished, because it is different from the property of the deceased who have not relinquished.

original: gcig la gcig mi dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig la gcig mi dbang po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term “not belonging to one another” is that they do not belong to one another.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i gang zag mi dbang bas chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad la yang /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad la gzhan gyi phyogs su gtogs pa'i gang zag mi dbang bas chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi pa'i yo byad la yang /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa mi dbang la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa mi dbang la /
translated: The property of one who belongs to the faction of Dharma does not belong to one who belongs to the faction of non-Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la yang chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs ba mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i shi ba'i yo byad la yang chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs su gtogs ba mi dbang ngo //
translated: and the property of one who belongs to the faction of non-Dharma does not belong to one who belongs to the faction of Dharma.

original: 'dir gzhung ni khas blangs pa rnams kyi gnas su khas ma blangs pa'i dge tshul 'ongs te dus byas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni khas blangs pa rnams kyi gnas su khas ma blangs pa'i dge tshul 'ongs te dus byas par gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says, “If a novice monk who has not taken the vows comes and dies in the residence of those who have taken the vows,” and so on.

original: chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Those who belong to the faction of Dharma have taken the vows.

original: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas ma blangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang mthun pa'i phyogs khas blangs pa ni khas ma blangs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the acceptance of a position that is not Dharma is not an acceptance.

original: rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa dag de mi dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa dag de mi dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Others than the ordained and those who practice pure conduct do not have a right to it.

original: rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa nye du la sogs pa dang rgyal po yang rab tu byung ba'i shi ba'i yo byad de mi dbang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa las gzhan pa nye du la sogs pa dang rgyal po yang rab tu byung ba'i shi ba'i yo byad de mi dbang ba nyid yin te /
translated: Others than the ordained and those who practice pure conduct, such as relatives, etc., and even kings, do not have a right to the property of an ordained person who has died.

original: de ni rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag kho na dbang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rab tu byung ba dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag kho na dbang ba yin no //
translated: That is only for the ordained and those who practice pure conduct.

original: 'dir rab tu byung ba zhes smos pa ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang dge slob ma yang dbang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rab tu byung ba zhes smos pa ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang dge slob ma yang dbang ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the mention of the ordained is to show that novices, female novices, and female probationers also have a right to it.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The mention of those who practice pure conduct

original: gzhan mu stegs can bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is to exclude non-Buddhists.

original: gsol ba 'am dang po dang thams phyin gyis brlabs zin pa ni 'ongs pa ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsol ba 'am dang po dang thams phyin gyis brlabs zin pa ni 'ongs pa ni mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first and last lines indicate that the Buddha is not subject to coming and going.🔽

original: shi pa'i yo byad la dge 'dun gyis gsol bas byin gyis brlabs su zin kyang rung /
analyzed: shi pa'i yo byad la dge 'dun gyis gsol bas byin gyis brlabs su zin kyang rung /
translated: If the Sangha has already consecrated the property of the deceased through a motion,

original: dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlabs zin kyang rung ste /🔽de'i 'og tu rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ongs pa dag ni mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlabs zin kyang rung ste / de'i 'og tu rab tu byung ba tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'ongs pa dag ni mi dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: whether or not it has already been consecrated by the first or last rites,🔽the property belongs to the Sangha.🔽If the property of the deceased has not been consecrated by either of these two rites,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa de gnyis ma zin pa'i skabs su 'ongs pa ni dbang ngo //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa de gnyis ma zin pa'i skabs su 'ongs pa ni dbang ngo //
translated: the property belongs to the spiritual companions who arrive later.🔽If the deceased had already made a gift of his property to the Sangha,

original: dang por shi ba'i bsod nams su yon bshad pa byas nas phyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dang por shi ba'i bsod nams su yon bshad pa byas nas phyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: the consecration should be done after the announcement of the gift.

original: gal te yon bshad pa ma byas par byin gyis @179b brlabs pa de gnyis byed na ni /
analyzed: gal te yon bshad pa ma byas par byin gyis @179b brlabs pa de gnyis byed na ni /
translated: If the consecration is done without the announcement of the gift,

original: byin gyis brlabs pa des phyis 'ongs pa dag skal ba mi dbang ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur la byin gyis brlabs pa de yang mi 'chags so //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa des phyis 'ongs pa dag skal ba mi dbang ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur la byin gyis brlabs pa de yang mi 'chags so //
translated: By that consecration, those who come later do not become undeserving of a share, and that consecration is not lost.

original: yon bshad pa'i 'og tu byin gyis rlob na ni byin gyis brlabs pa de yang 'chags la phyis 'ongs pa dag kyang skal ba mi dbang pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon bshad pa'i 'og tu byin gyis rlob na ni byin gyis brlabs pa de yang 'chags la phyis 'ongs pa dag kyang skal ba mi dbang pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is consecrated after the explanation of the offerings, that consecration is lost and those who come later become undeserving of a share.

original: gsol bas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: gsol bas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for consecration through request is:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: Venerable saṅgha, please listen!

original: 'di ltar gnas 'dir dge slong nye dga' gum na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas 'dir dge slong nye dga' gum na /
translated: In this place, the monk Udayī has passed away.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong nye dga' gum pa'i rdzas bgo bar bgyi ba gum pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma lags pa gda' ba dang mi gda' ba byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong nye dga' gum pa'i rdzas bgo bar bgyi ba gum pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma lags pa gda' ba dang mi gda' ba byin gyis brlab po //
translated: If the time is right for the saṅgha and you accept, please grant permission for the saṅgha to distribute the belongings of the deceased monk Udayī. The belongings of the deceased, whether robes or non-robes, will be consecrated.

original: 'di ni gsol pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gsol pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is the request, it is said.

original: 'dir nye dga' zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir nye dga' zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Here, the term “Upananda”

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs par zad de /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis gsungs par zad de /
translated: is mentioned only because of the nidana.

original: las bya ba'i skabs su ni gang zag gang shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba de nyid kyi ming nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las bya ba'i skabs su ni gang zag gang shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba de nyid kyi ming nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: When it is time to perform the rite, the name of the person whose possessions are to be consecrated should be mentioned.

original: dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the consecration by the first and last,

original: de las 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyis la byin pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de las 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyis la byin pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “From that, some give to the elder and the junior of the Saṅgha. That is called…”

original: de las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “From that” means

original: shi ba'i yo byad de las so //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad de las so //
translated: from those possessions of the deceased.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni dngos po 'ga' zhig go //
translated: “Some” means some things.

original: rgan pa zhes bya ba ni gral gtso'o //
analyzed: rgan pa zhes bya ba ni gral gtso'o //
translated: “Elder” means the chief of the row.

original: gsar bu zhes bya ba ni gral tha ma na 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gsar bu zhes bya ba ni gral tha ma na 'dug pa ste /
translated: “Junior” means sitting at the end of the row.

original: de gnyis la shi ba'i yo byad de las dngos po sna re zhig sbyin pa ni dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab pa de zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la shi ba'i yo byad de las dngos po sna re zhig sbyin pa ni dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab pa de zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving one thing from those possessions of the deceased to those two is called “consecration by the first and last.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni yo byad cig btsongs te cung zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan pa dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la byin nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yo byad cig btsongs te cung zhig dge 'dun gyi rgan pa dang dge 'dun gyi gsar bu la byin nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text says that one should sell some property and give a little to the senior monk and a little to the junior monk.

original: de la dang po dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dang po dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the first and the last refers to

original: dge 'dun gyi rgan pa ni dang po yin la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rgan pa ni dang po yin la /
translated: the senior monk, who is the first,

original: dge 'dun gyi gsar bu ni tha ma yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gsar bu ni tha ma yin te /
translated: and the junior monk, who is the last.

original: shi ba'i yo byad kyi gnas der tshogs pa'i dge 'dun tshul bzhin du dngar ba rnams las dang po dang tha ma de gnyis la shi ba'i yo byad de las dngos po sna re phul na cho ga de nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad kyi gnas der tshogs pa'i dge 'dun tshul bzhin du dngar ba rnams las dang po dang tha ma de gnyis la shi ba'i yo byad de las dngos po sna re phul na cho ga de nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin no //
translated: If one gives one item from the deceased’s property to those two, the first and the last, then the entire property is consecrated by that very ritual.

original: yang rnam pa gcig tu na dang po dang tha ma zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gcig tu na dang po dang tha ma zhes bya ba /
translated: Alternatively, the first and the last refers to

original: phyogs gcig dang tshig gcig gis kyang bstan te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig dang tshig gcig gis kyang bstan te /
translated: one part and one statement.

original: tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The last refers to

original: rgan rabs nas rjes su mthun par bgrangs nas gsar bu tha ma @180a * //
analyzed: rgan rabs nas rjes su mthun par bgrangs nas gsar bu tha ma @180a * //
translated: the junior monk, who is the last in the sequence of the senior monks.

original: yin pa / gzhon rabs nas rjes su mi mthun par bgrangs na rgan pa tha ma yin pas /
analyzed: yin pa / gzhon rabs nas rjes su mi mthun par bgrangs na rgan pa tha ma yin pas /
translated: If one counts from the youngest, the oldest is the last.

original: de ltar na rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyi ga tha ma zhes bya'o //🔽dang po zhes bya ba ni rgan rabs nas rjes su mthun par bgrangs te gsar bu tha mar byas na de la shi ba'i yo byad sna gcig dang por spyin dgos pas de dang po yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyi ga tha ma zhes bya'o // dang po zhes bya ba ni rgan rabs nas rjes su mthun par bgrangs te gsar bu tha mar byas na de la shi ba'i yo byad sna gcig dang por spyin dgos pas de dang po yin la /
translated: Thus, both the oldest and the youngest are called the last.🔽If one counts from the oldest, the youngest is the first.

original: gzhon rabs nas rjes su mi mthun pas bgrangs te /🔽rgan pa tha mar byas na de la yang shi ba'i yo byad sna gcig dang por sbyin dgos pas /
analyzed: gzhon rabs nas rjes su mi mthun pas bgrangs te / rgan pa tha mar byas na de la yang shi ba'i yo byad sna gcig dang por sbyin dgos pas /
translated: If one counts from the youngest, the oldest is the first.

original: de ltar na rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyi ga dang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rgan pa dang gsar bu gnyi ga dang po zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, both the oldest and the youngest are called the first.

original: de ni dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni dang po dang tha mas byin gyis brlab par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the consecration of the first and the last.

original: gang na byin gyis brlab pa bya ba 'dug pa de ni mtshams su gtogs pa rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang na byin gyis brlab pa bya ba 'dug pa de ni mtshams su gtogs pa rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is a consecration, those who belong to the boundary should perform the consecration.

original: gnas gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i dngos po 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa'i rab tu byung ba rnams ni de byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas gang na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i dngos po 'dug pa de'i mtshams su gtogs pa'i rab tu byung ba rnams ni de byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
translated: Those who are fully ordained within the boundary of a place where the articles to be consecrated are located consecrate those articles.

original: de dag gi dngos po de byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po de byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that those articles should be consecrated by them.

original: 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the place of death itself is not the cause.

original: shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'di las /
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'di las /
translated: In this consecration of the articles of the dead,

original: shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin te /🔽'dir shi ba de'i dbang gis mtshams de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas gzhan na shi ba'i yo byad 'dug pa byin gyis brlab tu ma rung ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: shi ba'i gnas nyid ni rgyu ma yin te / 'dir shi ba de'i dbang gis mtshams de na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas gzhan na shi ba'i yo byad 'dug pa byin gyis brlab tu ma rung ba nyid yin la /
translated: the place of death itself is not the cause.🔽Here, by the power of death in that place, the articles of the dead in another place are not suitable to be consecrated by the monks dwelling in that boundary.

original: gnas gzhan du shi ba de'i yo byad mtshams 'di na 'dug pa ni mtshams 'di na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis brlab tu rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du shi ba de'i yo byad mtshams 'di na 'dug pa ni mtshams 'di na gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis brlab tu rung ba nyid do //
translated: The articles of the dead in another place that are located in this boundary are suitable to be consecrated by the monks dwelling in this boundary.

original: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa la lus sam gzhan gyis reg pas ji tsam non pa der gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la /🔽mtshams kyi bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa la lus sam gzhan gyis reg pas ji tsam non pa der gtogs pa rnams so zhes bya ba la / mtshams kyi bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are within the boundary, either by their bodies or by other objects, are those who are touched by it.

original: mtshams gzhan dang gzhan gyi bar ro //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan dang gzhan gyi bar ro //
translated: The boundary is the space between one boundary and another.

original: de dag na byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'dug pa ni mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'o //🔽mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la shi ba de'i lus kyis reg gam khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pa'i shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba des mtshams ji tsam non cing khyab pa'i mtshams der gtogs pa'i
analyzed: de dag na byin gyis brlab par bya ba 'dug pa ni mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'o // mtshams kyi bar na 'dug pa'i shi ba'i yo byad de la shi ba de'i lus kyis reg gam khri dang khri'u la sogs pa gzhan gyis reg pa'i shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba des mtshams ji tsam non cing khyab pa'i mtshams der gtogs pa'i
translated: Those who are within the boundary are those who are within the space between boundaries.

original: dge slong rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams byin gyis rlob par byed pa yin te /
translated: The articles of a dead monk are those that are to be consecrated. The articles of a dead monk are either touched by the body of the dead monk, or touched by other objects such as a bed or a chair. The articles of a dead monk are consecrated by those monks who are within the boundary that is touched and pervaded by that consecration.

original: mtshams de na gnas shing 'khod pa de dag gis byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
analyzed: mtshams de na gnas shing 'khod pa de dag gis byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
translated: Those who are within that boundary, who are present and assembled, should consecrate it.

original: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan na gnas pa dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are within another boundary should not consecrate it.

original: de lta bas na 'di la ni @180b byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi shi ba'i ro'i dbang gis ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la ni @180b byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i rdzas kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi shi ba'i ro'i dbang gis ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ritual is performed on the basis of the substance that is consecrated, not on the basis of the corpse.

original: gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa de'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa de'i khongs su yo byad gtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ritual is performed in the same region where the wealth is,🔽because the articles of the deceased belong to the saṃgha of that region.

original: mtshams gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i mtshams de'i khongs su shi ba'i yo byad mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa yang gtogs pas /🔽des na mtshams gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i mtshams de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyis mtshams de nyid kyi nang du nor dang 'dra ba de byin gyis brlabs na shi ba'i yo byad mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa'i chos gos dang chos gos ma
analyzed: mtshams gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i mtshams de'i khongs su shi ba'i yo byad mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa yang gtogs pas / des na mtshams gang na nor dang 'dra ba de 'dug pa'i mtshams de'i khongs su gtogs pa'i dge 'dun gyis mtshams de nyid kyi nang du nor dang 'dra ba de byin gyis brlabs na shi ba'i yo byad mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa'i chos gos dang chos gos ma
translated: The ritual is performed in the same region where the wealth is, because the articles of the deceased that are in another region belong to the saṃgha of that region.

original: yin pa snang ba dang mi snang ba thams cad byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yin pa snang ba dang mi snang ba thams cad byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, if the saṃgha of the region where the wealth is consecrates the wealth in that region, then all the articles of the deceased that are in that region, whether they are robes or not, whether they are visible or not, are consecrated.

original: nor dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nor dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like wealth

original: khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba gang gi lag tu gzhag shing shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba gzhag pa'i khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba de la bya ste /🔽de ni nor de'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'am de'i gzugs brnyan nam /
analyzed: khyim pa 'am rab tu byung ba gang gi lag tu gzhag shing shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par bya ba gzhag pa'i khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba de la bya ste / de ni nor de'i dngos po dang 'dra ba'am de'i gzugs brnyan nam /
translated: means that the wealth of the deceased should be placed in the hands of a layperson or a monastic and the ritual for consecrating the wealth of the deceased should be performed.

original: de'i ring lugs lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ring lugs lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because that layperson or monastic is like the actual wealth, a reflection of the wealth or a substitute for the wealth.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽'di ltar gnas gzhan na nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de 'dug na /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / 'di ltar gnas gzhan na nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de 'dug na /
translated: This is taught by the following.

original: des gzhan shi ba'i nor byin gyis brlab par bya bdag gnas gzhan du bzhag tu zin kyang nor dang 'dra ba'i gang zag de 'dug pa'i gnas de nyid na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i nor de yang 'dug pa nyid dang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: des gzhan shi ba'i nor byin gyis brlab par bya bdag gnas gzhan du bzhag tu zin kyang nor dang 'dra ba'i gang zag de 'dug pa'i gnas de nyid na byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i nor de yang 'dug pa nyid dang 'dra bar bstan par bya ste /
translated: If a person who is like the wealth is present in another place, then even though the wealth of the deceased is placed in another place, the wealth to be consecrated should be considered to be present in the place where the person who is like the wealth is present.

original: des na gnas gang na nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de 'dug pa'i gnas de nyid du nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de nyid byin gyis brlabs na /
analyzed: des na gnas gang na nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de 'dug pa'i gnas de nyid du nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag de nyid byin gyis brlabs na /
translated: Therefore, if the one who is like wealth is consecrated in the very place where he resides,

original: des gzhan shi pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma yin pa snang ba dang mi snang ba gnas gzhan du gzhag pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des gzhan shi pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma yin pa snang ba dang mi snang ba gnas gzhan du gzhag pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then all the articles of the deceased, both visible and invisible, such as Dharma robes and non-Dharma robes, placed in other places, will be consecrated.

original: de'i phyir de'i nor dang 'dra bas gzhan na 'dug pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i nor dang 'dra bas gzhan na 'dug pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the one who is like wealth should be consecrated even if he is in another place.

original: dge slong rnams kyis nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag drung na 'dug pas gzhan shi ba'i yo byad de la gzhag pa thag ring po na 'dug pa gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis nor dang 'dra pa'i gang zag drung na 'dug pas gzhan shi ba'i yo byad de la gzhag pa thag ring po na 'dug pa gsol ba 'ba' zhig gi las kyis byin gyis brlab par bya ba'o //
translated: The monks, while sitting in the presence of the one who is like wealth, should consecrate the articles of the deceased placed far away by the mere act of supplication.

original: 'di'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for this is:

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol /
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!

original: 'di ltar gnas 'dir dge slong gre skyes gum par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas 'dir dge slong gre skyes gum par gyur na /
translated: In this way, if a monk named so-and-so has died in this place,

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi dus la bab cing bzod na /
translated: If the Saṅgha is ready and agrees,

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang @181a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang @181a * //
translated: the Saṅgha should allow it.

original: bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong kun dga' bo nor dang 'dra bas dge slong gre skyes gum pa'i rdzas bgo bar bgyi ba /
analyzed: bar mdzod cig dang / dge 'dun gyis dge slong kun dga' bo nor dang 'dra bas dge slong gre skyes gum pa'i rdzas bgo bar bgyi ba /
translated: The Saṅgha will distribute the property of the monk named so-and-so, who has died, to the monk named so-and-so, who is like his heir.

original: gum pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma lags pa gda' ba dang mi gda' ba byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: gum pa'i yo byad chos gos dang chos gos ma lags pa gda' ba dang mi gda' ba byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: The Saṅgha will consecrate the property of the deceased monk, both the robes and the non-robes.

original: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽bskur ba bskur par bya ba ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni gsol ba'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // bskur ba bskur par bya ba ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the motion.🔽The one who has not given up the one to whom it is to be given is the very same one.

original: bskur ba'i dngos po gang yang rung ba gang la bskur bar bya ba'i gang zag des ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bskur ba'i dngos po gang yang rung ba gang la bskur bar bya ba'i gang zag des ma spangs pa ni de nyid yin te /
translated: The one to whom it is to be given is the very same one who has not given up the thing to be given.

original: bskur par bya ba'i dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: bskur par bya ba'i dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: He is the very one who is to be given.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽If the one who is giving gives a thing to the one to whom it is to be given,

original: gal te skur bar byed pas bskur bar bya ba la dngos po zhig skur par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te skur bar byed pas bskur bar bya ba la dngos po zhig skur par byed cing /
translated: and

original: bskur bar bya ba des kyang dngos po de spong bar mi byed na /
analyzed: bskur bar bya ba des kyang dngos po de spong bar mi byed na /
translated: If the one who is to be given does not relinquish that thing,

original: dngos po de bskur bar bya ba dbang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po de bskur bar bya ba dbang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: then the one who is to be given should be understood to have control over that thing.

original: de na skabs der skur ba byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro //🔽spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de na skabs der skur ba byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro // spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If in that situation both the one who is to give and the one who is to be given die, then that thing becomes the property of the one who is to give at the time of his death.

original: bskur bar bya ba'i gang zag des spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyud du dbang ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bskur bar bya ba'i gang zag des spangs pa ni skur bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyud du dbang ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If the one who is to be given relinquishes it, then it is the property of the one who is to be given at the time of his death.

original: des na skabs der skur bar byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro //🔽des spangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na skabs der skur bar byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro //🔽des spangs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If in that situation both the one who is to give and the one who is to be given die, then that thing becomes the property of the one who is to be given at the time of his death.🔽If the one who is to be given relinquishes it, then it is the property of the one who is to be given at the time of his death.

original: skur bar byed pa des dngos po de spangs na yang 'on kyang dngos po de skur bar byed pa de nyid dbang par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skur bar byed pa des dngos po de spangs na yang 'on kyang dngos po de skur bar byed pa de nyid dbang par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the one who is sending it has abandoned that thing, still that thing is the property of the one who is sending it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: skur par byed pas bskur bar bya ba la bskur ba'i dngos po de bskur bar bya ba des spangs par gyur pa /
analyzed: skur par byed pas bskur bar bya ba la bskur ba'i dngos po de bskur bar bya ba des spangs par gyur pa /
translated: The thing that is being sent is abandoned by the one who is sending it to the one who is receiving it.

original: skur bar byed pa des thos nas des kyang bdag gis sngar spangs zin pa 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya zhes yang spangs par gyur du zin kyang /
analyzed: skur bar byed pa des thos nas des kyang bdag gis sngar spangs zin pa 'dis bdag la ci zhig bya zhes yang spangs par gyur du zin kyang /
translated: When the one who is sending it hears that, he thinks, “What is the use of that which I have already abandoned?” and he abandons it again.

original: dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid dbang ngo //
analyzed: dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid dbang ngo //
translated: Still, that thing is the property of the one who is sending it.

original: des na skabs der skur bar byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na skabs der skur bar byed pa dang bskur bar bya ba gnyi ga shi bar gyur na dngos po de skur bar byed pa nyid kyi shi ba'i yo byad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in that case, if both the one who is sending it and the one who is receiving it die, that thing becomes the property of the one who is sending it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dge slong la chos gos dag bskur nas /
translated: Here is the text: A monk sends robes to another monk.

original: gang la bskur ba des spangs nas gang gis bskur ba des kyang spangs na /
analyzed: gang la bskur ba des spangs nas gang gis bskur ba des kyang spangs na /
translated: If the one who is to be consecrated abandons it and the one who is to consecrate it also abandons it,

original: gang la bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob pa ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la bskur ba de yir byin gyis rlob pa ni byin gyis ma brlabs pa yin no //
translated: then the consecration of the one who is to be consecrated is not consecrated.

original: gang gis bskur ba de yi phyir byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gis bskur ba de yi phyir byin gyis rlob par byed na ni byin gyis brlabs pa yin te /
translated: If the one who is to consecrate it consecrates it for the sake of the one who is to be consecrated, then it is consecrated.

original: @181b legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: @181b legs par byin gyis brlabs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that it is well consecrated.

original: de shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlabs pa nyid kyis skur bar byed pa de nyid kyir byin gyis brlabs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de shi ba'i yo byad du byin gyis brlabs pa nyid kyis skur bar byed pa de nyid kyir byin gyis brlabs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the one who consecrates it should consecrate it for the one who is to be consecrated, since it is consecrated as an article for the dead.

original: phyi rol du yang mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi rol du yang mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa dag gis 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that only those who have the perception of being within the boundary consecrate it.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'i gang zag rnams kyis 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba mi mthun pa dag gis byin gyis rlob par byed na mi 'chags so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'i gang zag rnams kyis 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba mi mthun pa dag gis byin gyis rlob par byed na mi 'chags so //
translated: If the persons outside the boundary, perceiving the boundary, consecrate the boundary with the non-concordant, it is not confessed.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshams kyi nang du yang mi 'chags te /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtshams kyi nang du yang mi 'chags te /
translated: By the word “also,” it is said that it is not confessed within the boundary.

original: 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis byin gyis rlob pa ni mi mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the consecration by the non-concordant is itself non-concordant.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol lam mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'i gang zag rnams kyis mi mthun pas byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags na /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol lam mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa'i gang zag rnams kyis mi mthun pas byin gyis rlob pa mi 'chags na /
translated: If the persons outside the boundary or within the boundary, perceiving the boundary, consecrate the boundary with the non-concordant, it is not confessed.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'du shes pa dag gis lta mi 'chags pa smos kyang ci dgos te mi 'chags pa mi bya'o zhes spyir bstan pa des 'di la nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du 'du shes pa dag gis lta mi 'chags pa smos kyang ci dgos te mi 'chags pa mi bya'o zhes spyir bstan pa des 'di la nyes byas su shes par bya'o //
translated: If the persons outside the boundary, perceiving the boundary, consecrate the boundary with the non-concordant, it is not confessed. What need is there to mention that it is not confessed? It is not confessed. By that general teaching, it should be understood that this is a fault.

original: yid gnyis za na yang yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes spyir bstan pa des de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis za na yang yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes spyir bstan pa des de la yang nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: By this general teaching, it should be understood that there is an offense of wrong conduct in that case as well.

original: phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi rol du mtshams kyi nang du 'du shes pa 'am /
translated: If, with the perception that it is inside the boundary,

original: yid gnyis za bas rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na /
analyzed: yid gnyis za bas rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na /
translated: or with doubt, one consecrates with a thieving mind,

original: rku sems de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku sems de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: then the offense of wrong conduct is in that thieving mind.

original: mtshams kyi nang du rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du rku sems kyis byin gyis rlob par byed na /
translated: If one consecrates with a thieving mind inside the boundary,

original: brkus pa'i mdun rol du de la yang nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brkus pa'i mdun rol du de la yang nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is also the offense of wrong conduct before the theft.

original: brkus pa nyid na ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: brkus pa nyid na ni dngos po las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: But when it is stolen, it is determined from the object.

original: dbyung ba dang rim gro dang chos mnyan pa dang yon bshad pa ma byas par byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyung ba dang rim gro dang chos mnyan pa dang yon bshad pa ma byas par byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not consecrate without carrying out the duties of taking out, serving, listening to the Dharma, and explaining the gifts.

original: mtshams der shin shi ba'i ro dbyung ba la sogs pa ma byas par shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams der shin shi ba'i ro dbyung ba la sogs pa ma byas par shi ba'i yo byad byin gyis brlab par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not consecrate the belongings of the dead without carrying out the duties of taking out the dead body, etc. in that boundary.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gzhan na 'dug pa nyid ni khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim gzhan na 'dug pa nyid ni khyim bdag gis gang la byin pa de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the alms bowl and robes are in the home, the householder has control over them.

original: gal te shi ba'i lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa khyim pa gzhan na 'dug par gyur na de dag ni khyim bdag des rab tu byung ba gang la byin pa'i rab tu byung ba de dbang ba nyid yin no //🔽gal te dbang zhing des phongs pa yan no zhes bya ba ni /🔽khyim bdag des rab tu byung ba gang la byin pa'i rab tu byung @182a * //
analyzed: gal te shi ba'i lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa khyim pa gzhan na 'dug par gyur na de dag ni khyim bdag des rab tu byung ba gang la byin pa'i rab tu byung ba de dbang ba nyid yin no // gal te dbang zhing des phongs pa yan no zhes bya ba ni / khyim bdag des rab tu byung ba gang la byin pa'i rab tu byung @182a * //
translated: If the dead person’s alms bowl, robes, and so on are in the home of another layperson, then the renunciate to whom that householder gave them has control over them.🔽If the renunciate to whom the householder gave them has control over them and is in need of those things.

original: ba de yang gal te mtshan mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams pa lngar smos pa dag gis dbang ba nyid yin zhing lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po des kyang phongs pa yin na des de'i tshe blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba de yang gal te mtshan mthun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams pa lngar smos pa dag gis dbang ba nyid yin zhing lhung bzed la sogs pa'i dngos po des kyang phongs pa yin na des de'i tshe blang bar bya'o //
translated: If the renunciate to whom the householder gave them has control over them and is in need of those things, then he should take them at that time.🔽If the renunciate to whom the householder gave them has control over them and is in need of those things, then he should take them at that time.

original: gal te khyim bdag sbyin pa'i phyir 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag sbyin pa'i phyir 'jug par mi byed na de'i tshe su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If the householder does not give, then who owns it?

original: sbyin par mi byed na bslangs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sbyin par mi byed na bslangs pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: If he does not give, then it belongs to the one who asks.

original: 'dir yang dbang zhing des phongs par zhes bya bar sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang dbang zhing des phongs par zhes bya bar sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here also, it should be understood that the one who owns it is the one who is in need of it.

original: khyim bdag gi rang dgar sbyin par mi byed na de'i tshe de dbang zhing des phongs pa'i rab tu byung ba gang gis khyim bdag de la bslangs pa dang ldan pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi rang dgar sbyin par mi byed na de'i tshe de dbang zhing des phongs pa'i rab tu byung ba gang gis khyim bdag de la bslangs pa dang ldan pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the householder does not give at his own discretion, then it belongs to the renunciate who asks the householder, since he is in need of it.

original: cig car bslangs na ni spyir dbang ngo //
analyzed: cig car bslangs na ni spyir dbang ngo //
translated: If he asks all at once, then it belongs to all in general.

original: mthar gyis na dang po'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis na dang po'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he asks gradually, then it belongs to the first.

original: mthar gyis slong na dang por gang gis bslangs na der dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: mthar gyis slong na dang por gang gis bslangs na der dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: If he asks gradually, then it belongs to the first one who asked.

original: gal te len pa med dam len pa yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te len pa med dam len pa yod kyang rung ste /
translated: If there is no one to take it, or if there is someone to take it,

original: khyim bdag gis gang zag gang la yang bye brag tu ma byas par su khyer ba khyer cig snyam du bor bar gyur na de la su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis gang zag gang la yang bye brag tu ma byas par su khyer ba khyer cig snyam du bor bar gyur na de la su dbang ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: The householder does not specify to which person the gift should go, but thinks, “Whoever takes it may have it.” To whom does it belong?

original: de'i phyir med pa nyid yin zhing ma bsngos par por na song ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa nyid yin zhing ma bsngos par por na song ba dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If it is abandoned without dedication, it belongs to whoever takes it.”

original: len pa med cing gang zag la bye brag tu ma bsngos par por na de'i tshe dang por der song ba ni song ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: len pa med cing gang zag la bye brag tu ma bsngos par por na de'i tshe dang por der song ba ni song ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is abandoned without dedication to a specific person, then it belongs to whoever takes it first.

original: de dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: That person has ownership of it.

original: de'i phyir de ni mthar gyis dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mthar gyis dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is like the case of gradual giving.”

original: ji ltar mthar gyis slong ba la dang por gang gis bslangs pa dbang ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mthar gyis slong ba la dang por gang gis bslangs pa dbang ba dang 'dra bar 'dir yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the case of gradual giving, the first person who asks receives it, so too here.

original: bu lon pa byung ba na de la gzhal bar bya ba'i tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bu lon pa byung ba na de la gzhal bar bya ba'i tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad de dbang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When a debt is incurred, the debtor has ownership of the goods that are the measure of the debt.

original: gal te shi ba'i 'og tu bu lon pa byung na de'i tshe bu lon pa de la shi ba das gzhal bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad bu lon pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te shi ba'i 'og tu bu lon pa byung na de'i tshe bu lon pa de la shi ba das gzhal bar bya ba'i rdzas kyi tshad kyi shi ba'i yo byad bu lon pa de dbang ba nyid yin no //
translated: If a debt arises after death, then the deceased’s estate is subject to the creditor’s claim.🔽If it arises before the division of the estate, then it is subject to the claim of the estate. But if it arises after the division of the estate, then it is not subject to the claim of the estate.

original: ma bgos par byung na de la gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi bgos pa'i 'og tu byung na ni de la mi gzhal bar bya ba nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma bgos par byung na de la gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi bgos pa'i 'og tu byung na ni de la mi gzhal bar bya ba nyid do snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To eliminate this doubt, he says, “Even if the estate has been divided.”

original: gzhal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is subject to the claim of the estate.

original: de dang lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa de la sbyin par bya ba nyid dam blang bar bya ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa de la sbyin par bya ba nyid dam blang bar bya ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is to be given or taken from that estate which is established together with that debt.

original: de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That is not the case.

original: shi ba de dang bu lon ded pa dang bu lon 'jal bar lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa @182b zhes bya ba mngon sum du 'thams pa dge slong gis bu lon ded pa la phar gzhal bar bya ba'i rin dang / bu lon 'jal ba las dge slong gis tshur blang bar bya ba'i spu gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhal ba dang blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: shi ba de dang bu lon ded pa dang bu lon 'jal bar lhan cig rnam par gzhag pa @182b zhes bya ba mngon sum du 'thams pa dge slong gis bu lon ded pa la phar gzhal bar bya ba'i rin dang / bu lon 'jal ba las dge slong gis tshur blang bar bya ba'i spu gyur pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhal ba dang blang bar bya'i /
translated: The debtor is the monk who is to pay the price of the goods and the creditor is the monk who is to receive the price.

original: shi ba des bu lon dad pa las rdzas gang blangs pa dang bu lon 'jal ba la gang gtad pa de nyid dngos su gzhal zhing blang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: shi ba des bu lon dad pa las rdzas gang blangs pa dang bu lon 'jal ba la gang gtad pa de nyid dngos su gzhal zhing blang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: The goods that the debtor took out and the goods that the creditor entrusted are not to be paid or received in actuality.

original: dper na shi bas tshong ba las ras yug chen blangs te rin sbyin par bya'o zhes 'thams pa la ni rin sbyin par bya'i /
analyzed: dper na shi bas tshong ba las ras yug chen blangs te rin sbyin par bya'o zhes 'thams pa la ni rin sbyin par bya'i /
translated: For example, if a debtor dies after agreeing to pay the price for a bolt of cloth that he took from a merchant, the price should be paid to the merchant.🔽But the bolt of cloth should not be given to him in actuality.

original: ras yug chen dngos sbyin par mi bya ba dang / thag pa la ras yug chen gyi don du rgyu spun gtad pa las ni ras yug chen blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: ras yug chen dngos sbyin par mi bya ba dang / thag pa la ras yug chen gyi don du rgyu spun gtad pa las ni ras yug chen blang bar bya'i /
translated: If a creditor dies after entrusting yarn to a weaver for the purpose of having it woven into cloth, the cloth should be taken from the weaver.

original: rgyu spun blang bar mi bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu spun blang bar mi bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is not proper to take the robes of a dead monk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis phra ba bkug pa dang / de na re 'phags pa dag bdag gis de la sbom por dbul bar bgyi ba lags so zhes zer nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis phra ba bkug pa dang / de na re 'phags pa dag bdag gis de la sbom por dbul bar bgyi ba lags so zhes zer nas /
translated: Here, the text says that monks should summon a debtor, and that debtor says, “Noble ones, I will pay you back with a large amount.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: de la dge slong shi bas ci 'dra ba gtad pas dgug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dge slong shi bas ci 'dra ba gtad pas dgug par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “In that case, monks, summon him with the same appearance as when he died.”🔽It is said that in this way,

original: des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “he does not become indebted to his fellow brahmacārin.”

original: shi ba la bu lon chags pa des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shi ba la bu lon chags pa des tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la bu lon chags pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: By becoming indebted to the dead, he does not become indebted to his fellow brahmacārin.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyis shi bde'i bu lon gzhal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos kyis shi bde'i bu lon gzhal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po lnga bcu gsum pa /
translated: The meaning is that his fellow brahmacārin should not repay his debt with their own alms bowl and robes.

original: lag gi blas dkon mchog gi blangs pa nyid yin na de'i ji snyed pa de snyed mnyam par bsab po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag gi blas dkon mchog gi blangs pa nyid yin na de'i ji snyed pa de snyed mnyam par bsab po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the monk has stolen property belonging to the Three Jewels, he should repay the full amount.

original: gang zag lag gi blas dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor blangs shing khyer ba nyid yin na /🔽dkon mchog de'i dkor ji snyed blangs pa de snyed lag gi bla de'i shi ba'i yo byad las cha mnyam par byas te /
analyzed: gang zag lag gi blas dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor blangs shing khyer ba nyid yin na / dkon mchog de'i dkor ji snyed blangs pa de snyed lag gi bla de'i shi ba'i yo byad las cha mnyam par byas te /
translated: If the monk has stolen property belonging to the Three Jewels,🔽he should repay the full amount of the property he has stolen.

original: dkon mchog la dbul zhing dkor bsab par bya'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog la dbul zhing dkor bsab par bya'o //
translated: He should offer it to the Three Jewels and repay the stolen property.

original: 'di ltar gtsug lag las /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtsug lag las /
translated: The scriptures state:

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi ni mchod rten gyir byed /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi ni mchod rten gyir byed /
translated: If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to a stupa,🔽the stupa should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property, it should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Sangha.

original: mchod rten gyi ni dge 'dun gyir byed cing de bzhin du chos kyi yang 'dres par byed na /🔽de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos las cha gsum du byas te /
analyzed: mchod rten gyi ni dge 'dun gyir byed cing de bzhin du chos kyi yang 'dres par byed na / de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos las cha gsum du byas te /
translated: If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the Sangha, it should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Sangha, it should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.🔽If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.🔽If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the Sangha, it should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Sangha, it should take it from the Sangha.🔽If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the stupa has stolen property belonging to the Dharma, it should take it from the Dharma.🔽If the Dharma has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.

original: ji snyed blangs pa de snyed der dbul zhing lhag ma dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
analyzed: ji snyed blangs pa de snyed der dbul zhing lhag ma dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes gsungs mod kyi /
translated: If the Sangha has stolen property belonging to the stupa, it should take it from the stupa.

original: de ni tha mal pa'i shes pas gzung bar dka' la /
analyzed: de ni tha mal pa'i shes pas gzung bar dka' la /
translated: If the Dharma has stolen property belonging

original: 'di la lhag par phul ba yang nyes @183a * //
analyzed: 'di la lhag par phul ba yang nyes @183a * //
translated: It is also a fault to offer it to them in excess.

original: pa med pas /
analyzed: pa med pas /
translated: There is no fault in offering it to the Sangha.

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'ged la rag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'ged la rag go //
translated: Therefore, it should be distributed to all.

original: lag gi bla zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de 'di ltar gzhan dag gis brkus na de dag la yang de bzhin byar rung ngo //🔽lag gi bla zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag gi bla zhes smos pa ni dpe tsam du zad de 'di ltar gzhan dag gis brkus na de dag la yang de bzhin byar rung ngo // lag gi bla zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the hand of a friend” is merely an example, because it is suitable to do the same with others who steal.

original: las sar pa la sbyor du 'jug pas lag gi bla zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las sar pa la sbyor du 'jug pas lag gi bla zhes bya'o //
translated: The hand of a friend is called the hand of a friend because it is applied to new work.

original: nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na yo byad drug de dbang ba nyid yin pas byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na yo byad drug de dbang ba nyid yin pas byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the deceased had attendants, the six articles belong to them, so they should not be consecrated.

original: gal te shi ba de nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te shi ba de nad g-yog dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the deceased had attendants,

original: shi ba de'i yo byad drung ni nad g-yog de dbang ba nyid yin pas /
analyzed: shi ba de'i yo byad drung ni nad g-yog de dbang ba nyid yin pas /
translated: the six articles of the deceased belong to the attendants.

original: dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis mi brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis byin gyis mi brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The monks should not consecrate them.

original: yo byad drug ni chos gos gsum dang stan dang lhung bzed dang chu tshags so //
analyzed: yo byad drug ni chos gos gsum dang stan dang lhung bzed dang chu tshags so //
translated: The six articles are the three Dharma robes, a mat, a begging bowl, and a water strainer.

original: de ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dang bcas pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma dang bcas pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is from the best, middling, and least.

original: de dbang ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽nad g-yog de la yo byad drug po dag las kha cig ni dge sbyong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i yo byad rab las sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de dbang ba nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar te / nad g-yog de la yo byad drug po dag las kha cig ni dge sbyong gi yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i yo byad rab las sbyin par bya'o //
translated: It is from the best, middling, and least.

original: kha cig ni 'bring /🔽kha cig ni tha ma dang ldan pa las sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bring / kha cig ni tha ma dang ldan pa las sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The attendant should give from the six articles to the sick person, some of the best, some of the middling, and some of the least.

original: du ma nyid yin na de thun mong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin na de thun mong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there are many attendants, the six articles are shared.

original: nad g-yog gnyis sam gsum mam mang po nyid yin na yo byad drug po de de dag ni thun mong yin no //🔽de'i don du song ba nyid yin la nad pa shin sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽nad g-yog nad pa de'i don du gzhan du song ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: nad g-yog gnyis sam gsum mam mang po nyid yin na yo byad drug po de de dag ni thun mong yin no // de'i don du song ba nyid yin la nad pa shin sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni / nad g-yog nad pa de'i don du gzhan du song ba nyid yin la /
translated: If there are two, three, or many attendants, the six articles are shared.

original: phyi nas nad pa shi bar gyur na yang yo byad drug po sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyi nas nad pa shi bar gyur na yang yo byad drug po sbyin par bya ba nyid yin no //
