translated: If the sick person dies, the six articles are given to the attendant.🔽If the sick person dies, the six articles are given to the attendant who went for the sake of the sick person.🔽If the sick person dies, the six articles are given to the attendant who went for the sake of the sick person.

original: gal te nad pa'i phyir nad g-yog gzhan du song par gyur na de lta na yang yo byad drug po sbyin par bya ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te nad pa'i phyir nad g-yog gzhan du song par gyur na de lta na yang yo byad drug po sbyin par bya ba nyid yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the nurse of the sick person goes elsewhere, then also the six articles should be given to him, not to anyone else.

original: rdzas de mi dbang ba la ni de mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas de mi dbang ba la ni de mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not give those articles to one who is not the master of the substance.

original: shi ba'i rdzas de mi dbang ba khyim pa la sogs pa'i g-yog la ni yo byad drug po de mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: shi ba'i rdzas de mi dbang ba khyim pa la sogs pa'i g-yog la ni yo byad drug po de mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: One should not give the six articles to the attendant of a layman, etc., who is not the master of the dead person’s substance.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bro g-yog khyim pa lags na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa bro g-yog khyim pa lags na /
translated: Here is the text: “If the nurse of the sick person is a layman,

original: de la bro g-yog gi chos gos stsal bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: de la bro g-yog gi chos gos stsal bar bgyi 'am /
translated: should the nurse be given the sick person’s Dharma robes?

original: bka' stsal ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba mi bya'o //
translated: ” The Buddha said, “No.

original: de bzhin du nad g-yog dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la yang mi sbyin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad g-yog dge slong ma dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la yang mi sbyin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, one should not give to a nun, a female novice, or a female novice trainee who is the nurse of the sick person.” This is stated in detail.

original: gang na mtshan mi mthun pa dag 'ba' zhig yod la mtshan mthun pa dag med pa der ni mtshan mi mthun pa dag la yang sbyin par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang na mtshan mi mthun pa dag 'ba' zhig yod la mtshan mthun pa dag med pa der ni mtshan mi mthun pa dag la yang sbyin par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: If only those of different gender are present and none of the same gender, then it is proper to give to those of different gender.

original: de dag de dbang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de dbang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have control over it.

original: gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la mi sbyin par mi @183b bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la mi sbyin par mi @183b bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not refuse to give to those who have accepted a different residence.

original: nad g-yog gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la yo byad drug po dag mi sbyin par mi bya zhing sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: nad g-yog gnas gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa la yo byad drug po dag mi sbyin par mi bya zhing sbyin par bya ste /
translated: One should not refuse to give the six articles to those who have accepted a different residence as their caretaking.

original: 'di ltar gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa ni mi sbyin pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan du gnas par khas blangs pa ni mi sbyin pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because accepting a different residence is not a reason for not giving.

original: 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni thams cad dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni thams cad dbang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this context, those not fully ordained have control over all.

original: shi ba'i yo byad bgo ba 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs ba ni so so'i skal ba'i cha thams cad bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mnyam par dbang ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad bgo ba 'di la bsnyen par ma rdzogs ba ni so so'i skal ba'i cha thams cad bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang mnyam par dbang ste /
translated: In this context of distributing the property of the dead, those not fully ordained have control over all their individual shares, equal to those fully ordained.

original: dbyar gyi rnyed pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la sum cha dbri ba lta bu ma yin no //🔽nad pas smras pa sbyin pa phri yang ji skad smras pa bzhin du bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar gyi rnyed pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la sum cha dbri ba lta bu ma yin no // nad pas smras pa sbyin pa phri yang ji skad smras pa bzhin du bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not like the case of a sick person who, when he recovers, must repay the third of his property that he previously promised to his nurse.🔽Even if the sick person’s property is reduced, he must do exactly as he said.

original: nad pas nad g-yog gam gzhan gang la smras pa'i gang zag des sbyin pa phri yang nad pas ji skad smras pa kho na bzhin bya dgos so //
analyzed: nad pas nad g-yog gam gzhan gang la smras pa'i gang zag des sbyin pa phri yang nad pas ji skad smras pa kho na bzhin bya dgos so //
translated: If a sick person tells his nurse or another person to give something to someone else, then even if the nurse or the other person reduces the amount, the sick person must do exactly as he said.

original: ji skad bstan te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan te /
translated: What does this mean?

original: gal te nad pa gang zag 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig byin cig ces nad g-yog gam gzhan la gtad pa las nad g-yog gam gzhan des phrir zin kyang de ltar mi bya bar sngar nad pas bsgo ba kho na bzhin du bya dgos te shi pas
analyzed: gal te nad pa gang zag 'ga' zhig la dngos po 'ga' zhig byin cig ces nad g-yog gam gzhan la gtad pa las nad g-yog gam gzhan des phrir zin kyang de ltar mi bya bar sngar nad pas bsgo ba kho na bzhin du bya dgos te shi pas
translated: If a sick person tells his nurse or another person to give something to someone else, then even if the nurse or the other person reduces the amount, the sick person must do exactly as he said.

original: sngar ltos pa med par byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ltos pa med par byin zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has already given it away without regard for his own needs.

original: shi ba nyid kyi dus na rdzas nyid sgrub pa la ni nor bdag mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shi ba nyid kyi dus na rdzas nyid sgrub pa la ni nor bdag mi dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the time of death, the owner of the property has no power to establish ownership.

original: nad pas bdag shi bar gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod rdzas 'di nyid gang zag che ge mo zhig la sbyin par grub pa la ni shi ba de nor bdag tu mi 'gyur bas nor de de la mi sbyin par /
analyzed: nad pas bdag shi bar gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod rdzas 'di nyid gang zag che ge mo zhig la sbyin par grub pa la ni shi ba de nor bdag tu mi 'gyur bas nor de de la mi sbyin par /
translated: If a patient says, “After I die, then give this property to a certain person,” then since the dead person is not the owner of the property, that property should not be given to him.

original: dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The Saṅgha should consecrate it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gal te bdag shi bar gyur na de'i tshe che ge mo zhig la bdag gi rdzas 'di sbyin par bya zhes zer ba'i rab tu byung ba ni nor de'i bdag por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bdag shi bar gyur na de'i tshe che ge mo zhig la bdag gi rdzas 'di sbyin par bya zhes zer ba'i rab tu byung ba ni nor de'i bdag por mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a renunciate says, “When I die, then give this property of mine to a certain person,” then that renunciate is not the owner of that property.

original: shi ba'i nor de rab tu byung ba gzhan dbang bas de dag gis de byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: shi ba'i nor de rab tu byung ba gzhan dbang bas de dag gis de byin gyis brlab par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the property of the dead person belongs to the other renunciates, it should be consecrated by them.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A layperson is the owner.

original: khyim ba ni gal te bdag shi bar gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod rdzas 'di nyid gang zag che ge mo zhig la sbyin par bsgrub na /
analyzed: khyim ba ni gal te bdag shi bar gyur na de'i 'og tu gzod rdzas 'di nyid gang zag che ge mo zhig la sbyin par bsgrub na /
translated: If a layperson says, “After I die, then give this property to a certain person,”

original: de shi ba'i tshe yang nor de'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de shi ba'i tshe yang nor de'i bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: When he dies, the wealth belongs to the owner.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshogs dag las khyim pa dag ni ltos pa dang bcas pas dus byed pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshogs dag las khyim pa dag ni ltos pa dang bcas pas dus byed pa /
translated: Here the treatise mentions that householders die with attachment

original: rab tu byung ba dag ni ltos pa med pas dus byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag ni ltos pa med pas dus byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: and renunciates die without attachment.

original: de lta bas na khyim pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dbang la /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyim pa ni ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dbang la /
translated: Therefore, householders have control because they have attachment.

original: rab tu byung ba ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir mi dbang ngo //
translated: Renunciates do not have control because they are without attachment.

original: khyim pas bu dang chung ma @184a * //
analyzed: khyim pas bu dang chung ma @184a * //
translated: If a householder dies after offering his son and wife

original: phul nas shi na ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phul nas shi na ci bder bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: to the Saṅgha, they should do whatever is comfortable.

original: khyim pas dge 'dun la bu dang chung ma phul nas khyim ba nyid shi na de'i bu dang chung ma dag ci bder bya ste /
analyzed: khyim pas dge 'dun la bu dang chung ma phul nas khyim ba nyid shi na de'i bu dang chung ma dag ci bder bya ste /
translated: If a householder dies after offering his son and wife to the Saṅgha, they should do whatever is comfortable for the son and wife.

original: bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they should not be made to belong to the Saṅgha.

original: glang po che dang rta dang por bu dang dre'u dang go cha rnams ni rgyal po la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glang po che dang rta dang por bu dang dre'u dang go cha rnams ni rgyal po la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Elephants, horses, carriages, sons, mules, and armor should be offered to the king.

original: glang po che la sogs pa ni rgyal po la dbul lo //🔽dbyig dang gser dang gzhan byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams na gsum la'o zhes bya ba ni dbul lo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa ni rgyal po la dbul lo // dbyig dang gser dang gzhan byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams na gsum la'o zhes bya ba ni dbul lo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Elephants and so on are offered to the king.🔽Wealth, gold, and other things, both made and unmade, are offered to the three.

original: dbyig dang gser dang de dag las gzhan pa zangs kyi rang bzhin la sogs pa brdungs su byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams ni dkon mchog gsum la dbul lo //
analyzed: dbyig dang gser dang de dag las gzhan pa zangs kyi rang bzhin la sogs pa brdungs su byas pa dang ma byas pa rnams ni dkon mchog gsum la dbul lo //
translated: Wealth, gold, and other things made of copper and so on, both made and unmade, are offered to the three jewels.

original: rin po che rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rin po che rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also the jewels.

original: nor bu dang bee d'ur+ya dang dung g-yas su 'khyil ba la sogs pa dag kyang dkon mchog gsum la dbul lo //
analyzed: nor bu dang bee d'ur+ya dang dung g-yas su 'khyil ba la sogs pa dag kyang dkon mchog gsum la dbul lo //
translated: Pearls, lapis lazuli, right-coiling conches, and so on are offered to the three jewels.

original: mu tig rnams ni gal te gzhan yod na de'i skal bas sam lhag pa nyid yin na yang rung gal te med kyang de bzhin du sangs rgyas la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mu tig rnams ni gal te gzhan yod na de'i skal bas sam lhag pa nyid yin na yang rung gal te med kyang de bzhin du sangs rgyas la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If pearls are available, they are offered to the Buddha, even if they are not the best or the most, or if there are none at all.

original: mu tig rnams ni gal te mu tig las gzhan pa beed'ur+ya la sogs pa'i rin po che yod na dkon mchog gsum po dag las sangs rgyas de'i skal bas mu tig rnams brjes te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mu tig rnams ni gal te mu tig las gzhan pa beed'ur+ya la sogs pa'i rin po che yod na dkon mchog gsum po dag las sangs rgyas de'i skal bas mu tig rnams brjes te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If there are other jewels such as beryl, etc., besides pearls, then the pearls are to be exchanged for the share of the Buddha from among the Three Jewels, and offered to the Lord Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas nyag gcig gi sku skal gyi rin po che gzhan dag pas mu tig rin che ba'i phyir mu tig lhag pa nyid yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig gi sku skal gyi rin po che gzhan dag pas mu tig rin che ba'i phyir mu tig lhag pa nyid yin yang rung ste /
translated: Even though the pearls are superior, because they are more valuable than the other jewels which are the share of the Buddha alone,

original: de lta na yang mu tig de dag thams cad sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
analyzed: de lta na yang mu tig de dag thams cad sangs rgyas la dbul lo //
translated: still, all those pearls are to be offered to the Buddha.

original: gal te mu tig las gzhan pa'i rin po che med na ni de bzhin du skyin pa med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: gal te mu tig las gzhan pa'i rin po che med na ni de bzhin du skyin pa med kyang bla ste /
translated: If there are no jewels other than pearls, then it is all right if there is no exchange.

original: dkon mchog gsum char gyi sku skal gyi mu tig thams cad sangs rgyas nyag gcig la dbul lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum char gyi sku skal gyi mu tig thams cad sangs rgyas nyag gcig la dbul lo //
translated: All the pearls which are the share of the Three Jewels are to be offered to the Buddha alone.

original: tshon rtsi chen po rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshon rtsi chen po rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And the great colors.

original: gang kus dang mtshal dang mthing shun la sogs pa yang sangs rgyas la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: gang kus dang mtshal dang mthing shun la sogs pa yang sangs rgyas la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word also is used because they are to be offered to the Buddha, and because they are to be offered to the Buddha's stūpa.

original: de dag ni btags te dri gtsang khang gi zhal zhal du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni btags te dri gtsang khang gi zhal zhal du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are to be used for the decoration of the temple.

original: sangs rgyas la phul ba'i mu tig de dag ni btags te dri gtsang khang gi zhal zhal du bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phul ba'i mu tig de dag ni btags te dri gtsang khang gi zhal zhal du bya'o //
translated: The pearls that are to be offered to the Buddha are to be used for the decoration of the temple.

original: de ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi ni sku gzugs dang dri gtsang khang dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi ni sku gzugs dang dri gtsang khang dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The other jewels are to be used for the Buddha's image, temple, and stūpa.

original: mu tig ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi sku skal gyi rin po che gzhan ni sku gzugs la sogs pa'i yo byad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mu tig ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi sku skal gyi rin po che gzhan ni sku gzugs la sogs pa'i yo byad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The other jewels that are the Buddha's share are to be used for the Buddha's image and so on.

original: chos @184b kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bri ba dang seng ge'i khri dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos @184b kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bri ba dang seng ge'i khri dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Dharma's share is to be used for writing the Buddha's word and for lion thrones.🔽 The other jewels that are the Dharma's share are to be used for writing the Buddha's word and for lion thrones.

original: yo byad du sbyar ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yo byad du sbyar ro zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The Sangha's share is to be used for the Sangha's needs.

original: chos kyi sku skal gyi rin po che dag ni ngar ma bri ba dang seng ge'i khri'i yo byad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku skal gyi rin po che dag ni ngar ma bri ba dang seng ge'i khri'i yo byad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The precious Dharma body is to be applied to the non-depletion and the equipment of the lion throne.

original: theg pa ni sku gzugs la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: theg pa ni sku gzugs la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The vehicle is for the image.

original: khyogs dang shing rta'i theg pa bzhon pa dag ni sku gzugs la dbul ba'o //🔽rgyal mtshan dang de'i srog shing dag ni rgyal mtshan gyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyogs dang shing rta'i theg pa bzhon pa dag ni sku gzugs la dbul ba'o // rgyal mtshan dang de'i srog shing dag ni rgyal mtshan gyi don du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The palanquin, chariot, and vehicle are to be offered to the image.🔽The banner and its pole are for the banner.

original: rgyal mtshan dang rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing dag ni rgyal mtshan nyid kyi don du dbul lo //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing dag ni rgyal mtshan nyid kyi don du dbul lo //
translated: The banner and the banner pole are to be offered for the purpose of the banner itself.

original: der rung ba'i srog shing rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der rung ba'i srog shing rnams kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also the poles suitable for that.

original: rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du rung ba'i srog shing gzhan dag kyang sku gzugs la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du rung ba'i srog shing gzhan dag kyang sku gzugs la dbul lo zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyag pa'i phyir /
translated: Also the other poles suitable for the banner pole are to be offered to the image.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word “also” is used to imply that.

original: gzhan dag dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The other weapons are for the Saṅgha.

original: dbul lo zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du rung ba las gzhan pa rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du mi rung ba'i srog shing thung du dag dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la dbul lo //
analyzed: dbul lo zhes bya bar sbyar te / rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du rung ba las gzhan pa rgyal mtshan gyi srog shing du mi rung ba'i srog shing thung du dag dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la dbul lo //
translated: The term “poor” is applied to the following.🔽The short flagpoles that are not suitable to be flagpole supports and the weapons are offered to the saṅgha.

original: de dag ni 'khar sil gyi yu ba dang khab dang gri 'ur byas te brim mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni 'khar sil gyi yu ba dang khab dang gri 'ur byas te brim mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The handles of the musical instruments and the needles and knives are distributed to the saṅgha.

original: gzhan dag dang mtshon cha de dag las srog shing gzhan de dag ni 'khar sil gyi yu bar bya /
analyzed: gzhan dag dang mtshon cha de dag las srog shing gzhan de dag ni 'khar sil gyi yu bar bya /
translated: The handles of the musical instruments are made from the flagpoles other than the flagpole supports.

original: mtshon cha rnams ni khab dang gri'ur byas te dge 'dun la brim mo //
analyzed: mtshon cha rnams ni khab dang gri'ur byas te dge 'dun la brim mo //
translated: The weapons are made into needles and knives and distributed to the saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyi gzhan ni gzhag pa dang 'go ba dang bza' ba dag tu ci rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gzhan ni gzhag pa dang 'go ba dang bza' ba dag tu ci rigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rest of the saṅgha’s property should be used as appropriate for sitting mats, robes, and food.

original: dge 'dun gyi srog shing dang mtshon cha la sogs pa ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag las gzhan pa zhing dang ras dang 'bras la sogs pa dag ni gzhag par 'os pa dag kyang gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi srog shing dang mtshon cha la sogs pa ji skad smos pa'i rnam pa de dag las gzhan pa zhing dang ras dang 'bras la sogs pa dag ni gzhag par 'os pa dag kyang gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The Sangha should keep the fields, cloth, rice, etc. which are suitable to be kept, other than those mentioned above.

original: bgo bar 'os pa dag kyang bgo par bya'o //
analyzed: bgo bar 'os pa dag kyang bgo par bya'o //
translated: The Sangha should distribute the things suitable to be distributed.

original: bza' bar 'os pa dag kyang bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: bza' bar 'os pa dag kyang bza' bar bya ste /
translated: The Sangha should eat the things suitable to be eaten.

original: de ltar ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be done, as appropriate.

original: zhing dang khang khyim dang tshong khang dang gnas mal dang mgar spyad dang gser mgar gyi lag cha dang 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha dang / rdza mkhan gyi lag cha dang / shing mkhan gyi lag cha dang / bsil yab mkhan gyi lag cha dang bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba dang pa lang dang ma he dang ra dang lug dang sman dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan bcos kyi glegs bam dang myur du mi 'grub pa'i dam rgya dag ni
analyzed: zhing dang khang khyim dang tshong khang dang gnas mal dang mgar spyad dang gser mgar gyi lag cha dang 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha dang / rdza mkhan gyi lag cha dang / shing mkhan gyi lag cha dang / bsil yab mkhan gyi lag cha dang bran dang bran mo dang las byed pa dang zho shas 'tsho ba dang pa lang dang ma he dang ra dang lug dang sman dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan bcos kyi glegs bam dang myur du mi 'grub pa'i dam rgya dag ni
translated: Fields, houses, shops, beds, tools, goldsmith’s tools, barbers’ tools, potters’ tools, carpenters’ tools, tools for making fans, male and female servants, laborers, workers, cattle, buffalo, goats, sheep, medicine, books of the Buddha’s teachings, and seals that are not quickly accomplished

original: dang por 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge 'dun gyi zhing la sogs pa 'di dag ni dang @185a * //
analyzed: dang por 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni / dge 'dun gyi zhing la sogs pa 'di dag ni dang @185a * //
translated: are suitable from the beginning.

original: por 'os pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: por 'os pa nyid yin te /
translated: These fields of the Saṅgha and so on are suitable from the beginning.

original: gzhag par 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhag par 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are suitable to be set aside.

original: ras dang ras yug chen dang be'u ras dang mchil lham dang lham sgro gu can dang 'bru mar dang 'bru mar snod dang bya ma bum dang ril ba spyi blugs dang glegs bam gzhan dang dam rgya gzhan dang tshon rtsi gzhan dag ni gnyis par 'os pa nyid
analyzed: ras dang ras yug chen dang be'u ras dang mchil lham dang lham sgro gu can dang 'bru mar dang 'bru mar snod dang bya ma bum dang ril ba spyi blugs dang glegs bam gzhan dang dam rgya gzhan dang tshon rtsi gzhan dag ni gnyis par 'os pa nyid
translated: Cotton cloth, woolen cloth, goat hair cloth, shoes, sandals, oil, oil containers, water pots, water filters, books, seals and other dyes are suitable for two.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: dge 'dun gyi ras la sogs pa 'di dag ni gnyis par 'os pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ras la sogs pa 'di dag ni gnyis par 'os pa nyid yin te /
translated: these cotton cloth and so on of the Saṅgha are suitable for two.

original: bgo bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bgo bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are suitable to be worn.🔽Grains, sesame, barley, beans, peas and other grains, food and drink are suitable for three.

original: 'bras dang til dang nas dang mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang 'bru gzhan dang bza' ba dang btung ba dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi 'bras la sogs pa 'di dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin
analyzed: 'bras dang til dang nas dang mon sran sde'u dang mon sran gre'u dang 'bru gzhan dang bza' ba dang btung ba dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi 'bras la sogs pa 'di dag ni gsum par 'os pa nyid yin
translated: This is because these grains and so on of the Saṅgha are suitable for three.

original: te / bza' bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: te / bza' bar 'os pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are suitable to be eaten.

original: gzhir gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi'o zhes bya ba la 'dul ba'i gzhir gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzhir gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi'o zhes bya ba la 'dul ba'i gzhir gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi bshad zin to /
translated: The basis of the robe that belongs to the basis of the Vinaya has been explained.

original: // / da ni phran tshogs la sogs par gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi bsdu ba'i phyir glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed dag mnyam par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // / da ni phran tshogs la sogs par gtogs pa'i gos kyi gzhi bsdu ba'i phyir glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed dag mnyam par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Now, in order to include the basis of the robe that belongs to the minor topics and so forth, it is said: “The panels and half-panels should be made equal.”

original: glegs bu rnams kyang logs shig tu mnyam par bya /
analyzed: glegs bu rnams kyang logs shig tu mnyam par bya /
translated: The panels should be made equal separately.

original: glegs bu phyed rnams kyang logs shig tu mnyam par bya'o //🔽glegs bu yang glegs bu rnams dang lhan cig tshad mnyam par bya /
analyzed: glegs bu phyed rnams kyang logs shig tu mnyam par bya'o // glegs bu yang glegs bu rnams dang lhan cig tshad mnyam par bya /
translated: The half-panels should also be made equal separately.🔽The panels should be made equal in size with the panels.

original: glegs bu phyed rnams kyang glegs bu phyed rnams dang lhan cig tshad mnyam par bya ste /
analyzed: glegs bu phyed rnams kyang glegs bu phyed rnams dang lhan cig tshad mnyam par bya ste /
translated: The half-panels should also be made equal in size with the half-panels.

original: mnyam pa 'di ni mdzes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa 'di ni mdzes pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This equality is for the sake of beauty.

original: gzhal ba'i phyir de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhal ba'i phyir de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of measuring, a measuring stick of that size should be kept.

original: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed gzhal ba'i phyir de gnyis kyi tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed gzhal ba'i phyir de gnyis kyi tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The measure of the two is the cubit, which is to be carried.

original: gal te chag shing gcig gis gnyi ga'i dgos pa 'grub na ni gnyis mi dgos so //
analyzed: gal te chag shing gcig gis gnyi ga'i dgos pa 'grub na ni gnyis mi dgos so //
translated: If one cubit serves the purpose of both, then two are not necessary.

original: de ltar yang gzhan las chag shing gcig kho na bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhan las chag shing gcig kho na bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in another text, it is said that only one cubit is to be carried.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: chag shing bya zhing de'i tshad kyi glegs bu bya'o //
analyzed: chag shing bya zhing de'i tshad kyi glegs bu bya'o //
translated: “Make a cubit, and make a tablet of that measure.

original: glegs bu'i tshad kyi glegs bu phyed gcad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: glegs bu'i tshad kyi glegs bu phyed gcad par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Cut a tablet in half with the measure of the tablet.”

original: tshal bu dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshal bu dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni yang mnyam pa nyid du bya ba'o //
translated: The pieces are also, that is, they are to be made equal.🔽The measure of the two is the cubit, which is to be carried.🔽The measure of the two is the cubit, which is to be carried.

original: de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhal ba'i phyir tshal bu'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshad kyi chag shing bcad bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhal ba'i phyir tshal bu'i tshad kyi chag shing bcang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The measure of the pieces is the cubit, which is to be carried.

original: de'i che tshad ni sor bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i che tshad ni sor bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The measure of that is four finger breadths.

original: tshal bu de'i che tshad kyi zheng ni sor bzhir bya'o //
analyzed: tshal bu de'i che tshad kyi zheng ni sor bzhir bya'o //
translated: The width of that section should be four finger breadths.🔽Or one cubit of a crow.

original: bya rog gi mtho gang yang ngo zhes bya ba yang tshal bu de'i @185b che tshad kyi zheng ste /
analyzed: bya rog gi mtho gang yang ngo zhes bya ba yang tshal bu de'i @185b che tshad kyi zheng ste /
translated: The width of that section is also one cubit of a crow.

original: bya rog gi mtho zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo'i tshigs dbus ma'i steng du mthe bo'i tshigs dbus ma'i lto gtad de rgya gram du bya rkang 'dra bar gzhag ste /
analyzed: bya rog gi mtho zhes bya ba ni mdzub mo'i tshigs dbus ma'i steng du mthe bo'i tshigs dbus ma'i lto gtad de rgya gram du bya rkang 'dra bar gzhag ste /
translated: A crow cubit is when the middle joint of the thumb is placed on the middle joint of the index finger, and the two are placed in a cross-like position like a crow's foot.

original: de ltar gzhag pa'i mtheb mdzub gnyis kyi rtse mo'i bar gyi tshad ni bya rog gi mtho gang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhag pa'i mtheb mdzub gnyis kyi rtse mo'i bar gyi tshad ni bya rog gi mtho gang zhes bya'o //
translated: The measure between the tips of those two thumb and index fingers placed like that is called a crow cubit.

original: de la dngos su na sor bzhi kho na yod de /
analyzed: de la dngos su na sor bzhi kho na yod de /
translated: In reality, it is only four finger breadths.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so //🔽chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam phyed dang gsum mam mtheb sor gcig go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis bstan pa'i phyir de skad gsungs so // chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam phyed dang gsum mam mtheb sor gcig go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is stated like that in order to teach it in another way.🔽The small measure is two finger breadths, two and a half, or one thumb length.

original: tshal bu chung tshad kyi zhing ni sor gnyis sam sor phyed dang gsum mam mthe bo'i sor gcig go //
analyzed: tshal bu chung tshad kyi zhing ni sor gnyis sam sor phyed dang gsum mam mthe bo'i sor gcig go //
translated: The small measure field of a section is two finger breadths, two and a half, or one thumb length.

original: gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The large size is four fingerbreadths.

original: chung tshad ni sor phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: chung tshad ni sor phyed dang gsum mo //
translated: The small size is one and a half fingerbreadths.

original: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The medium size is between those.🔽Some texts say:

original: gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi 'am bya rog gi mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni che tshad ni sor bzhi 'am bya rog gi mtho gang ngo //
translated: The large size is four fingerbreadths or a crow’s height.

original: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam mthe bo'i lto gang ngo //
analyzed: chung tshad ni sor gnyis sam mthe bo'i lto gang ngo //
translated: The small size is two fingerbreadths or the palm of a thumb.

original: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring tshad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The medium size is between those.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the words here is as follows.

original: sor bzhi ni chos gos che tshad kyi'o //
analyzed: sor bzhi ni chos gos che tshad kyi'o //
translated: Four fingerbreadths is the large size of a Dharma robe.

original: sor gsum dang sor phyed dang sor gnyis dang mtheb sor gcig ni chos gos chung tshad kyi'o //
analyzed: sor gsum dang sor phyed dang sor gnyis dang mtheb sor gcig ni chos gos chung tshad kyi'o //
translated: One and a half fingerbreadths, two fingerbreadths, and one thumb’s breadth is the small size of a Dharma robe.

original: 'bring gi ni bar ma'o //🔽sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bring gi ni bar ma'o // sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The medium size is between those.

original: sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya ba'o //🔽de'i don du gtan pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa la chos gos gding bar mi bya ba'o // de'i don du gtan pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Do not spread out a Dharma robe on the ground” means do not spread out a Dharma robe on the ground.🔽“For that purpose, make a mat” means make a mat for the purpose of spreading out a Dharma robe.

original: chos gos gding ba de'i don du sra brkyang bya ba'o ;
analyzed: chos gos gding ba de'i don du sra brkyang bya ba'o ;
translated: “For that purpose, make a mat” means make a mat for the purpose of spreading out a Dharma robe.

original: / shing las byas pa'am smyig ma las byas pa'am gru bzhi btod pa'i phyir thag gu gzhug pa'i bu ga btod pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / shing las byas pa'am smyig ma las byas pa'am gru bzhi btod pa'i phyir thag gu gzhug pa'i bu ga btod pa ni de zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Made of wood means made of a piece of wood. Made of bamboo means made of a piece of bamboo. Made of a square piece of wood means made of a piece of wood that has been cut into a square shape. A hole for a string means a hole that has been made in order to insert a string.

original: thang bcad cing gding ba'i phyir thag gu gang yin pa de gzhug pa'i bu ga gang la btod pa de ni gtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thang bcad cing gding ba'i phyir thag gu gang yin pa de gzhug pa'i bu ga gang la btod pa de ni gtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A string is a cord that is used to spread out and sew together the pieces of cloth. A hole is the hole that is made in order to insert the string.

original: de'i tshad ji tsam du bya zhe na de'i phyir chos gos ji tsam par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i tshad ji tsam du bya zhe na de'i phyir chos gos ji tsam par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the size of the needle? The text states, The size of the robe.

original: chos gos dang 'tsham ba'i tshad du bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang 'tsham ba'i tshad du bya'o //
translated: The size of the needle should be in proportion to the size of the robe.

original: chos gos tshad tha dad pa du ma yod pas gtan pa yang du ma bya dgos so //
analyzed: chos gos tshad tha dad pa du ma yod pas gtan pa yang du ma bya dgos so //
translated: Since there are many different sizes of robes, the needle should be made in a variety of sizes.

original: gri'us bra'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos so //
analyzed: gri'us bra'o zhes bya ba ni chos gos so //
translated: The text states, The needle is for sewing the robe.

original: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gri'u de'o //
analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gri'u de'o //
translated: The needle is for sewing the robe. It should be kept means that the needle should be kept.

original: de dbyibs ji lta bur bya zhe na de'i phyir bya rog gi mchu lta bu 'am bya gag gi gshog pa lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dbyibs ji lta bur bya zhe na de'i phyir bya rog gi mchu lta bu 'am bya gag gi gshog pa lta bur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the shape of the needle? The text states, The shape of a crow's beak or a chicken's wing.

original: dbyibs de lta bur bya'o //
analyzed: dbyibs de lta bur bya'o //
translated: The needle should be made in that shape.

original: ci las byas pa zhen de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci las byas pa zhen de'i phyir /
translated: What is the implement made of?

original: lcags las byas pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lcags las byas pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is made of iron, not of anything else.

original: lcags las brdungs pa ni lcags las byas pa ste /
analyzed: lcags las brdungs pa ni lcags las byas pa ste /
translated: That which is beaten from iron is made of iron.

original: de las gzhan pa las mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las mi bya'o //
translated: It is not made of anything else.

original: yu brtsi can dang khra bo mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yu brtsi can dang khra bo mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not carry a knife with a handle or a variegated blade.

original: @186a * // gri'u'i yub bse rtsi can dang sra rtsi la sogs pa 'tshor bag can gyis bskus pa dar tshon ris dang 'bur shad la sogs pa'i ri mo can bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: @186a * // gri'u'i yub bse rtsi can dang sra rtsi la sogs pa 'tshor bag can gyis bskus pa dar tshon ris dang 'bur shad la sogs pa'i ri mo can bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not carry a knife with a handle made of ivory, horn, or bone, or with a blade smeared with poison, or with a variegated blade of silk, or with a blade that is sharp on one side only.

original: sor drug gi tshad las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor drug gi tshad las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not carry a knife that exceeds six fingerbreadths in length.

original: gri'u yi srid kyi tshad sor drug las lhag par mi bcang ba'o //
analyzed: gri'u yi srid kyi tshad sor drug las lhag par mi bcang ba'o //
translated: One should not carry a knife that exceeds six fingerbreadths in length.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gri'u ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gri'u ni gsum ste /
translated: Here the text states: “There are three types of knives:

original: chen po dang 'bring dang chud du'o //
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang chud du'o //
translated: large, medium, and small.

original: chen po ni sor drug go //
analyzed: chen po ni sor drug go //
translated: The large one is six fingerbreadths in length.

original: chung ngu ni sor bzhi'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni sor bzhi'o //
translated: The small one is four fingerbreadths in length.

original: de'i bar ni 'bring ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bar ni 'bring ngo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The medium one is in between these two.”

original: kha cig las ni brgyad las mi bcang ngo zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig las ni brgyad las mi bcang ngo zhes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some texts say, “Do not use a knife more than eight fingerbreadths long.”

original: gzhung kha cig las ni gri'u sor brgyad kyi tshad las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni gri'u sor brgyad kyi tshad las lhag pa mi bcang ngo zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Some texts say, “Do not use a knife more than eight fingerbreadths long.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni chen po ni sor brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chen po ni sor brgyad do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “The large knife is eight fingerbreadths long.”

original: sor bzhi pas thung ba ni dgos pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sor bzhi pas thung ba ni dgos pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A knife shorter than four fingerbreadths is useless.

original: de bas thung ba ni cir yang mi mkho bas de yang bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas thung ba ni cir yang mi mkho bas de yang bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: A knife shorter than that is useless, so it should not be used.

original: lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The hem of the robe should be sewn with a paste of clay.

original: chos gos sra brkyang la gri'us dras pa btsem pa'i gnas ni dngos su 'am brgyud pas rdul ldang ba med par bya ba'i phyir lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo //
analyzed: chos gos sra brkyang la gri'us dras pa btsem pa'i gnas ni dngos su 'am brgyud pas rdul ldang ba med par bya ba'i phyir lci ba'i byug pas bskus par btsem mo //
translated: The hem of the robe should be sewn with a paste of clay, either directly or indirectly, in order to prevent the robe from being damaged by dust.

original: 'di ni rdul gyis ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rdul gyis ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to prevent the robe from being damaged by dust.

original: lci ba med na chag chag btab cing phyags par ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lci ba med na chag chag btab cing phyags par ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no clay, the hem should be sewn with a paste of flour and water.

original: ba lang gi lci ba med na chus chag chag btab cing phyags mas phyags pa'i gnas su chos gos btsem mo //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba med na chus chag chag btab cing phyags mas phyags pa'i gnas su chos gos btsem mo //
translated: He should sew the robe there.

original: de btsem par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de btsem par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should sew it” means

original: dge slong gis chos gos de bcom du rung ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos de bcom du rung ba'o //
translated: that the monk should sew the robe in a place suitable for sewing.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing ngam smyig ma'i tshal bu gang yin pas chos gos dag btsem par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan las btsem par 'os pa btsem par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing ngam smyig ma'i tshal bu gang yin pas chos gos dag btsem par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / gzhan las btsem par 'os pa btsem par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: The text here says, “Monks, you should sew the robes with either a peacock’s tail feather or a bamboo sliver,” and, “You should sew the robe in a place suitable for sewing.”

original: khab kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khab kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: “He should also use a needle.”

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khab kyis kyang btsem du rung ba'o //
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khab kyis kyang btsem du rung ba'o //
translated: The word “also” means that he should not only use a peacock’s tail feather or a bamboo sliver, but he should also use a needle.

original: dra ba'i gzhung ni dge slong dag lag pa dag gis dra bar byed pa ni ma rung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dra ba'i gzhung ni dge slong dag lag pa dag gis dra bar byed pa ni ma rung bar gyur nas /
translated: The text on nets says, “Monks, it is not suitable to make nets with your hands.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: gri'us dra bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gri'us dra bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The needle should be put in a case.

original: khab kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bus chos gos 'tshem pa na /
analyzed: khab kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag bya gag gi gshog shing dang smyig ma'i tshal bus chos gos 'tshem pa na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: khab bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: de bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni khab de'o// @186b da gan dang zangs dang 'khar ba dang lcags las byas pa las gzhan pa mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: kha cig las zangs dang lcags rno ba dag las byas pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhung kha cig las khab ni rno zangs dang rno lcags las byas pa bcang ngo zhes 'byung ngo //

original: de ngo tsha med pa dang dge tshul dag la rag las par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ngo tsha med pa dang dge tshul dag la rag las par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: khab ral de dge slong ngo tsha med pa dang dge tshul dag la rag las par mi bya ba'o //

analyzed: gzhong pa 'jam por rang gis bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: chu bde bas so zhes bya ba ni /

translated: It is not too hot and not too cold. This is the method of cleaning the bowl.

original: lag pa gnyis kyis mthar gyis bsgyur zhing ngo zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis mthar gyis bsgyur zhing bkru bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis mthar gyis bsgyur zhing ngo zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis mthar gyis bsgyur zhing bkru bar bya ba'o //
translated: One should wash it by turning it over and over with both hands.

original: mi nus na rkang ba gnyis kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi nus na rkang ba gnyis kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is unable to do so, one should wash it with both feet.

original: gal te lag pa gnyis kyis mi nus na rkang pa gnyis kyis bkru bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te lag pa gnyis kyis mi nus na rkang pa gnyis kyis bkru bar bya ba'o //
translated: If one is unable to wash it with both hands, one should wash it with both feet.

original: de ltar khyim pas bkrur rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar khyim pas bkrur rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this way, a householder may wash it.

original: ji ltar rang gis bkru ba'i cho ga bstan pa de ltar khyim pas kyang bkrur rung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gis bkru ba'i cho ga bstan pa de ltar khyim pas kyang bkrur rung ba'o //
translated: A householder may wash it in the way that has been taught as the procedure for washing it oneself.

original: de'i gzhan du gyur par spyod pa bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i gzhan du gyur par spyod pa bsrung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should protect the householder from the other’s misconduct.

original: cho ga ji skad bstan pa las gzhan du khyim pa de'i log par spyod par dge slong gis bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: cho ga ji skad bstan pa las gzhan du khyim pa de'i log par spyod par dge slong gis bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: The monk should protect the householder from the other’s misconduct, which is different from the prescribed ritual.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan gyis lag pa gnyis kyis kyang mi nus la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan gyis lag pa gnyis kyis kyang mi nus la /
translated: Here the text says: “He is unable to do so with his two hands,

original: rkang pa gnyis kyis kyang mi nus nas /
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis kyis kyang mi nus nas /
translated: and he is unable to do so with his two feet.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: de dag gis zhal ta byas te gzhan gyis bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽phyag dar khrod legs par bkru ba dang btsems pa dag kha bsgyur ba bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis zhal ta byas te gzhan gyis bkru bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // phyag dar khrod legs par bkru ba dang btsems pa dag kha bsgyur ba bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They should do the service, and someone else should wash him.”🔽One should keep a rag from a charnel ground that is well washed, well sewn, and well dyed.

original: phyag dar khrod ni legs par bkrus pa dang / legs par @187b bcom pa dang / legs par kha bsgyur bar byas te bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod ni legs par bkrus pa dang / legs par @187b bcom pa dang / legs par kha bsgyur bar byas te bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep a rag from a charnel ground that is well washed, well sewn, and well dyed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis phyag dar khrod mi gtsang bas gos pa dag bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis phyag dar khrod mi gtsang bas gos pa dag bcang bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: Here the text says: “A monk should not keep rags from a charnel ground that are soiled with filth.”

original: gang 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'chang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phyag dar khrod pa dag legs par bkrus pa dang / legs par btsems pa dang / legs par kha bsgyur ba byas te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa dag legs par bkrus pa dang / legs par btsems pa dang / legs par kha bsgyur ba byas te bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should keep the refuse rag robes after washing them well, sewing them well, and dyeing them well.

original: mi gtsang bas gos pa'i chos gos mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: mi gtsang bas gos pa'i chos gos mi bcang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: One should not keep Dharma robes that are soiled by filth.

original: mod la legs par bkrus te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mod la legs par bkrus te bcang bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should wash them well immediately and then keep them.

original: tshon bzang ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir grib ma dang nyi ma 'dros par brdung zhing bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: tshon bzang ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir grib ma dang nyi ma 'dros par brdung zhing bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni /
translated: In order to make them have good color, one should beat them in the shade and dry them in the sun.

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi bslab pa'i gzhi las /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi bslab pa'i gzhi las /
translated: This is the text of the training precept on the analysis of the seat:

original: pib pa la'i tshon blangs te cham chom brdung bar bya zhing skams te bskol bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pib pa la'i tshon blangs te cham chom brdung bar bya zhing skams te bskol bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should take the color of the pippala tree, beat it, dry it, and boil it.

original: tshon brdung ba dang bskam pa dang grib ma dang nyi ma 'dres ma la gzhan du byas na nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshon brdung ba dang bskam pa dang grib ma dang nyi ma 'dres ma la gzhan du byas na nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one beats the color, dries it, and mixes it in the shade and the sun, it will be spoiled.

original: pib pa la zhes smos pa ni tshon gzhan gyi dpe yin no //
analyzed: pib pa la zhes smos pa ni tshon gzhan gyi dpe yin no //
translated: The phrase “in a dye” is an example of another color.

analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad par gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /

original: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni gsum pa'o zhes dang po la sogs par bskol ba'i tshon yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir snod kyi steng du yi ge bri'o //

original: gos kun nas bsubs pa la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos kun nas bsubs pa la'o zhes bya ba ni /

original: tshon legs par 'jen pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshon legs par 'jen pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make the dye well-spread,

analyzed: tshon gyis kun nas bsubs pa'i gos de la tshon dang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de las thun @188a * //
analyzed: de las thun @188a * //

analyzed: tshon bskol ba de las ji tsam gyis gos phangs par 'gyur ba'i thun de tsam bcu zhing gzhong bar blugs par bya'o //

original: gsher ches na 'dzag la /

analyzed: skams ches na gos 'dris par 'gyur bas de'i phyir thun ran par blugs so //

analyzed: gzar thag thang bcad pa nyid la skams na bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzar thag thang bcad cing brgyangs pa la skams na bzang ba'o //

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de'i phyir mtha' 'byar bas so zhes bya ba smas te /

analyzed: dbang bu dag gis so zhes bya ba smras so //

original: gzung dka' ba rnams ni rtsva bting bar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzung dka' ba rnams ni rtsva bting bar ro zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dbang bu dag gis gzung dka' ba'i gos rnams ni rtsva bting ba'i steng du bskam pa'o //

analyzed: tshon phyogs gcig tu mi 'tshigs par bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang bsgyur par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: tshon rnying pa ni gos rnying pa dag la blugs na bzang ba'o //

translated: In order to avoid familiarity, the water should be poured in on another day, as much as is needed to soak it. It should be soaked and dried.

analyzed: / tshon zhag lon na sra bar 'gyur la sra bar gyur na chu'i thun gyis kyang rtol bar nus so //

analyzed: bang rim dang 'chag sar tshon gyi las mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /

translated: refers to

original: gser skud ces bya ba ni gser las byas pa'i lu gu rgyud do //
analyzed: gser skud ces bya ba ni gser las byas pa'i lu gu rgyud do //
translated: The “golden thread” is a chain made of gold.

original: de dag ni rgyan ma yin pa ma yin te rgyan kho na yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyan ma yin pa ma yin te rgyan kho na yin no //
translated: These are not ornaments, but are themselves ornaments.

original: rgyan thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes smos pas de dag bkag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan thogs pa bsten par mi bya'o zhes smos pas de dag bkag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are prohibited by the statement, “One should not wear ornaments.”

original: khra bor byas pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khra bor byas pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The same applies to variegated colors.

original: za 'og dang tshon ris dang skud ris dang phra bkod pa la sogs pas khra bor byas pa'i gos kyang rgyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: za 'og dang tshon ris dang skud ris dang phra bkod pa la sogs pas khra bor byas pa'i gos kyang rgyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: Variegated colors are like ornaments, because they are made of silk, or are dyed, or are woven with pictures, or are embroidered.

original: mdo 'di ni gos kyi don du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni gos kyi don du byas pa yin no //
translated: This sūtra was composed for the sake of the robes.

original: rtsva las byas pa dang shing las byas pa dang gzhan yang rgyan gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsva las byas pa dang shing las byas pa dang gzhan yang rgyan gyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the category of ornaments.

original: gzhi ma bting ba'i sar chos gos gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi ma bting ba'i sar chos gos gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not place one’s Dharma robes on the ground without a covering.

original: ras sam lo ma la sogs pa gzhi ma bting ba'i sa la chos gos gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: ras sam lo ma la sogs pa gzhi ma bting ba'i sa la chos gos gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not place one’s Dharma robes on the ground without a covering of cloth, leaves, and so forth.

original: de ni ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is to prevent damage.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi bslab pa'i gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa'i stan gyi bslab pa'i gzhi las /
translated: Here is the text from the training precept on the analysis of seats:

original: dge slong rnams chos gos dag gyon tes la 'khod pa na chos gos dag ma rung bar gyur ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams chos gos dag gyon tes la 'khod pa na chos gos dag ma rung bar gyur ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When the monks were sitting wearing their Dharma robes, their robes were damaged. The Blessed One said,

original: dad pa sbyin par bya ba chud gzan par mi bya bar 'di ltar stan nang tshangs can la 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa sbyin par bya ba chud gzan par mi bya bar 'di ltar stan nang tshangs can la 'dug par bya'o //
translated: “Do not waste the offerings of the faithful. Sit on a seat with a lining.”

original: stan nang tshangs can ji lta bu mi shes nas /
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can ji lta bu mi shes nas /
translated: Not knowing what a seat with a lining was,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,🔽“A seat with a lining is a seat with a cloth lining.

original: rtsva'i chun po bcings te ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsva'i chun po bcings te ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He should bind it with a bundle of straw and wrap it in cloth.

original: 'dir stan nang tshangs can ni dpe tsam @189b du zad de stan gzhan la yang 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir stan nang tshangs can ni dpe tsam @189b du zad de stan gzhan la yang 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Here, a couch with legs is merely an example; one should sit on another kind of couch as well.

original: 'di ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to avoid damaging the robes.

original: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i phyogs su mi gzhag go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not place it in an unclean place.

original: chos gos de bar du chod par gyur kyang mi gzhag go //
analyzed: chos gos de bar du chod par gyur kyang mi gzhag go //
translated: One should not place the robe in a place that is obstructed.

original: rtul ba yod na khur lci pas mi mnan no zhes bya ba ni /🔽rtul ba gzhan yod na khur lci bas chos gos mnan par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtul ba yod na khur lci pas mi mnan no zhes bya ba ni / rtul ba gzhan yod na khur lci bas chos gos mnan par mi bya ba'o //
translated: If one has the strength, one should not press down on it with a heavy load.🔽If one has the strength, one should not press down on the robe with a heavy load.🔽One should not use it by wearing it in a different way.

original: gzhan du spyad pas yongs su spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya bstod du bgo ba smad du bgo ba dang smad du bgo ba steng du bgo ba yongs su spyad par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du spyad pas yongs su spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya bstod du bgo ba smad du bgo ba dang smad du bgo ba steng du bgo ba yongs su spyad par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not use it by wearing it in a different way, such as wearing the upper robe as the lower robe or the lower robe as the upper robe.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba bya ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba bya ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo ba bsten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear the upper robe when defecating, urinating, or cleaning oneself.

original: bshang ba dang gci ba bya ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba bya ba dang mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu bla gos bgo bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wear the upper robe when defecating, urinating, or cleaning oneself.

original: mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i byi dor bya ba dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “When cleaning oneself” means

original: mi gtsang ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa gtsug lag khang du chag chag gdab pa dang phyag dar bya ba dang rkang pa bkru ba dang / chab kung sa phyags pa dang bkru bshal bya ba la sogs pa'i byi dor gyi las dag ste /🔽de dag tu bla gos bgo bar mi bya ba'o //🔽der nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i ngo bo nyid gang dag yin pa gtsug lag khang du chag chag gdab pa dang phyag dar bya ba dang rkang pa bkru ba dang / chab kung sa phyags pa dang bkru bshal bya ba la sogs pa'i byi dor gyi las dag ste / de dag tu bla gos bgo bar mi bya ba'o // der nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: when cleaning the temple, such as sprinkling it with water, sweeping it, washing the feet, washing the water pots, washing the floors, and so on.🔽One should not wear the upper robe when doing these things.🔽One should not sleep on it.

original: bla gos de'i steng du nyal bar mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla gos de'i steng du nyal bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not sleep on the upper robe.

original: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba dang / mchod ston dang mchod rten la phyag bya ba dang rjes bya ba dang dge 'dun tshogs pa dang gdams dag dang chos mnyan pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba dang / mchod ston dang mchod rten la phyag bya ba dang rjes bya ba dang dge 'dun tshogs pa dang gdams dag dang chos mnyan pa nyams su myong ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not put on the patched robe for activities other than experiencing alms-gathering, worshipping stūpas, performing circumambulation, gathering in the saṅgha, receiving instructions, and listening to the dharma.

original: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya ba'o /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la rgyu ba la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya ba las gzhan pa'i bya ba la snam sbyar bgo bar mi bya ba'o /
translated: One should not put on the patched robe for activities other than experiencing alms-gathering and so forth.

original: de la 'dug pa'am nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dug pa'am nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not sit or lie down on it.

original: snam sbyar de'i steng du 'dug pa dang nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: snam sbyar de'i steng du 'dug pa dang nyal bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not sit or lie down on the patched robe.

original: des na gva brdzi ba yang bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gva brdzi ba yang bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is also prohibited to sit on it and so forth.

original: gzhung ni snam sbyar lus la reg par mi bya /
analyzed: gzhung ni snam sbyar lus la reg par mi bya /
translated: The text says: “One should not touch the patched robe with the body.

original: gding bar mi bya /
analyzed: gding bar mi bya /
translated: One should not sit on it.

original: rgyun du bgo bas longs spyad par mi bya /🔽snam sbyar gyi steng du 'dug par mi bya /
analyzed: rgyun du bgo bas longs spyad par mi bya / snam sbyar gyi steng du 'dug par mi bya /
translated: One should not use it by wearing it all the time.

original: nyal bar mi bya /
analyzed: nyal bar mi bya /
translated: One should not sit or lie down on the patched robe.

original: snam sbyar gyis rtsva'am lci ba'am sa bskur bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snam sbyar gyis rtsva'am lci ba'am sa bskur bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not use the outer robe to carry grass, mud, or earth.

original: 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽snam sbyar gyis dngos po 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar bar mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / snam sbyar gyis dngos po 'ga' yang bskur ba la sbyar bar mi bya ba ste /
translated: One should not use it to carry anything.🔽One should not use the outer robe to carry anything.

original: snam sbyar gyi nang du ci yang bcug ste bskur bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snam sbyar gyi nang du ci yang bcug ste bskur bar mi bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not carry anything inside the outer robe.

original: lus la reg par bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus la reg par bgo bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear it touching the body.

original: snam sbyar lus la reg par bgo bar mi @190a * //🔽bya'o ; / mtshan khung g-yas pa'i drod kyis de ma rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar lus la reg par bgo bar mi @190a * // bya'o ; / mtshan khung g-yas pa'i drod kyis de ma rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not wear the outer robe touching the body.🔽The heat of the right armpit would spoil it.

original: mchan khung g-yas pa'i drod ces bya ba mchan khung g-yas pa'i rdul gyis snam sbyar de ma rung par 'gyur srid pa'o //
analyzed: mchan khung g-yas pa'i drod ces bya ba mchan khung g-yas pa'i rdul gyis snam sbyar de ma rung par 'gyur srid pa'o //
translated: The heat of the right armpit means that the outer robe could be spoiled by the sweat of the right armpit.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir phyogs der de la gos glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir phyogs der de la gos glan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to prevent that, one should wear a cloth over that place.

original: ma rung ba de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mchan khung g-yas pa'i phyogs der snam sbyar de la gos glan par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rung ba de ltar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir mchan khung g-yas pa'i phyogs der snam sbyar de la gos glan par bya'o //
translated: In order to prevent that unsuitable thing, he should fasten that upper robe to the left side of his armpit.

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir khru phyed dang do dang mtho gang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is its size? Therefore it is said, “half an armspan and one full armspan in length.”

original: de'i tshad ni srid du khru phyed do //🔽zheng du mtho gang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshad ni srid du khru phyed do // zheng du mtho gang ngo //
translated: Its size is half an armspan in width.🔽It is one full armspan in length.

original: ngos gnyis kar skud pa'i gzungs kyis sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ngos gnyis kar skud pa'i gzungs kyis sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is fastened with a string on both sides.

original: gos de ngos gnyis kar khab srungs kyi skud pa'i gzungs kyis mdo mdor gzungs gdab cing sbyar bar bya'i /
analyzed: gos de ngos gnyis kar khab srungs kyi skud pa'i gzungs kyis mdo mdor gzungs gdab cing sbyar bar bya'i /
translated: That cloth is fastened with a string of thread on both sides, with a string on each side.

original: dngos su bcom par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos su bcom par ni mi bya'o //
translated: It is not to be torn apart.

original: dus dus su de bkru ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos de'o //🔽de'i de ni btsag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus dus su de bkru ba dang kha bsgyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gos de'o // de'i de ni btsag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From time to time it is to be washed and dyed.🔽That is its purification.

original: gos de'i kha bsgyur ba de ni btsag gis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gos de'i kha bsgyur ba de ni btsag gis rig par bya'o //
translated: That is to be known as its purification.

original: gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gdong phyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: A face-cloth is to be carried.

original: gdong phyis ni ras phyis la sogs pa dag gi dpe yin no //
analyzed: gdong phyis ni ras phyis la sogs pa dag gi dpe yin no //
translated: The cloth is a metaphor for the cloth of the face, and so on.

original: lus 'dzag pas rnag gzan no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus 'dzag pas rnag gzan no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body is a wound, a sore.

original: bcad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcad par bya ba ste /
translated: It is to be cut away.
